Develop and present executive level briefings to organizational leadership team
Provide technical advice, guidance, and recommendations to advance the program objectives
Develop and update mandatory training modules
Manage, track, and update catalog of document types
Privacy
Develop, review, and maintain privacy policies and standard operating procedures to ensure it complies with federal mandates, NIST guidance, FISMA requirements, and Commission policies.
Develop, review, and maintain Privacy Threshold Assessments (PTAs) for all applicable Commission utilized systems.
Develop, review, and maintain Privacy Impact Assessments (PIAs) for all applicable Commission utilized systems.
Provide ad-hoc support such as preparing responses to OMB information requests, data calls, and requests from other entities as required.
Provide support in developing and reviewing System of Record Notices (SORN) for all applicable systems.
Support the annual FISMA audit by developing, reviewing, and preparing responses for the Senior Agency Official for Privacy section within the DHS CyberScope application.
Develop, review, and implement a process to support the reduction of unnecessary use of Social Security Numbers (SSNs) and Personally Identifiable Information (PII).
Develop, maintain, and update privacy content on webpages and privacy training to ensure Commission employees understand their responsibilities required by federal mandates.
Provide Privacy Incident Response support for all identified incidents including but not limited to drafting communication emails, drafting responses to federal entities, and drafting notification letters to impacted staff.
Support the implementation of new privacy security tools as deemed appropriate.

3-year of related experience (compliance, information security, requirements analysis, business analysis)
Bachelor's degree

Experience in managing enterprise data, or sensitive data
Excellent capability in development of executive briefings, strategic recommendations, and roadmaps

TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance.

TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR.

JOB SUMMARY/OVERVIEW
The Benefits Informatics Analyst is responsible for developing and interpreting medical and clinical data to provide business and financial advice to TriNet’s senior leadership team. The position utilizes medical data repositories to analyze and pinpoint cost drivers, healthcare trends, develop KPI’s and utilizations. This position will be responsible for gathering data from a variety of sources, compiling results and reporting on findings to senior management. The ability to analyze data and provide recommendations is critical.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES
• Proficiency creating queries using a variety of database applications, primarily from the Truven Healthcare Analytics database.
• Independently design and analyze adhoc requests. Articulate and communicate findings of healthcare trend and drivers to senior leadership thru data visualization or other tools with minimal direction.
• Performs business analysis, eliciting, analyzing, specifying, and managing reporting needs at a high-level of competency.
• Proactively identify and resolve data discrepancies.
• Support quarterly analysis and recommendations for client re-pricing actions; producing, evaluating and providing pertinent feedback to colleagues on utilizations and KPHIs using the healthcare database.
• Expertise conducting data analysis using basic skills in statistics and database management.
• Comprehensive understanding of all fields within the healthcare analytics database to create and analyze monthly and ad-hoc reports as requested.
• Convert data into functional formats, reconcile and identify data anomalies.
• Thorough understanding of PeopleSoft, SalesForce, HR Passport, and healthcare analytics database.
• Compile claims and premium information, summarize results and provide insight to analysts and management.
• Identify and implement process improvements to existing procedures.
• Maintain relationships with carrier and vendor contacts to help with data interpretation and resolution of data integrity issues.
• Manage deliverables to meet time and resource budgets for prompt delivery.
• Train prepare and mentor Associate and Sr Associate colleagues.
• Capable of evaluating a variety of adhoc analytics, providing pertinent feedback to colleagues.
• Other projects and responsibilities may be added at the manager’s discretion.

JOB REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS
Education: BA/BS degree in finance, economics, math or other business-related areas having strong quantitative and analytical analysis or equivalent combination of education and experience desired

Experience:
• 3-5 years’ experience in healthcare analytics, and/or insurance with prior client facing responsibilities
• 3-5 years in healthcare administration or related field.

Other Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office, with an advanced proficiency in Excel, including SUM/IF, VLOOKUPS, arrays, conditional formatting, pivot tables, and dashboards.
• Proficiency in PeopleSoft, Oracle, MS Access, MS Visio, MS PowerPoint, Truven, MS Project Management
• Demonstrate logical reasoning, critical thinking and problem-solving skills to identify, analyze, evaluate and interpret information
• Extensive knowledge of medical utilization data
• Outstanding financial and problem-solving skills
• Report writing, data mining and analytical interpretation
• Navigate various databases, understand the schema, meaning of various table and column definitions
• Proficiency with Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) tools such as Tableau
• Exceptional presentation and facilitation skills
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Ability to communicate with employees at all levels of the organization
• Proven project management experience
• Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
• Excellent interpersonal skills
• Ability to adapt to a fast paced continually changing business and work environment while managing multiple priorities
• A demonstrated commitment to high professional ethical standards and a diverse workplace

WORK ENVIRONMENT/OTHER INFORMATION (Travel required, physical requirements, on-call schedules, etc.)
• Travel may be required once a quarter
• Work in clean, pleasant, and comfortable office setting
• Ability to be on-call for time-sensitive deadlines and meetings

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst, Sales and Service
Job Description:
Curriculum Associates is seeking a highly-qualified Senior Business Analyst to serve as a member of the Business Systems team within the Information Technology department. The Senior Business Analyst will act as an intermediary between the business partners and the IT team, and responsible for collecting, clarifying, and documenting business requirements. The Senior Business Analyst will also act as an active thought partner and Salesforce application visionary who shapes business demand for technology.

Why join this team:

Our organization is currently in a transformational phase due to our growth and changing industry; therefore, candidates with experience guiding organizations through this process are highly desired.

The impact you’ll have:
Work with business partners to elicit and capture business needs; understand the customer journey and define detailed user requirements to enhance the design and development of our Salesforce platform.
Engage with business partners and influence project decisions; assess the risks of various solutions and prioritize competing business demands.
Act as an intermediary between business and IT by using a deep understanding of business processes and technology to help business partners achieve their desired outcomes.
Responsible for working with the IT project management team to prioritize these changes and define project scope.
Facilitate requirements gathering sessions and document current and future state processes by creating functional specification documents, process flows, etc.
Builds testing plans, scenarios, and scripts to support QA efforts; actively participates in unit and system tests while coordinates user acceptance testing.
Responsible for developing the governance process and change control management by using best practices for prioritization, requirements gathering, QA, UAT and end user training.

Summary

The Senior Business Intelligence Engineer will design, administer and maintain the CoverMyMeds BI Infrastructure, ensuring scalability, security, and availability of one of our most important technologies. This person will be part of our Data Solutions and Strategy team, which is comprised of four strategically focused teams that deliver data solutions and capabilities across the company. They will collaborate with many different business partners at CMM, including analytics, technology and business end-users to ensure that our BI platform meets the needs of our customers.

What youll do
Youll have responsibility for designing and maintaining internal and external facing BI toolsets. These may be third-party solutions, embedded products and in-house developed solutions.
You will work closely with our Security and Technology teams to ensure that BI solutions are highly resilient and secure.
You will monitor our vendor offerings and collaborate with analysts to ensure we are leveraging new features and functions as they become available.
You will work closely with the Solutions, Capabilities teams to ensure our BI solutions utilize the most accurate, governed and purpose-build data sources.
You will collaborate with the DBAs and Data Developers on data modeling and design, ETL, data marts and other data store best practices.
You will support collaborative efforts across the company by facilitating teams of stakeholders on topics around data-viz design, Tableau Blueprint or equivalent, and industry trends in business intelligence.
About you

This role requires someone who thrives in a collaborative team-centered environment and welcomes a fast-paced environment and interacting with many stakeholders. You should have a proven track record as a self-starter who can rally individuals across teams to realize a shared vision.

Our ideal candidate also possesses the following qualifications:
3-5 years managing complex internal and external facing BI solutions
3 years of supporting BI technology on Windows platforms, including server-side configuration and web services.
1+ year experience with UNIX/LINIX
3 years experience with Tableau and Tableau Server Administration
1-2 years experience with Tableau dashboard development
SaaS and PaaS experience a plus
Microsoft Azure experience a plus
Experience with other BI platforms (Domo, Sisense etc.) a plus
About Us

CoverMyMeds is one of the fastest growing healthcare technology companies in the US and consistently honored as one of the best places to work in the country. Our mission: Help patients get the medications they need to live healthy lives. Our solutions seamlessly connect the health care network to improve medication access, increasing speed to therapy and reducing prescription abandonment for patients like you and me.

We know our culture is special because our employees tell us that time and time again. We're all driven by our mission and passionate about making CoverMyMeds the best place to work and grow, whatever that means to you. We want you to come here to be yourself, embrace challenges and achieve meaningful results. (The on-site lunch, paid benefits and flexibility are icing on the cake!)

Want to learn more? Were flattered. Check out: https://www.covermymeds.com/main/careers/.

Job Description:
Job Description

Join CACI as a Business Systems Analyst supporting financial management and contract writing systems that help our Department of Defense customers execute work to support our country. We have been supporting our customers for over 20 years with the implementation of COTS financial management and acquisition systems. We continue to develop and implement exciting and complex solutions to support the evolving needs of our customers. We are looking for an experienced, resourceful Business Systems Analyst with the desire to be a critical member of our team designing creative new solutions for our customers and managing customer relationships. We value team members who strive to produce high quality work through collaboration with team members and customers while making a difference through individual contributions to ensure project success for our team and our customers. Under minimal supervision, you will work as a member of the Functional Implementation Team, working closely with the customer to gather requirements and configure the system to support the implementation of Momentum Acquisitions as a Government Organizations contract writing system. You will also perform critical system testing to ensure application functionality works correctly and meets the customers' needs.

What Youll Get to Do:
· Coordinate and conduct customer work sessions to gather and document requirements.

· Configure Momentum system settings based on customer requirements.

· Translate business requirements into test scripts; execute tests against developed systems, and document results.

· Troubleshoot to determine the source of system errors.

· Find and log system defects using software tools, including steps required to repeat, and track defects to closure.

· Work independently with minimal guidance from more senior subject matter experts.

· Develop subject matter expertise for assigned components.

Youll Bring These Qualifications:
· US Citizen with a current Top Secret or TS/SCI clearance.

· Bachelor's degree and 5 years of experience using IT systems related to Finance, Accounting and/or Acquisitions.

· Experience with IT systems functional analysis, requirements design, test development, and test execution.

These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have:
· Experience with Financial Management and/or Acquisition Systems or Business Applications.

· Experience with CGI Momentum software.

· Familiarity with configuration of Momentum subsystems, specifically Momentum Acquisitions.

· Familiarity Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) and/or Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation (DFAR) requirements.

· Self-starter with initiative and aptitude to quickly learn and put new skills to use.

· Strong written and oral communications skills.

· Ability to work both independently and with a team to solve problems.

· Ability to write and execute SQL queries.

· Ability and initiative to set goals and execute.

What We Can Offer You:
Weve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post.
Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.
We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.
We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nations highest priorities.
For over 55 years, the principles of CACIs unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success.

Job Location

US-Reston-VA-VIRGINIA SUBURBAN

CACI employs a diverse range of talent to create an environment that fuels innovation and fosters continuous improvement and success. At CACI, you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. CACI is proud to provide dynamic careers for employees worldwide. CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Job Description:
Primary Purpose

Manage the grants application and data verification process for Sempra Energy and the Sempra Energy Foundation along with the related companywide data collection process that allows for sophisticated reporting on enterprise-wide community investments. Aggregate grants data for use in public reporting on social impact. Develop company responses to philanthropic and social impact surveys and awards applications related to corporate citizenship and philanthropy. Support external relations' stakeholder engagement efforts and related outputs from key alliances and executive service on key nonprofit boards at the federal, state and local level.

Duties and Responsibilities
Manage the online grants application process, verification with the IRS and other public databases as well as internal anti-bribery and anti-corruption clearances for Sempra Energy and the Sempra Energy Foundation, interfacing with grant applicants and providing technical support, as needed. Coordinate with the operating companies on their online grant applications to assure consistency in approach and ability to aggregate results for public reporting. Obtain results from grantees, analyze outputs, outcomes, impacts and report on results.
Manage and execute an annual philanthropy and community investment data collection process, keeping track of survey and internal reporting deadlines, data integrity and meet Sempra's impact reporting obligations for the annual sustainability report and annual citizenship surveys and awards deadlines.
Develop and move to more sophisticated multi-tiered grant applications over time, allowing Sempra and its operating companies to achieve more granular impact results that we can leverage internally and externally. Maintain awareness of citizenship trends and impact measurement, developing and implementing a continuous improvement process to ensure ongoing relevancy.
Support external involvement initiatives with partnership fulfillment, providing advertisements, logos, social media information and event support, as needed.
Performs other duties as assigned including benchmarking analyses; vendor assessment; Power point presentations and participation in philanthropic webinars. (no more than 5% of duties).

Bachelor's Degree Business, external affairs, philanthropy, public relations, information technology, or a related field required.

Ability to gather, understand, organize and manage corporate citizenship-related data.
Aptitude in completing a range of surveys relating to corporate citizenship that drive company's external positioning and result in corporate awards and related publicity.

Ability to accept responsibility and work independently; must be able to plan, analyze, organize, control and coordinate multiple projects, often under tight time constraints.

Job Description:
Industry Overview
US News & World Report ranks the Financial Industry as the #6 Best Career and one of the highest paying in the country with average compensation close to 100K.The financial industry is deemed by the government as “Essential” So while a lot of industries are furloughing and laying off people during this pandemic, we are actually expanding.
Company Overview
One of the largest marketers of financial products in North America with a very different approach to the business. Our agents and advisors are more teachers than salespeople. We focus on financial education for our customers rather than sales tactics. This unique approach is just one reason why we have the #1 investment office in Mississippi with our company.
Financial Analyst-Remote
Part-time opportunity available to join one of the fastest growing industries in the country. We offer an excellent educational system to teach you our business, a comprehensive support network and attractive compensation packages. This position is remote, but you will have access to meeting and conference rooms from multiple office locations in the area.
Job Responsibilities/Requirements
Financial Analysts will first get their State licenses. Then if they wish, they could get their federal series 6 and series 63 Financial Advisor license. These licenses costs around a $1,000 to $1,200 and fully funded by the company. Your study program can be developed according to your preference. Either online, classroom or a mixture of both.
Once licensed, you will be working with families and individuals to help them get out of debt, properly protected and financially independent.
Typical part time monthly compensation for a 10-15-hour work week is around $1,000 to $2,000.
Compensation consists of study bonuses, commissions, incentives and corporate bonuses.
Work Experience/Skills
Requires good oral and written communication.
Shown a pattern of success in a variety of roles/positions.
A proven self-starter with little supervision needed.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
Track record of teaching, educating or training others is a plus.
Education
College degree preferred.
No financial experience required. We teach you our financial education approach to the business.
Type
Part-time
However could develop into full-time based on the individuals learning curve and career goals.
Location
Jackson MS and surrounding area.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:(A function is essential if: it is required to be performed– removing the function would fundamentally alter the position; the duties are fundamental, not marginal).
Plan, facilitate and manage business process improvement initiatives using lean and/or six sigma methodologies.
Evaluate business workflows, documentation and systems to identify business needs for efficiencies and continuous improvement.
Assist CL Managers in prioritization of improvement opportunities and identified projects in expense management.
Identify, research, resolve, and communicate production problems and other system issues and their impacted areas in Commercial Lines
Lead value stream and business process mapping workshops with management and associates from all Grange business units to identify improvement opportunities.
Lead process improvement reviews, root cause analyses and metric/KPI reviews to assist business units in identifying and prioritizing continuous improvement efforts, process design, or engineering.
Formulate implementation plans on identified business improvement opportunities and assist process champions, business subject matter experts, and business partners, in guiding changes through implementation.
Assist business units in implementation plans, identification of metrics to define success and establish visual management and visual controls. Improve sustainability of improvement with the development of post-implementation controls.
Build facilitation guidelines and best practices for the Grange environment as we facilitate an increasing number of mapping and improvement workshops.
Provide templates, tools and the necessary knowledge transfer to members of Grange business units to propagate a sustainable continuous improvement methodology throughout the company.
Assist with testing as needed with implementations of emerging technology.
Ensure confidentiality of all sensitive information
PLACEMENT CRITERIA:

College degree or 2 years of equivalent work experience performing similar functions as outlined above with additional insurance related coursework or designations preferred. Highly motivated, result-oriented, and possess the ability to handle multiple tasks with multiple deadlines concurrently with minimal supervision. Preferred knowledge and understanding of Commercial Lines operations. Capable of learning new systems and using same in practice. Must possess excellent communication skills (oral and written), data entry and organizational skills, and the ability to complete multiple tasks within established deadlines. Must handle confidential information in a professional manner. Preferred experience in process engineering, process design, or Lean Six Sigma with demonstrated experience and documentation of project work showing efficiency gains and savings for organizations. Ability to understand, analyze and arrange data and metrics into concise and meaningful communications and presentations. Strong preference toward a demonstrated proficiency in Excel and SharePoint skills.

Position: Business Analyst (IT)

Location: Kennesaw, GA

Duration: Full Time

Salary: $70,000-$80,000/yr. (Commensurate with experience)

Objective:

Jasper, INC. is seeking a Business Analyst that will serve as the liaison between the executive team and the information technology team. This person will be responsible for eliciting, analyzing, validating, specifying, and verifying the business needs of the project stakeholders, including customers and end-users. The successful candidate will work closely with business units, subject matter experts, and technical resources to identify business needs, define projects, develop requirements and manage the development effort to completion.

Job Duties:
Lead requirements analysis, validation, and verification, ensuring that requirement statements are complete, consistent, concise, feasible, and verifiable.
Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, surveys, business process descriptions, uses cases, scenarios, business analysis, competitive project analysis, task, and workflow analysis, and/or requirement workshops.
Communicate (verbally and in writing) with business units that rely on information to define system requirements or organizational processes.
Collect and analyze the project's business requirements and transfer the same knowledge to the information technology team.
Work with the Systems Architect, ensuring business requirements are verified, validated, and delivered.
Ensures end users and IT support teams are fully trained to use, support, and maintain the application/solution.
Provides project management support.
Run an Agile scrum team for multiple projects simultaneously.
Competencies:
Project management skills; comfortable managing multiple initiatives
Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
Detail-oriented, self-organized, and committed to quality
Excellent time management skills
Business analysis skills
Demonstrated understanding of Salesforce product
Demonstrated understanding of value-driven business results and metrics


Benefits:
100% paid healthcare insurance premiums for employees and for their legal dependents at 90 days of continuous employment
Paid time off
Samsung company phone
Company laptop
Weekly pay
Benefits OR Student Loan Assistance for full-time employees
Requirements:
3 + years Salesforce administration experience
Experience gathering requirements for Salesforce Clouds
JIRA setup experience / JIRA and Confluence
An understanding of SQL and database relational models
BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems and/or equivalent formal training or experience
Adept at working independently while staying in sync with team members and stakeholders
Must be able to pass an extensive background screening, drug screening, and have a valid Driver’s License
Must have reliable transportation to and from work
JasperINC. is a drug-free workplace.

Job Title: Senior Medical Economics Analyst - Contract Modeling Exp A Plus!
Job Description:
About Fallon Health
Founded in 1977, Fallon Health is a leading health care services organization that supports the diverse and changing needs of those we serve. In addition to offering innovative health insurance solutions and a variety of Medicaid and Medicare products, we excel in creating unique health care programs and services that provide coordinated, integrated care for seniors and individuals with complex health needs. Fallon has consistently ranked among the nation’s top health plans, and is accredited by the National Committee for Quality Assurance for its HMO, Medicare Advantage and Medicaid products. For more information, visit fallonhealth.org.
Brief Summary of Purpose: The Medical Economics Senior Analyst will partner with the Manager, Medical Economics as a subject matter expert in data and analysis, demonstrating an in-depth understanding of financial, clinical, and other business data. The position works directly with operational leadership in the design and development of analytical capabilities, reports, and dashboards needed for short and long-term decision-making to achieve success in managing care. This individual provides complex ad hoc analysis and reporting as directed by management to include the evaluation of financial, operational, clinical and general business programs and processes. The Senior Analyst is responsible for data quality and data integrity as they relate to reporting and analytical activities.

Analysis, Decision Support and Business Intelligence
Provide actionable analyses and reports that help monitor performance and drive decision making to reduce total medical expense and utilization
Assist in designing initiatives to impact cost drivers, including measurement and monitoring of initiatives. Identify the cost drivers, quantify variances, formulate and propose strategies and communicate the outcomes to customer, business owners and senior management
Evaluate the impact of current vs. proposed financial arrangements with providers; compare payment terms against Medicare and Medicaid reimbursement methodologies
Perform cost and utilization trend analyses at the provider, PHO, employer or other group variation.
Measure actual performance against benchmarks or targets
Provide advanced analytical and reporting support to customers on various projects
Leads or assists in process improvement and special projects
Regulatory & Clinical Model Design and Support
Provide support for regulatory reporting; analyze specifications to develop accurate responses or summaries for timely submissions
Provide analytical support for clinical initiatives including development, evaluation and ROI analyses
Evaluate the effectiveness of clinical initiatives in improving patient outcomes and reducing health care costs
Ad-Hoc Support
Provide support for ad-hoc (i.e. one time) requests that require clinical, financial, regulatory, pharmacy and operational analysis and reporting.
Prepare reports and supporting analysis for internal and external customers focused on reducing costs and utilization and enhancing healthcare system efficiency.
Act as a resource for other members of the department on business issues.
As a subject matter expert, train and guide other associates in the department in data understanding and analytical processes.

Education
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance or Public Health required
Experience
Minimum of 5 years of financial or analytical experience. Healthcare experience highly preferred.
Experience with data analysis, interpretation and reporting of clinical and financial data
Experience with Microsoft Excel, ACCESS, SSMS or SQL
Ability to design, evaluate and interpret complex data sets
Knowledge of managed care and health care claims
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Fallon Health provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

What We Do:
Alluma is a non-profit on a bold mission: to remove the barriers between people and the services and support that matter most. We are policy experts and technologists, determined leaders and compassionate innovators, united by our desire to do whatever it takes to solve complex problems in access to health and social services. We create technology solutions that put people first.

How We Work:
Alluma employees dig deep into how our clients work and the challenges faced by the people they serve, so we can streamline complicated processes and design smart solutions that work better for everyone. At Alluma, every employee has a role in ensuring that nobody falls through the cracks. We put people and their unique needs at the center of what we do. Each client we work with is different, and each community they aim to serve unique, so our technology must flex to each opportunity.

Position: The Business System Analyst, Enterprise Collaboration is responsible for digital collaboration technologies utilized throughout the organization. This role suits someone with technical and management experience as well as a desire to constantly find new ways of improving how things are done, someone who can leverage the tools as well as look outside the box and incorporate new ways of doing business. This person will partner with Operations and Service Delivery, Strategy and Innovation teams and related functional stakeholders to build and enhance the capability and user experience across collaboration technologies. The role will define the collaboration and productivity technical roadmap structure and ensure alignment with overall industry trends. This position will also assist functional teams in the configuration and integration of collaboration and productivity tools to support or implement simple business processes and workflows.

Essential Functions& Summary of Responsibilities:
· Define and establish technical road map across communication technologies
· Drive continual improvement of the firm’s Office 365 systems and tools, working closely with internal teams to facilitate increased adoption, knowledge and configuration-to-task.
· Support integrating enterprise collaboration environments to cloud services such as AD, SharePoint, OneDrive, Office,& Exchange Online
· Rationalize underlying technologies and pivot to enterprise standard and optimize for enhanced user experience and financial spend
· Manage and maintain partner vendor relationship and governance. Keep abreast of industry trends and drive ongoing partner engagement
· Develop and drive adoption of standardized operating paradigm with appropriate Standard operating procedures, checklists and knowledge base documentation
· Intermediate to advanced scripting to support cloud collaboration applications, services, and simple business process automation.
· Collaborate across stakeholders and identify needs, define requirements and break down effort into structured implementation sprints leveraging agile
· Drive incident resolution and root cause problem management metrics and ensure key metrics and SLA’s are achieved and maintained
· Dash-boarding skills and ability to present graphical analysis and intuitive reports on usage and adoption
· Perform and support quarterly capacity and financial planning exercise and ensure system upkeep with growing needs
· Effectively work with team members and act as team technical lead, motivating, assisting and mentoring junior members
· As a Technology owner, provide tier 3 support as a Subject Matter Expert to assist system administrators in resolving difficult technical problems with productivity and collaboration tools and systems
· Identify security risks in collaboration with security team and proactively ensure mitigation and resolution of any security related vulnerabilities
· Other duties as assigned

Qualifications Requirements (Knowledge, Skills, Abilities):
· 5-7 years’ experience administrating O365, Exchange Email, File/Print Services, Active Directory, SharePoint, OneDrive, MS Teams, Slack
· Flexible and adaptable to various management styles and organizational cultures.
· Excellent problem-solving skills
· Demonstrable experience with PowerShell scripting
· 4+ years of AWS, Azure and Process automation experience
· Understands global enterprise requirements, virtualization concepts and network architecture& security concepts
· Knowledge and experience with ITIL concepts related to Incident and Change Management
· Proven ability to showcase attributes such as Self-starter, motivated to excellence and driving value through end user productivity
· Ability to analyze complex problems, interprets operational needs, and develops integrated, creative solutions.
· Outstanding collaboration and communication skills
· Strong organizational, verbal, written and documentation skills.

Education/Training Requirements:
· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science related discipline, or computer information systems or equivalent work experience in a related field

Work Environment and Conditions:
Physical requirements: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required sit, stand, talk and hear, use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; repetitive motion; reach with hands and arms. The position is primarily sedentary work. The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. The worker is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading; Other vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, and the ability to adjust focus.

Work environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is working in an office environment. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

About Us
Dama Financial is a financial technology startup focused on partnering with banks to serve business customers around the country. Given the nature of our partnership model, the settlement function is critical to the success of our business. With that in mind, we are looking for a BSA/AML Compliance Analyst with the experience and energy necessary to help build a BSA/AML/OFAC function that can scale and support the rapid growth of our business.
Seeking Kansas City and Surrounding Area Candidates for this position.
Relocation assistance is not offered.

Duties & Responsibilities
The BSA/AML Analyst assists in the day to day BSA/AML responsibilities within Compliance & Risk Management. Responsibilities will include but are not limited:
to reviewing and investigating alerts; high risk accounts; identifying suspicious activity, performing enhanced due diligence on customers and accounts,
interpreting company’s policy and procedures pertaining to compliance and BSA/AML/OFAC; keeping up to date on regulations, and ensuring timely
reporting of all activity to the Chief Compliance Officer (CCO).

Duties of the position will include, but are not limited to:
• Act as a resource to all co-workers in understanding compliance requirements and how it affects products and services;
• Conduct enhanced due diligence for customers at on-boarding and on-going monitoring;
• Identify complexity of beneficial ownership with account relationships;
• Review incoming new accounts for compliance with relevant laws, rules and regulations;
• Assist or conduct with transaction testing, data validation, and ongoing customization of monitoring systems;
• Conduct comprehensive investigation reviews of customers by utilizing CIP information, occupation, line of business, income methods, and transaction activity as identified by the risk assessment and system platform predefined triggers.
• Utilize data to research and build a case or activity for suspicious activity and/or scenarios
• Identify high risk activity, relationships and accounts based on tier levels;
• Assist in ensuring compliance with OFAC, PEPs, and other BSA regulatory lists, to include 314(a) searches from Dept of Treasury
• Assist in preparation for internal audits or bank partners examinations;
• Identify deficiencies and make recommendations for overall purpose of the integrity of the BSA/AML program
• Recommend enhancements for marketing materials for products and services to ensure compliance requirements are considered or included;
• Review and contribute to compliance training materials for staff, as needed;
• Update compliance program manuals, upon the request of the CCO as needed;
• Participate in meetings with co-workers, individually or in a group, to identify gaps within current practices and regulatory requirements and then rectify the process to assure regulatory compliance;
• Review and make recommendations for policies and procedures to meet current regulatory expectations and assist in making updates as regulatory changes occur;
• Monitor new and any proposed laws and regulations in a timely manner and establish compliance obligations to allow Dama to effectively meet these requirements;
• Review and understand consumer complaints received by the organization so accurate and
compliant responses are communicated to consumers;
• Conduct research and data gathering for the completion of compliance requirements for
new products & services; and
• Other duties as assigned.

Knowledge & Skills
Minimum
• Working knowledge of compliance regulations governing Bank Secrecy Act & Anti-Money Laundering (BSA/AML), Patriot Act (CIP), Treasury Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC), FFIEC advisory guidelines regarding Know Your Customer (KYC), Enhanced Due Diligence (EDD) Reg CC, Reg G and other areas to include consumer banking, credit card, prepaid card, and third-party risk management.
• Ability to develop and maintain rapport with co-workers to effectively obtain and
communicate compliance information.
• Identify and assess regulatory compliance risks and develop appropriate strategies to
mitigate risk.
• Effectively detect patterns and conditions through observing processes.
• Organized with ability to maintain a complex annual review calendar.
• Ability to work independently.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills and computer proficiency.

Preferred
• 3+ years of experience or equivalent in audit program development, internal control
consulting, or risk management utilizing.
• CAMS or relative certification.
• Various automated tools and techniques.
• Experience within credit card industry.
• Exhibit superior time management skills (measured by deadlines and quality of
progress and projects completed).
• Advanced decision-making aptitude.
• Demonstrates ability to deal with and meet tight deadlines with limited resources.
• Demonstrates ability to manage multiple projects.

Requirements
Minimum
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration (w/
strong emphasis in Accounting or Finance).
• 2+ years of BSA Analyst with BSA/AML/OFAC experience within a bank setting.

Target Competencies
• Achievement Orientation
• Communication/Interpersonal Skills
• Demonstrates Integrity
• Initiative
• Internal Partnering
• Problem Solving
• Teamwork and Cooperation
• Business and Industry Acumen
• Technology Proficiency
• Project Management
• Leadership/Management

Work Environment
Ability to handle highly confidential and sensitive information; possess skills to work independently or in a group setting; Flexible personality, as needs change depending on needs of the organization; can Influence a large span of relationships and levels; general business office environment.

Due to the nature of financial systems, you will be required to pass a background check.
Benefits
Healthcare
401K

Seeking Kansas City and Surrounding Area Candidates for this position.

What You'll Do:


As the Business Intelligence Data Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting our Professional Services, eAdoption, Credit, and Collections teams to drive business results. You will be the data expert responsible for acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources as a means to develop & implement data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that offer insight into operational efficiency, performance targets, and data inconsistencies. With an eye for accuracy and quality, you will be responsible for optimizing reporting tools, administering project data, building new reports, and providing metric-driven analyses to various levels of management and executive leadership. In this role, you will collaborate with others in the organization to understand business objects, interpret data, analyze results, suggest improvements to tracked metrics, and support the strategic planning around achieving departmental goals.

This position offers you a unique opportunity to develop robust reports while honing in on your curiosity to question and solve complex business issues to further accelerate the growth of our services.
Compile and analyze all project data and other business metrics
Create & maintain meaningful reports to share with various departments utilizing Microsoft Excel
Acquire a solid understanding of the data, various data collection systems, & reporting
Suggest and implement solutions to optimize reporting and processes; build out KPIs, streamline data migration through use of APIs from Clarizen and Salesforce
Understand project management software workflow and fields utilized by the team and function as a platform administrator as necessary
Carry out performance analysis and reporting in collaboration with management
Understand departmental functions & how the various data points demonstrate efficiency & performance
Collaborate and build rapport inter-departmentally and across other departments
Partner with end-users to understand & support their reporting requirements
Present data to various members of management in a consumable format that lends insight into the data without unnecessary complexity
Be able to speak on reporting/data at various levels, depending on the audience (e.g. high-level with executives, detailed level with end-users)
Perform ad hoc reporting to satisfy end-users
What You'll Bring to the Team:


Proven ability to create, maintain, analyze, and report on business data in a fast growing company 3+ years of relevant experience
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Strong Excel skills and the ability to create pivot tables, look up tables (LUT), and dynamic formulas; experience with Power BI a plus
Knowledge of Project Management and CRM software such as Clarizen and Salesforce a plus
Active listener who seeks to understand the root cause of issues and provides solutions
Well-honed written and verbal communication skills
Critical thinker who investigates and seeks to understand the "why"
Approachable and collaborative attitude
Ability to thrive in a fast changing work environment
Strong desire to learn and learning agility
Bachelor's degree preferred in Finance, Business, Accounting, or related field
What You'll Get:


Competitive salary, stock options and 401(k): We appreciate our employees and we make sure they know it.
Open PTO: Work-life balance is important. We believe in giving our employees time to truly relax and recharge.
Paid Parental Leave: To keep our employees and their families healthy.
A Lively Culture: Ping-pong, bean bag toss, hackathons - We enjoy friendly competition.
Flexible Work: Ability to work from home to support your lifestyle or our offices in Denver, Chicago, or Lawrenceville, NJ.
Casual Dress: Every day is "Casual Friday', we want you to be comfortable when you come to work.
Minimal Bureaucracy: An entrepreneurial environment of ownership and accountability allows you to get work done.
Who We Are:


Billtrust is the best-in-class provider of Payment Cycle Management and accounts receivable solutions, helping businesses accelerate Invoice-to-Cash. We provide a flexible, automated, cloud-based product portfolio that meets diverse buyer requirements and speeds cash application through tailored invoice delivery, secure multi-channel payment enablement, and intelligent matching and payment posting. Our platforms process $30B+ annually and help companies like Kraft Foods, New Balance Athletics and Ferguson Enterprises get paid faster and more efficiently. For the past 18 years, we have achieved remarkable success with year-over-year growth and we attribute that growth to our people and culture - We encourage employees to have autonomy, think creatively, share ideas even with our CEO and to challenge the status quo every day without a lot of red tape.

Looking for an exciting career? Join our innovative and growing team of Business Analysts!
Job Description:
We are looking for a Business Analyst professional with experience in both Information Technology and Medical Insurance Business Administration. You will work alongside other business analysts, developers, testers, and business stakeholders and report directly to the Director of Business Analysis. The Business Analysis team is responsible for the continuous improvement of the organization’s operational processes, systems functionality, and user experiences. You will be required to act as a liaison between our business partners and technology teams to ensure that business requirements for new products and enhancements are well-documented and transformed into conceptual technical solutions that support business strategies.
Job Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
· Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions
· Work closely with the business stakeholders in capturing requirements and analyzing data in support of business cases, proposed project layout and system requirements for SDLC projects
· Gathering, documenting and validating requirements as user stories, translating functional requirements to technical requirements, and identifying scalable solutions
· Develop strategic partnership with the business leaders to prepare a solid knowledge based of the business line, products and process
· Collaborating with cross-functional teams and end-users to create solutions that delight, deliver value, and are synergistic to product roadmaps and future-state vision
· Take the ownership of project tasks and ensure they are completed in a timely fashion
· Evaluate, test and recommend new opportunities for enhancing our software and operational processes
· Develop test plans and must be able to perform manual testing
· Coordinates User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and create implementation plans
· Project management knowledge: ability to anticipate risks, propose alternative solutions, and overcome obstacles
· Create process documentation and process flows for current and new processes
· Determine operational objectives by studying business functions, gathering information, and evaluating output requirements and formats
· Create informative, actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement
Qualifications:
· A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or related field

Title:

Description:
Solutia Consulting, Inc.® is a national IT consulting firm with offices in the Twin Cities, Dallas, Austin and Seattle. We are currently looking to add consultants to our Minneapolis team.

We are a unique organization, which is built on best practices and philosophies of small companies, Big 4 Consulting firms and leading corporations. We focus on delivering innovative services to solve our clients’ business needs and also understanding the career interests of our employees to ensure we’re matching assignments that fit their career interests. Solutia looks for employees that want to grow their careers as consultants but also be part of a dynamic team and growing organization.

A Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing and modeling existing business processes. The goal of business process analysis is to understand and document current business procedures and identify areas for improvement. A thorough understanding of the current state of the organization is necessary prior to recommending changes related to implementing a new business solution. This person understands business and ensures that there is integration between business and technology.

The successful candidate will prepare and conduct business process analysis, document and present analysis and modeling results, and transfer knowledge to business users, developers and project managers.

This position presents a unique opportunity to work and learn in a diverse and talented environment that rewards innovation and provides exceptional career growth.

Responsibilities include:

• Stakeholder definition.
• Participate in defining the approaches and priorities for satisfying client needs.
• Participate in business and systems planning for integrated analytic and information technology needs.
• Elicit Requirements using variety of methods including interviews, focus groups, surveys, brainstorming, observation, etc.
• Diagnose process improvement opportunities and develop solutions using principles of process excellence and related tools.
• Document requirements clearly and cohesively such that a variety of audiences both technical and non-technical may comprehend them.
• Translate business requirements into functional and non-functional feature specifications including ability to quantify / qualify the degree to which a feature addresses the desired business outcomes.
• Document functional and non-functional feature specifications using a variety of methods including user stories, use cases, UML diagrams, and workflow diagrams.
• Manage requirements and functional and non-functional feature specifications according to best practice standards and client facing accepted versioning strategy.
• Create and support client-facing presentations to enable solution development, use case development, any additional client education and engagement materials as needed.
• Create, maintain and communicate status reporting to internal and external stakeholders.
• Coordinate business issue resolution through-out the project life cycle.
• Produce phase-end documentation for the business analysis phase.
• Act as champion and Voice of the Customer representing the stakeholders within the project.
• Act as a communication bridge between the technical and business domains of a project.

Required Experience and Education:

• 3+ years’ experience in business analysis techniques and business rule(s) definition
• 4 year college degree from an accredited college or university
• SQL experience
• Business Acumen - demonstrating the ability to enter a new business domain and immediately understand the forces that drive business performance and profitability.
• Visual Modeling experience with processes, complex systems, software models, user interface / user experience
• Ability to interface effectively and build relationships with all levels and across organizational lines, including C-Level executives and business units
• Demonstrated excellence in, time and project management, problem solving, organization, and analysis skills
• Respond quickly to and effectively manage priorities for project requests, deliverables and deadlines
• Ability to effectively utilize external vendors and resources throughout the organization
• Must be self-motivated, well organized and have strong innovation and facilitation skills
• Work both independently and as part of a team to complete identified project objectives
• Passionate about client satisfaction
• Excellent work ethic, high attention to detail
• Ability to Learn / Intellectual Curiosity
• Be flexible and work comfortably in dynamic settings
• Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status)

LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY

If you are looking for a way to growth your experience and develop strong network, you should consider a career in consulting.

In addition to competitive compensation, benefits and incentive programs, we believe there are some excellent reasons for you to consider employment with Solutia. We welcome your inquiry and look forward to sharing more about Solutia Consulting with you.

Solutia Consulting, Inc. ® is an AA/EEO employer in MN.

Are you an experienced QA Analyst and looking to join a stable and innovative organization? If so, this could be the job for YOU!

This job is primarily responsible for ensuring that the organization's applications meet established quality standards. The role is responsible for gathering and analyzing data in support of business cases, proposed projects, and systems requirements. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, writing test plans and scripts for tracking defects and fixes in product development, software application development, information systems, and operations systems. The role applies proven analytical and problem-solving skills to validate IT processes through careful testing to maximize the benefit of business investments in IT initiatives.

In this job, you will:

Level 1; works independently while requiring general direction from experienced IT QA Analysts. Incumbents at this level, have a basic understanding of the software development lifecycle and demonstrate the ability to learn testing best practices and methodologies.
Participate in the development and maintenance of manual test cases.
Participate in the review of requirements specifications to identify gaps and inconsistencies.
Review and understand requirement specifications.
Execute previously written manual test plans and test cases.
Execute previously written SQL queries.
Execute previously defined backend and functional testing.
Execute previously defined regression tests.
Document detailed bug reports and/or testing defects and execute applicable testing once resolved.
Communicate test progress, test results, and other relevant information to project team.
Communicate with coworkers using both technical and user-friendly language.
Propose team goal ideas to manager.
Other duties as assigned.
Level 2; works independently while requiring direction on more complex issues. Incumbents at this level have a thorough understanding of the software development lifecycle and testing best practices and methodologies.
Participate in the review of requirements specifications to identify gaps and inconsistencies.
Review and understand requirement specifications.
Modify and execute previously written manual test plans and test cases.
Create new test plans and test cases with minimal to moderate assistance.
Modify and execute previously written SQL queries.
Execute previously defined backend and functional testing.
Modify and execute previously defined regression tests.
Creates new regression tests with minimal to moderate assistance.
Document detailed bug reports and/or testing defects and execute applicable testing once resolved.
Communicate test progress, test results, and other relevant information to project team.
Communicate with coworkers using both technical and user-friendly language.
Identify and recommend best practices to management and implement these as directed.
Propose team goal ideas to manager.
Other duties as assigned.
Here’s what you’ll need to be considered:

Education

Required – Bachelor’s degree in computer-related field, or equivalent experience and training.

Experience

Required – 2 years’ (Level 1) to 6 years’ (Level 4) related working experience.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Physical Demands & Requirements

Sedentary work. Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time. Jobs are sedentary if walking and standing are required only occasionally and all other sedentary criteria are met.

Hearing. Perceiving the nature of sounds at normal speaking levels with or without correction. Ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, and to make the discriminations in sound.

Environmental Conditions

The work environments described here are meant to be representative of those an employee would normally encounter while performing the essential functions of this job.

Overview


Do you love digging into the "X's and O's" of healthcare claims systems and driving efficiency through collaboration and system improvements?

In this role as a Configuration Analyst, you'll be responsible for application configuration and leverage your project planning, execution, and implementation acumen to drive changes to our mission-critical business applications and analyze application configuration to ensure it is efficient in setup and functionality.

WHAT YOU WILL DO
Implement and configure the QNXT health claims system by prototyping, analyzing, implementing and documenting the process changes.
Partner and collaborate with a Senior or Lead Business Solutions Analyst to resolve complex changes.
Partner with our testing team and key stakeholders to develop and execute appropriate test plans and ensure the configuration changes work as was intended.
Develop and recommend operational processes improvements.
Document functional specifications for system solutions and enhancements to existing business systems.
Communicate results through written documents and maintain configuration database.
WHAT YOU WILL BRING
A Bachelor’s degree (e. g., BS), or equivalent work experience.
Experience working at a healthcare organization.
3-5 years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst and/or Configuration Analyst
QNXT configuration and testing experience (i.e., prototyping, enhancements, unit testing and system upgrades).
Functional understanding of health care claims processing and data sets (i.e., ICD-9/10 and CPT/HCPCs, provider contracts and benefits).
Excellent communication skills with demonstrated ability to effectively exchange information with business and technical audiences at all levels.
Ability to be effective individually or working with a team.

Established in 1994, San Francisco Health Plan (SFHP) is a an award winning, managed care health plan whose mission is to provide affordable health care coverage to the underserved low and moderate-income residents in San Francisco county. SFHP is chosen by eight out of every ten San Francisco Medi-Cal managed care enrollees and its 130,000+ members have access to a full spectrum of medical services including preventive care, specialty care, hospitalization, prescription drugs, and family planning services. SFHP was designed by and for the residents it serves, and takes great pride in its ability to accommodate a diverse population that includes young adults, seniors, and people with disabilities.

A Database Analyst I is responsible for creating, managing, and coding databases and their features.

The Database Analyst I is responsible for the following:
Writes ad hoc TSQL for reports and other business needs.
Confirms project requirements by studying user requirements; conferring with others on project team.
Maintains data dictionary by revising and entering definitions.
Maintains client confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential.
Builds stored procedures, views, functions and tables to meet business needs.
Maintains technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing publications; establishing personal networks; participating in technical societies.
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Maintains user reference by writing and rewriting database descriptions.
Builds and maintains reports in SSRS and SSIS.
Database Analyst I Requirements:
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server and well versed in TSQL
Well-developed analytical skills and the ability to analyze situations, challenge assumptions, develop analytical methodologies, present/defend conclusions and recommend action plans.
Intellectual curiosity and a willingness to dive into a problem and uncover/understand the root cause.
Time management skills in regards to balancing & prioritizing multiple projects & requests, meeting deadlines, and producing accurate results.
Strong communication skills - both written and verbal.
High school diploma is required.
The Database Analyst I requires the following technical skills:
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server 2014, 2016 (2019 is a plus) supporting both OLTP and OLAP database types.
Sound knowledge of T-SQL, creation of stored procedures, functions, and jobs.
Sound knowledge of ETL concepts and experience using SSIS.
Strong trouble shooting skills.
Skills/Qualifications:
TSQL, SSRS, SSIS, Requirements Analysis, Software Development Fundamentals, Problem Solving, Documentation Skills, Verbal Communication, Data Maintenance, Database Security, Promoting Process Improvement
Developing database solutions with T-SQL to meet business needs
Creating reports using SSRS 2016 or newer.
Excellent communicator with the business owners.
Working closely with Application Developers, Network Administrators and other Technical Support team members.
Designing, developing, automating and supporting ETL processes for data staging, extraction, transformation, and data cleansing, and loading of fact tables.
Pluses:
Experience with XML
Experience with BCP importing of large volumes of data
Experience with SSIS, SSAS and SSRS
Experience with SQL Server 2016
Experience with Jira or any Atlassian tools
Experience with Git/BitBucket
Experience with Redgate Source Control or other Redgate tools
Experience with load balancing web application workloads
Experience in the development and maintenance of conceptual, logical and physical data models
Experience working with data warehouses and de-normalizing data
Experience with multiple architectural models
Experience with data warehouse tools
Experience with the Agile development methodology

Generous paid time off package

Job Description

What Youll Get to Do:

CACI has an immediate need for a Business System Analyst to support the GRIFFIN program in Chantilly, VA. The Business Systems Analyst (BSA) will define business requirements, translate business requirements to functional, user, and system requirements, and develop supporting materials such as use cases, flowcharts, context diagrams, wireframes, interface system diagrams, and data flows. The BSA will develop business, functional and system user stories and requirements for small and large-scale web applications.

More About the Role:
Translate business requirements to detailed user, functional, and systems requirements
Support the project team to ensure implementation meets specifications/requirements and customer expectations
Facilitate requirement gathering sessions by working with the customer/stakeholders to define and document customer requirements that will be developed by the development team
Serve as primary contact with the Subject Matter Experts
Responsible for supporting the client through User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and any support for defect management during UAT process
Provides guidance to less experienced Business System Analysts
Responsible for working with the customer/stakeholders to write and define customer requirements and workflows that will be developed by the development team.
Is an authority that provides expertise in the formulation of the application scope and objectives related to the customers business plans and application requirements.
Under minimal direction, formulates and defines systems scope and objectives through user needs and an understanding of business systems and industry requirements.
Develops or modifies procedures to solve complex problems within information systems.
Performs at an advanced technical level on all phases of analyzing business and user needs, documenting requirements, and translating into proper system requirement specifications.
Provides guidance to less experienced Business System Analysts.
Youll Bring These Qualifications:
Bachelors degree (Computer Science or technology related field) or equivalent
5+ years of experience in requirements capture, management and analysis activities in all phases of the software development life cycle
3+ years of experience in web application development projects
Excellent oral and written communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to communicate complex technical topics to management and non-technical audiences
Excellent analytical skills, including the ability to integrate information from multiple sources
Ability to work independently and interact regularly with government and non-government stakeholders at multiple levels of authority
Active TS/SCI with Polygraph is required.

We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nations highest priorities.

Position: Junior Program Analyst (Admin Support)

Overview:

This position supports tasking in PMA-265, NAVAIR Head Quarters in Patuxent River, MD. The successful candidate will support the FMS F/A-18 customer and shall provide technical and analytical support services for integration and sustainment planning to the USN FMS IPT for the F/A-18 air vehicle, subsystems, armament, engine, spares and support equipment efforts.

Responsibilities:
Provides program office analysis support
Performs critical program management, technical, or business analysis of major DoD acquisition systems and provides recommendations to ensure program success
Administrative, professional or other responsible work related to a broad range of fields including, but not limited to, personnel management, funds management, management analysis, procurement, contract management, data processing, travel, and office management
Coordination off a wide range of program related efforts including action item and risk database management, correspondence drafting, meeting coordination, recording meeting minutes, engineering change proposal review, CDRL development/review, drafting of SOW, and development/review of various briefings for the customer
Uploading of correspondence, enclosures, and reference material to SharePoint database as well as providing monthly calendar updates in support of schedules and meetings
SharePoint action item and risk database management, reviewing outgoing correspondence and providing feedback and guidance, developing and maintaining correspondence templates per correspondence manual requirements
Collect, complete, organize and interpret technical data, playbooks, and financial information relating to aircraft acquisition and sustainment programs
Tracks program/project status and schedules. Applies policies and procedures for financial planning
Participates in meetings and supports specified Program Integrated Product Teams (IPT). Tracks program/project status and schedules, takes minutes, prepares presentations, reports, studies documentation to support various aspects of FMS programs. Performs task under supervision
Minimum Requirements:
AS or AA Degree in a business or technical discipline
Allowable Substitution: An additional four (4) years of experience can be substituted for an AS or AA degree
At least two (2) years of experience in business or technical position is desired
Demonstrated experience in the program/project status and schedules
Demonstrated knowledge of SECNAV, OPNAV and OSD forms related to PPBS, MIPRS, work requests, Requisitions, Contract Data Requirements List (CDRL), and DD 254
Demonstrated experience in the program/project status and schedules
This position will require U.S. citizenship and an active DoD Secret clearance
Preferred Qualifications:
Previous experience with NAVAIR

About Us:

NYSTEC is a non-profit technology consulting company, advising agencies, organizations, institutions, and businesses since 1996. Were independent and vendor-neutral so we have our clients best interests at heart. At NYSTEC, we know that we succeed when individuals and teams flourish personally and professionally, so our benefits and perks support this mindset. Are you ready to contribute to our engaged workforce and deliver the NYSTEC Experience?

About the Role:

As a Business Analyst in the Healthcare Management Services practice, you will collaborate with team members to conceptualize, deliver, and support our clients through todays ever-changing healthcare landscape. NYSTEC is considered a trusted program advisor, providing subject matter expertise, and connecting the dots for our clients. Over the last five years, NYSTEC has consulted on some of the largest Medicaid initiatives and served in various roles across a multitude of New York State healthcare technology systems.

Serving as a Business Analyst, your day-to-day role as a NYSTEC consultant will include engagement of stakeholders, elicitation and prioritization of stakeholder requirements, research and assessment of the existing technology and policy landscape, and support of communications and expectation management with project sponsor and stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities
Support Project Manager in defining and prioritizing project tasks
Conduct stakeholder engagement sessions to identify system and policy requirements
Analyze and prioritize requirements and identify associated risks
Research and document project landscape, including identification of technologies available to support project goals and policy and process needs for successful implementation

About You:

Required Qualifications
Business analysis experience required, including full SDLC implementation experience, requirements elicitation and landscape analysis
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Healthcare experience
Experience working on collaborative, cross-functional teams
Preferred/Desired Qualifications
Experience with Medicaid or Long-term Care, especially working with health plans and local districts
Experience with health care policy a plus
CBAP a plus
Education and Experience
A minimum of a Bachelors degree with at least 5 years of related experience in healthcare or systems implementation business analysis is required. An equivalent combination of advanced education, training, and experience will be considered.
If youre an effective communicator who enjoys working in complex and collaborative environments, utilizing your critical thinking and research skills to develop solutions for clients, providing support to customers, and have the required education, experience and skills, we want to hear from you.

NYSTEC is an equal-opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship status, marital status disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future.
