Business Analyst

Job Location: Columbus, OH

Join our team

Centric Consulting is not the typical consulting company. We live our core values and bring them with us in all we do for our clients and community. Our core purpose is simple: every day we strive to provide unmatched customer and employee experiences and foster a culture of respect, diversity, and transparency. It’s this culture, our people, and delivery that come together to make Centric a trusted advisor to local businesses.

Our Columbus business unit is guided by the goal of creating unmatched experiences for our clients, employees and community. We are committed to doing great things for clients while making a positive difference in the community because it’s where we live, work and serve. We are seeking talented Business Analysts for W2T consulting opportunities to join our growing team.

In this role, you will:
Work with business subject matter experts and technical teams to gather project needs and translate them into functional and technical documentation.
Act as a general liaison between business and technical teams.
Create reference manuals, training material, and other technical documents as necessary.
Assist in the training of new users for the solution.
Work with test teams to enable the creation of test scenarios and plans.
Coordinate user acceptance testing with users.
Work with implementation teams to analyze and triage defects.
Work on agile projects (so, it’s a plus if you have experience writing user stories, creating acceptance criteria, stand-ups, product review sessions, backlog grooming meetings, retrospectives, sprint planning processes, and of automated testing processes).
Work with business stakeholders to gather and document business needs and translate them into operational requirements.
Ability to translate business vision into defined and prioritized stories for the team backlog.
Expertise in various business analysis methodologies, including data analysis, use case development, story writing, and user acceptance testing and product documentation.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to understand complex customer needs and translate them into stories with actionable acceptance criteria.
Create drafts of epics and stories to seed backlog in order to begin the refinement process.
Participate in agile ceremonies such as daily stand-ups, sprint planning meetings, demos, and retrospectives.
Mitigate impediments that may impact successful team completion of release/sprint goals.
Experience with Jira or similar Agile backlog management tool.
A successful candidate will have the following characteristics:
Ability to create unmatched experiences, for both clients and employees, is what we do. You should revel in doing the unexpected and extraordinary for others.
A learning mindset, ready to experience new ideas and situations regularly.
Consulting experience is strongly preferred. That said, you will also be considered if you have a strong industry background. We like to work in the communities we live in.
We want someone who likes to solve problems. Clients don’t come to us when the problem is easy. You should enjoy taking on the hard stuff.
And because we work with clients, excellent communication skills are important – both written and verbal. Translating technical concepts into layman’s terms is an essential skill.
Initiative is important. We don’t hand hold – you should be comfortable working independently in an entrepreneurial environment. That said, collaboration is equally important. Our Columbus team and other [technologists or consultants] at Centric will give you an amazing support system. You will lean on them daily.
What makes Centric different?
Special Culture – Our people make us different. We have highly talented, intelligent individuals across a broad variety of disciplines – who are eager to learn from you and share their own expertise. We embrace fresh perspectives and each other. Don’t take our word for it – check us out on Glassdoor, Comparably, Facebook , Twitter or Instagram to get a glimpse inside what makes us different.
Growth opportunities – As a mid-size firm, there is more flexibility when it comes to career paths . Figure out what you want to do, and we'll help you figure out how to get there.
Impact – We think of ourselves as a big company with a small company feel – a local player with a global reach that combines business, technology and industry expertise.
Unmatched Experiences – We are allowed to be ourselves here. We are encouraged to be human. It’s at the root of who we are as a firm and why we’re here.
Innovation – We value passion, determination, perseverance, and innovation. We are inspired because we believe in what we are doing and where we are going.
Passion for the greater good – We are steadfast in our devotion to the communities we serve and in actively promoting employee involvement in community improvement projects.
Centric believes the best solutions come from diverse teams. We strive to have an environment where everyone has an opportunity to be successful regardless of their race, color, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation or gender identity.

Participation in industry meetings as needed

Teaching Strategies is a dynamic early childhood education company that provides the most innovative and effective curriculum, assessment, professional development, and family connection resources to programs serving children from birth through kindergarten. With ground-breaking solutions and a strong belief that the most powerful way to impact child outcomes is to improve teacher effectiveness, Teaching Strategies has been supporting the critical work of early childhood educators for over 25 years.

Position overview
The Business Analyst will support the information needs of the business. He/she will gather and analyze data requirements to support pipeline and CRM applications, ad-hoc reporting, and self-service analytics platforms. He/she will be responsible for developing and managing processes, information flows, and data governance standards across various systems and business groups.

Duties:

Monitor, analyze and report key revenue performance drivers including market penetration and pricing
Responsible for the capture, delivery, and record-keeping of business information needs such as forecasting, variance analysis, identification and communication of risks & opportunities, industry & competitive analysis, board meeting support and financial closes.
Will collaborate with team members on the development of analytical models, interactive self-service dashboards, and guided reporting tools to support prospect, customer, sales and financial metrics reporting across the organization.
Establish and maintain strong relationships with all key stakeholders in Sales, Technology, Marketing and Finance to ensure consistent and open dialogue and a combined commitment to process improvements and data cleanliness.
Support VP and CEO in budget planning process, monthly financial close, and corporate forecast reporting
Display ingenuity through development of new analytical products that improve story-telling and issue identification
Work with internal and external stakeholders to develop tools and services such as modeling, dashboards, hypothesis generation and testing, scorecards, and data insights
Consult with departments across the organization to understand, document, and analyze data requirements and translate those requirements into analytics/reporting requirements
Conceptualize, design, and support the implementation of analytics and reports for business partners
Identify business data needs (and gaps) to support business goals
Stay current with new analytical tools and industry trends
Map business processes and data flow across systems and business groups

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Accounting/Finance/Business or Information Systems
Minimum of 5-7 years of related business/financial analysis experience in a professional private sector environment
Familiarity with the Education market and Sales greatly desired
Strong understanding of accounting/financial concepts
High proficiency in MS Office products required, (particularly Excel)
Experience utilizing Access and PowerPoint and familiarity with process charting tools as Visio is highly desired.
Prior experience customizing and maximizing the use of SalesForce.com or similar CRM Knowledge of dashboards/scorecards, and basic statistical techniques
Proficient at modeling, processing, and preparing data for analysis
Strong analytical skills, critical thinking, decision support and performance analysis, forecasting, and planning
Exceptional communications skills including demonstrated strength in creating presentations
Ability to professionally interacting with all levels of co-workers.
Excellent project management, communication, analytical, and problem solving skills
Ability to present complex information in an understandable and compelling manner
Ability to independently manage workload with regard to prioritization and time
Persistent attention to detail with ability to multi-task
High energy and sense of urgency in completing all tasks

Essential Job Functions:

Ability to frequently answer the telephone and communicate verbally
Ability to frequently read and understand text via computer and mobile device
Ability to frequently stand and/or sit for extended periods of time based on the task
Ability to frequently manipulate computer keyboard, mouse, and mobile device
Ability to travel up to 15% as needed by car, train, bus, and/or airplane

It will play an important role in supporting the commercialization of several software products to assist SullivanCotter clients with administration of performance-based physician compensation plans.

The position is ideal for candidates that demonstrate strong analytic capabilities; experience with data management, automation and technology; and a desire to assist health care organizations as they navigate the complexities of health care reform. The Business Analyst is a key resource for health care organizations as they implement new solutions. Approximately 60% of this position will be assisting with new client implementations and 40% will be client support, post implementation.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Assist with implementation process of the various Provider Performance Management Technology (PPMT) modules for current and potential clients. Including, but not limited to:
Work with implementation lead and IT to map import specifications, populate and audit tables with client logic and specific programming.
Assists in system configuration, data load and testing during client implementations.
Understand and complete security set-up based on roles and functions for each client implementation.
Process, validate and review system data, data reconciliation and parallel test.
Develop reporting requirements, including detailed design.
Test client custom reports; including building test data and working with development on team on issues.
Assist with developing, organizing and coordinating training materials for clients.
Ensure efficient client implementations with a positive and professional client experience:
Assist implementation lead by developing and updating basic project plans to support each implementation.
Proactively manage tasks based on the type of implementation and client specifics.
Work with implementation lead to create and maintain standard implementation materials (checklists, how to documentation). Once developed, work within agreed upon standard documents and process.‒ Work with implementation lead to guide client throughout implementation.
Create clear, concise – yet detailed - documentation of all actions taken throughout the implementation and stored in appropriate TFS folders.
Responsible for documenting all client testing and user acceptance sign off.
Log any bugs or feature requests for consideration in roadmap planning.
Support clients post implementation:
Understand client requests and translate them into table uploads and manual modifications as required.
Follow established policies and procedures regarding how problems are identified, received, documented, distributed and corrected.
Accurately track help desk support through use of help desk software.
Meets established service level agreements for general response times and issue resolution.
Provides references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation; providing help desk support.
The Business Analyst is expected to participate in other team responsibilities as needed to meet client needs, including:
Testing and implementation of database and reporting systems, including testing of web page functionality, database processing and online analytic reporting.
Assist clients with troubleshooting of system processing and online reporting issues as needed.
Maintains user confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree.
Minimum of three years’ experience working with significant data management responsibilities or software and analytic tools.
Advanced understanding of data management and analytics. Knowledge of health care related data is a plus.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft applications including Access, Word, Excel, Project and Outlook. Experience with online business intelligence report writing is a significant plus.
Advanced investigational skills, shows attention to detail, accuracy and ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks.
Strong individual contributor, but equally as strong team player that focuses and supports group results.
Must be able to work independently, prioritize and make sound business decisions.
Experience in environments where HIPAA policies and procedures are enforced is a plus.
Must be available periodically on weekends or evenings to support user testing and PPMT production migration.
BEHAVIORAL ATTRIBUTES
Communicates with others in a respectful, courteous manner while simultaneously building credibility and rapport.
Presents clear and accurate information and updates to clients, colleagues and leaders; adapts presentation to fit audience.
Able to communicate effectively with IT programmers to investigate and resolve issues or to design and implement system improvements.
Anticipates, understands and addresses client needs by taking ownership of and initiating action on client requests and concerns.
Establishes client confidence by developing and maintaining professional working relationships; utilizes resources to accomplish goals and meet client and team needs.
Prepares accurate information based on client requests or needs.
Provides excellent client service in multiple assignments.
Willing to work nights or weekends to ensure client needs are met.
Applicants for employment must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States (i.e. H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).

Qualified applicants will be afforded equal employment opportunities without discrimination because of race, creed, color, national origin, sex, age, disability or marital status.

Apply Now

Job Description:
CMHA-CEI has two Business Analyst positions available! Each position has a bit different duties, they will both report the Business Analyst Manager. Duties for each below:
Business Analyst (20-132): Under the supervision of the Business Analyst Manager, with dotted line responsibility to the Chief Financial Officer, and working with a team of other Business Analysts and IT specialists, assists in the design, testing and implementation of software systems used by CMHA-CEI for operational, management and reporting purposes (with an emphasis on supporting claims payment and financial systems.) Collects and prioritizes internal customer requests. Designs report layouts, procedures for data input, and time line requirements. Develops procedures for keeping the data set up-to-date and accurate. Works with end users in the design and development of new documents and other enhancements to the agency’s software systems. When needed, provides end user support for the software systems.
Business Analyst (20-135): Under the supervision of the Business Analyst Manager, and working with a team of other Business Analysts and IT specialists, assists in the design, testing and implementation of behavioral health software systems used by CMHA for operational, management and reporting purposes. Collects and prioritizes internal customer requests. Designs report layouts, procedures for data input, and time line requirements. Develops procedures for keeping the data up-to-date and accurate. Works with end users in the design and development of new clinical documents and other enhancements to the agency’s electronic health record. When needed, provides end user support for the behavioral health software systems.
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Management, Business Accounting or related field is required. A combination of education and directly related experience will be considered on a case by case basis. One year of experience analyzing business information, processes and requirements gathering preferred. Knowledge of principles of accounting and financial statements preferred. Knowledge of medical billing preferred. Strong skills in the use of spreadsheets. Working familiarity with databases, including underlying concepts. Ability to communicate accurately and effectively both in writing and verbally is required.
About Community Mental Health Authority: Community Mental Health Authority of Clinton, Eaton, and Ingham Counties was founded on the belief that mental health services are best provided in the community in which the person receiving such service lives. CMHA-CEI provides a wide range of community-based services. Annually, the organization serves over 10,000 persons at 122 sites through the tri-county region.
CMHA-CEI is a front runner in mental health awareness and change. Are you interested in joining us?
Compensation: We offer a very compelling salary commensurate with experience and a complete benefits package (Health, Dental, Disability, Defined Benefit through 403B), Public Service Loan Forgiveness,vacation, sick and personal days. We’re serious about finding good people and treating them well.

This is a work from home position!

Position Summary

The JD Edwards E1 Analyst role will be techno-functional in nature with a focus on sales and use tax calculations within different JDE modules. Major focus will be in Order-To-Cash, Procure-To-Pay, and Finance/Accounting. Knowledge in other modules would be appreciated. The most successful candidate will be a dynamic individual who can contribute to DMA’s business development model and build strong relationships with DMA partners.

Duties and Responsibilities

• Act as a main functional SME for JDEOrder-To-Cash, Procure-To-Pay and Finance modules.

• Help clients to design and implement sales and use tax calculation and accounting processes utilizing DMA tax Integration solution. Provide guidance on tax accounting standards and best practices.

• Work with clients to gather business requirements and compile them into functional design document.

• Work with DMA development team to translate the functional requirements into the technical design.

• Prepare unit and regression test plan based on the functional requirements.

• Create test data, unit and regression testing and document the test.

• Prepare training materials and conduct training sessions for clients on new JDE functionality implemented by DMA.

• Based on the industry best practices and current market trends, identify the gaps in DMAs existing solution offerings and prepare suggesting to fill those gaps.

• Monitor issue tracking system, triage support tickets. Isolate software bugs vs. other issues. Route the bug tickets to development team. Work with clients on resolution of the other issues.

• Help clients with data conversion activities related to tax connector implementation.

• Have a working knowledge of the JDE technical architecture.

• Understand JDE E1 development process, be able to work with E1 Development Client (Fat client), use OMW, create and maintain UBE applications and version.

• Be able to read and interpret the JDE logs.

• Manage multiple priorities and projects with critical deadlines.

Non-Essential Duties and Responsibilities

• Have a good understanding of other E1 modules such as Service and Warranty Management, Service and Contract billing etc. that uses tax calculation.

• Have a good understanding of JDE standard integration with JDE Vertex Q Series.

• Being familiar with JDE Word Software.

• Good knowledge of JDE interoperability functionality.

• Being able to read and / or debug JDE C functions is a plus.

• Being familiar with Java and JDE BSSV is a plus.

• Have experience of integrating JDE with other systems such as external tax engines.

• Having experience with some tax calculation software is a plus.

Education and Qualifications

• Bachelor degree in Information Technology, Accounting, Finance or other related fields.

• At least 5 years of techno-functional experience in JDE Order-To-Cash, Procure-To-Pay and Finance/Accounting.

• Strong oral, written communication and presentation skills.

• Experience with software QA processes.

• Must be able to travel 50 %.

We are hiring a Risk Analyst to join our Enterprise Risk team. In this role, you will conduct enterprise wide focused risk assessments. Qualified candidates will have 1-3 years of experience in a risk management, or compliance analyst role. You will have knowledge of financial industry operations, products and services, exceptional analytical skills, and the ability to balance multiple assignments with exceptional attention to detail.

Here’s what you can expect from the job and what you need to be successful:

Job Duties:

Identify and report levels of risk in the organization through risk reports and dashboards
Audit data and establish quality control measures
Create reports and summaries, and document processes
Analyze data to calculate risks and outcomes
Aggregate and transform data from multiple sources to produce consistent results
Essential Skills:
1-3 years of experience in a complex analyst role with a broad knowledge of financial industry operations, functions, products, and services
Expert knowledge of Excel, including the use of Pivot Tables and Macros
Ability to organize, analyze, and interpret data to explain complex irregularities or trends
Ability to manage interdepartmental initiatives, coordinate with business units, and document processes
Excellent organizational, time management, and adaptability skills
Ability to manage multiple conflicting priorities across multiple projects/initiatives
Technology savvy; proficiency with Microsoft suite of products including Word and PowerPoint
Strong verbal and written communication skills and ability to collaborate with internal/external partners and key stakeholders
Must be able to maintain confidentiality with member and employee information
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or related field of study is generally required. Will accept any suitable combination of education, experience, or training
Location: Hillsboro Corporate Office

First Tech is not currently offering Visa sponsorship for this position

MBC is a fast-growing firm that is seeking Business Systems Analysts with experience providing strategic or technical expertise for complex SAP engagements for Federal Government agencies or Fortune 500 companies that have undergone a financial statement audit and received an unmodified opinion.

**This role will be based in Arlington, VA.** Multiple positions available.

Client Management, Qualifications and Responsibilities
• Experience supporting IT system audit readiness, IT audit reviews, IT system control documentation, or FISCAM and Risk Management Framework (RMF) implementation and sustainment capabilities.

•A strong technical knowledge of data/financial systems (implementing, managing, optimizing) is required

•Provide support to clients’ technical areas such as accounting procedures, IT control projects, and compliance services
• Develop or update Navy ERP training materials and curriculum for eventual Navy roll-out.

• Draft functional specification documents for input to Business Requirements Documents (BRDs), System Change Requests (SCRs), Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs)& interface agreements including impact statement.

•Develop new interface agreements or modification of existing interface agreements as required.

Minimum Requirements:
• Candidate must have 5 years of full-time (excluding internships) experience within the past 10 years of progressive experience providing financial systems or business systems services to the Federal Government agencies or Fortune 500 companies.

•Candidate must be knowledgeable in coordinating across multiple organizations, risk and issue management, and managing multiple priorities. Knowledge should also include financial management systems architecture and solution design, data conversion, cutover, change management, system security and audit controls.

•Candidate must have an understanding of the configuration of SAP and its Modules.

•Bachelor's Degree from an accredited United States college or university in Business, Accounting, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Information Systems
• DoD SECRET clearance or ability to obtain a clearance

• Proficiency with the web and MS Office Suite applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and SharePoint)

Preferred Qualifications:

• Experience with DoD audit processes and FIAR Guidance

• Experience in FISCAM, OMB Circular A-123, audit readiness, and/or FISMA security reviews

•Business Process Improvement

•Business Process Documentation
• Knowledge of Federal financial statement auditing practices
• A strong technical knowledge of data/financial systems (implementing, managing, optimizing)

• Experience in performing information assurance, information security, risk management, IT application controls and technologies (e.g., COSO, ERM, FISCAM, FISMA, NIST), financial statement audits and/or auditability assessments
• Knowledge of the Financial Audit Manual (FAM), FIAR approaches and information system controls in areas of information assurance, access control, change control, segregation of duties, data base administration and data privacy
• Excellent writing and communications skills

JOB PURPOSE


The FP&A Analyst – Commercial supports finance, sales, and marketing leaders in developing accurate and insightful analysis and KPI reporting. The position will be responsible for providing recommendations and expected to have a highly analytical skillset with strong attention to detail and accuracy. The successful candidate will be expected to develop sales reporting and dashboards used to analyze and monitor the business. Candidate will also assist in the implementation of company pricing strategy and provide leadership and initiative in identifying sales and operational improvements. Must be able to communicate analysis effectively through oral and visual presentation and take accountability for accuracy of information. Experience with analytical software and tools to report and visualize data is required. Must have a strong desire to learn and be capable of solving complex problems with little to no supervision.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Utilize company data and systems to develop meaningful analysis that serve to analyze, measure, and support company strategies
Own report and dashboarding in ERP and Tableau to communicate sales KPI
Assist sales team in analysis and implementation of company pricing strategy
Manage monthly commissions process and provide insights and analysis to improve incentive programs
Support weekly and monthly development of financial and operational reporting to internal stakeholders

Experience with data visualization & reporting tools (Tableau or similar)
Pricing and commissions experience preferred
Expertise analyzing and designing business processes and recommending improvements
Desire to learn and take initiative to solve problems and assist cross-functional stakeholders
MS Office experience, highly proficient in Excel and PowerPoint
BA or BS in finance or related field

Here at Scotts Miracle-Gro there is no such thing as a typical day. Our culture is constantly energized by new and exciting growth opportunities and at a rapid pace. Every Associate plays an important role in providing innovative solutions for today’s gardeners and growers and contributing new ideas to improve operations. In our company you need grit, it is what we were founded on over 150 years ago and is what keeps us growing. Regardless of your level in the organization there is a platform for your voice to be heard and the ability to influence change. Family, community and hard working values are weaved into all that we do. Come grow with us, where we develop and nurture the next generation of leaders.

ScottsMiracle-Gro is searching for a dynamic social media marketer to grow with us, as we create and build engaged social media communities and industry-leading integrated digital campaigns.

The ideal person for this role has hands-on, professional experience managing and growing social media presences for brands across major platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, YouTube and Twitter, is excited to jump into the channels to engage with our audiences each day, and loves to keep a pulse on emerging trends and influencers. We’re searching for someone who is creative, thoughtful, analytical, and excited to share fresh takes on all things social, and digital omni-channel content work to shape the future of our brands.

You’ll contribute to the development and execution of social media strategy, work collaboratively with our creative agencies to manage the production and delivery of social media content, have ownership of content publishing, managing influencer marketing programs and own day-to-day social community engagement. We’re looking for someone who is curious, and has strong research skills; this role will perform audits and review case studies relating to social media, content, and digital channels at large to surface findings and insights relevant to our category and business goals.

This position requires a strong work ethic, including the ability to balance working autonomously and working in highly collaborative groups to deliver quality content that satisfies business and campaign objectives. Due to the always-on nature of social media, the person in this role must be comfortable monitoring and publishing on social channels outside of regular business hours as needed, which may include evenings, weekends and/or holidays.

Key Responsibilities and Skillsets:

Day to day
40% community management
30% content development and planning
20% research, audits and social listening
10% reporting
Subject Matter Expertise and Stewardship
Expert user of popular social networking sites like Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest, Snapchat, and YouTube
Understands the nuances of successful content across different channels and how to execute it accordingly
Passionate about the evolving landscape of digital marketing, including social media and content’s role in the sales funnel
Advocate for social media and content marketing best practices across the organization drawing on industry standards, best practice case studies and ScottsMiracle-Gro’s historical marketing activities
Analytical thinker with a creative flair who can translate conceptual ideas into consumer facing content
Interface with and provide feedback to agency partners to guide production and implementation of social media content and advertising work
Participate in paid social media strategy planning and implementation
Ability to develop and implement content calendars based on business goals and campaign objectives using ScottsMiracle-Gro’s library of internal content, or through coordinating with external resources as needed
Comfortable engaging with consumers on behalf of ScottsMiracle-Gro brands on social media, escalating issues to Customer Services as necessary
Delivery of social media consultation, content generation, and ongoing social media audit and support to our internal teams as necessary
Develop and advocate for online tone and voice across our family of brands
Actively research newsworthy topics/events, influencers and social media trends to improve content and share learnings with other Marketing Services stakeholders and Brand Team members
Use social channels to support PR, sponsorship and traditional media efforts
Monitor key performance metrics to understand trends and derive insights to inform future content or engagement efforts
Communication and Organization Skills
Effective communicator, able to explain complex nuances of social media channels and content simply
Willing to play an educator role to teach members of Marketing Services and Brand Teams about social media platforms and content
Able to develop presentations that clearly and succinctly outline campaign goals, processes, procedures and workflows
Comfortable with presenting to internal groups during meetings
Highly organized
Able to manage time and capacity effectively
Detail oriented
Cultural Fit
Comfortable working in a highly matrixed environment
Ability to work autonomously on a broad array of tasks and projects relating to community management, content development, auditing, social listening, reporting
Ability to contribute collaboratively to a team
Ability to work under deadlines in a fast-paced environment and own multiple projects at once
Qualifications:

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Liberal Arts, Marketing, Communications or a related field.
Experience:
Minimum 2-4 years of experience in interactive marketing or related communications positions, including experience and familiarity with branding, consumer packaged good marketing, project management and social media marketing.
Past experience in similar roles with internal clients or in an agency environment is preferred.
Writing, editing or content creation experience, including managing content and content marketing efforts for a national brand.

Job Description:
Company Information

Solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. Thats Travelers. Job Description Summary

Positions within this family work with business customers to determine how Business Intelligence information and analytic solutions can be leveraged to support business strategies, capabilities, and processes. Incumbents in this position are accountable for full spectrum of business analysis functions for multiple workflows/projects of medium to larger scope. This position, under general supervision, is responsible for: Eliciting, analyzing, specifying, documenting, communicating and validating business intelligence requirements. Collaborating in the development of BI capabilities and ensures alignment of these capabilities to BI strategies and roadmaps. Driving consensus among business stakeholders and IT about the business needs and their feasibility. Coordinating and executing user acceptance testing that proves that the reporting and analytic solution meets business needs. Communicating business intelligence requirements to diverse stakeholder groups to create a shared understanding of the business needs. Acting as a liaison on Business Intelligence initiatives between business users and technology team. This job may lead others. General Supervision: incumbents are told what to do, but not how to do it. Incumbents have some discretion on work accountabilities.

The Legal Resource Strategy & Operations organization has an exciting opportunity for a Business Intelligence Analyst Manager. The primary focus of this position will be to work in a team within an Agile framework to help deliver on strategic initiatives. These initiatives can range from delivering legal dashboards and reports, to business rule development, to modernizing and transforming our legacy BI&A assets to a strategic state. The Business Intelligence Analyst Manager will need to both understand and articulate the business need and collaborate on how information needs to be consumed, perform the data analysis required to create the information and achieve the desired outcome, as well as communicate with diverse stakeholders and team members as the go-to-person for analysis needs. Candidates ideally will have expertise as a Business Intelligence Analyst (data and business) and will also have a working knowledge of Insurance operations and core functions.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
Ensures that the business capability requirements align to the business intelligence and data strategy roadmaps.
Elicits, analyzes, specifies, documents, communicates and validates business intelligence requirements for assigned workflows/projects.
Responsible for developing a requirement approach for business intelligence initiatives, including developing estimates and timelines for business analyst deliverables.
Responsible for the ongoing rationalization of business intelligence assets to ensure they are providing utmost value for business outcomes.
Leads the execution of business analyst best practices in business intelligence; provides feedback and input into process improvements. Aids in the development of best practices.
Defines the capabilities that satisfy the broader business requirements.
Responsible for ensuring that requirement deliverables are compliant, auditable, unambiguous, complete, consistent, understood clearly and meet the business and technical needs of the project.
Offers insight and alternatives and obtains consensus among stakeholders. (May provide assistance on obtaining census to more junior staff where consensus difficult to reach).
Ensures requirement traceability is established and managed throughout the project lifecycle on more complex projects.
Facilitates cross functional requirement sessions about complex information needs and documents requirements; includes working with stakeholders to prioritize requirements based on aligned Business Intelligence capabilities and business need.
Review and provide business expertise to project requirements on Travelers business processes, products, and/or supporting systems.
Point of contact for business throughout and after project implementation.
Facilitates and utilizes the best practices for user acceptance testing (UAT) including creation, socialization, and execution of UAT plans.
Leads user groups and development of more complex documents, requirements and business process flows.
Aids in developing best practices regarding implementation readiness, user adoption, support, including communication, training and rollout plans on business intelligence solutions.
Provides project management support as necessary.
Aids in the design and implementation of all best practices used in business analysis.
Responsible for managing and fostering collaborative business and IT relationships.
Understands the business functions, processes, and overall business strategies.
Adheres and supports all data management practices and governance practices.
Leads medium to large size projects as needed.
May provide guidance to more junior team members.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelors Degree in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics), Business or equivalent education or 5 years analytics work experience required.
4 years of business analysis or analytics experience required.
Demonstrated intermediate analytic and diagnostic skills.
Education, Work Experience, & Knowledge
4 years supporting the development of Business Intelligence solutions preferred.
2 years in leadership role on projects preferred.
Previous experience leading others preferred.
General understanding of the business functions, processes, and overall business strategies.
General Knowledge: Possesses sufficient knowledge to perform most work in normal situations.
Job Specific Technical Skills & Competencies
Demonstrated intermediate interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated intermediate communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Intermediate project management skills.
Demonstrated ability to see results to completion.
Demonstrated ability to influence others. Intermediate business acumen.
Seeks opportunities to learn and to influence others. Intermediate problem solving and decision making skills.
Experience and ability using BI tools (as an end user) preferred.
Ability to interact effectively with others across functions.
Ability to think strategically.
Ability to consider others' ideas seriously and accept feedback.
Build and maintain credibility with others.
If incumbent leads others, intermediate leadership skills including ability to: Leverage Differences.
Manage in participative manner. Develop employees. Intermediate skill/competency level: demonstrates solid knowledge and ability; can apply the competency with minimal or no guidance, in the full range of typical situations.
Requires guidance handling novel or more complex situations.
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Travelers is an equal opportunity employer.

Business Systems Analyst - SAP Plant Maintenance

Airgas, an Air Liquide company, is the leading U.S. supplier of industrial, medical and specialty gases, as well as hardgoods and related products. We are in all 50 states, which is one reason why we’re one of the largest U.S. suppliers of safety products and a leading U.S. supplier of ammonia products and process chemicals.

Perks We Offer:

For your health...Airgas provides five medical plan options through Blue Cross Blue Shield. You may choose to add Dental,Vision, Life and AD&D insurance coverage, as well as Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance. You also have 5 paid sick days each year and access to our Employee Assistance Program.
When you need a break…We offer Vacation and Paid Holidays.
For your future…Airgas wants to help you develop and establish a career path, so we offer training and love to promote from within. Additionally, we have a terrific 401(k) Retirement Plan with company match and a Tuition Assistance program, which covers undergraduate and graduate degrees

What will the Business Systems Analyst at Airgas do?

You will be responsible for development and maintenance of computer systems and business process solutions in support of Airgas Supply Chain Management business utilizing SAP functionality and various related solutions. The ability to analyze, design, test and implement systems, which enable the business community to achieve their goals and objectives, is critical to the success of this role.
What You Can Look Forward To:

Development and maintenance of Supply Chain Management functionality including:
Equipment Master
Functional Location
Class and Characteristics
Measuring Points
Preventive Maintenance
Breakdown Maintenance
Capital Maintenance
Integration with the other Supply Chain modules such as Materials Management, Project Systems as well as Order Management and Finance modules

Activities include:

Title: Business Manager

Location: Bellingham, WA

Property: TBD

Indigo Real Estate Services, Inc. is recruiting for a Community Business Manager in Bellingham, Washington. We are looking for an organized, detail-oriented, self-starter who enjoys a fast-paced work environment and takes ownership in all aspects of work.

The successful candidate will possess the ability to multitask, make smart and timely decisions with limited guidance, react with appropriate levels of urgency to situations and events that require quick response with superb communication and problem solving skills. He or she will be highly self-motivated with a strong sense of initiative, collaborative work style, and have a sophisticated business mentality. This candidate will have a passion for providing exceptional service and hospitality, exceeding peoples expectations, and find great satisfaction in helping to create community.

Job Requirements:

Responsible for all aspects of efficient property operations.

Responsible for composing and managing annual budget.

Oversee submission of all invoices and bids.

Investigate and resolve resident issues and complaints.

Promote good public relations with residents, co-workers, and company employees, vendors and goodwill to the public through a people first approach and trust representing the brand and company.

On time and accurate reporting

Able to make recommendations for revenue and rent increases and implementing those strategies.

Promote a team-based environment with both leasing office and maintenance associates.

Weekly property walks and daily vacant walks

Manage Action Items / Pursuit notes

Train, develop, mentor, set expectations, inspect what you expect, give immediate thoughtful feedback, and be proactive on Performance Management

Complete Annual Reviews for yourself in accordance with company standards

Always display a respectful, professional, friendly and courteous attitude

Assist as needed in coordinating status of make-readies with leasing staff

Complete special projects as may be assigned by Investment Manager/Director/Vice President and/or client ownership.

Maintain communitys customer base with an effective resident retention program

Generates/reviews weekly, monthly, and financial reporting

Maintain accurate resident files and organization through lease file audits.

Communicate with residents on their work order progress or delays

Maintain low delinquency by collecting rents and fees in an efficient and timely manner.

Handle evictions

Experience and understanding of Outlook, Word, & Excel
Ability to exercise quick and accurate judgment and maintain confidentiality
Effective in conflict resolution and customer service

An effective and proactive problem-solver, able to analyze all situations thoroughly in order to anticipate problems before they arise
Ability to set priorities with a strong attention to detail
Able to manage multiple-step procedures and handle frequent interruptions in work flow and work under pressure to meet firm and changing deadlines
Must be articulate and possess excellent verbal and written communication skills. Superior grammar and spelling. This role involves frequent interaction with all levels in the company including senior executives inside and outside of Indigo
Exhibits integrity, positivity, professionalism and composure at all times in all situations
Is receptive to feedback, a fast-learner, self-motivated and proactive communicator

Job Description

The Business Operations Analyst, provides analysis functions for worldwide Sales Organization including pipeline, bookings, sales productivity, incentive compensation plans, goal attainment and KPI reporting. · Assist with forecast roll-ups, pipeline, and trending reports

At Johnsonville, our members are responsible for everything! If you're passionate about making a difference, we want you to help make our products, our processes, our communities and each other better. Wisconsin-based Johnsonville is the No. 1 national sausage brand, featuring bratwurst, Italian, snack and breakfast sausages in fresh and fully cooked varieties. Founded in 1945 by the late Ralph F. and Alice Stayer, the company employs 1,800 members and remains privately owned today. Come join our family-owned company!

Johnsonville, LLC

Job Posting

Customer Insights Analyst

Sheboygan Falls, WI

Position Overview:

An Analyst on our Customer Insights team helps us sell sausage by working closely with sales, marketing, and our retail customers, providing data insights and analysis, information support and training. This position focuses on:
Engagement with our sales team and strategic retail partners
Sausage category leadership and development
Sausage selling capability and tool development
Learning to use data tools to provide insights that lead to sausage growth


Responsibilities:
Work directly with our sales and marketing teams and strategic retail partners to:
Develop customer specific analyses that explain trends, identify distribution opportunities, develop promotion recommendations, etc.
Provide syndicated POS, panel, and customer card data to drive Johnsonville and category growth
Create and analyze marketing and sales reports using a variety of reporting tools and data sources
Leverage Johnsonville pricing and assortment tools to accurately forecast volume and share based on price, promotion, or assortment changes
Build strong collaborative partnerships with cross-functional team members and research partners like IRI, Numerator, 84.51, dunnhumby, and others
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Accounting, Finance or a related field required


Experience:
Strong analytical skills with a minimum of one (1) years’ experience working successfully with numerical data and information required
Syndicated POS data tool experience (i.e. IRI Unify, Nielsen Nitro/Answers) a plus
Customer POS and loyalty card data experience (i.e. dunnhumby, 84.51, EYC) a plus
Familiarity with assortment, pricing and marketing mix analyses a plus
Basic project management experience
Experience in the CPG industry a plus


Skills:
Excellent computer skills (Excel and PowerPoint required, Access preferred)
Excellent communication, organization and presentation skills (written and oral)
Ability to tell a story with data
Genuine curiosity and desire to ask “what’s next?”
Ability to contribute to strong team environment with positive and constructive input and desire to improve the SI&A team and function
Strong desire to learn new skills quickly in a project-oriented environment, with the ability to juggle many projects at one time
Location: Global Sausage Headquarters, Sheboygan Falls, WI

(Our office is about an hour north of Milwaukee)

Member Status: Full Time, Salaried

(At Johnsonville, you are not an employee. You are a Member and, yes, Membership has its privileges – like the ability to buy sausage at great discounts. Our more traditional benefits are great, too.)

Travel: 15-25%
Reason for Posting: Member was Promoted within the Company (We love it when that happens.)

About our Company

Since 1945, our family-owned band of sausage-makers has invented better ways to make, eat and prepare crave-able sausage. Today, we are 2,000 Members strong. We sell our famous sausage in all 50 United States and more than 40 countries. We have a culture built on the idea that if we make developing your talents our top priority, great business results will follow naturally. We call it The Johnsonville Way. It has been our secret sauce for decades, and we hope you get to experience it for yourself!

Who is Cenlar?

You are.

Employee-owners have made Cenlar one of the nation’s largest mortgage subservicers. We have achieved success by empowering people with company ownership, real programs that provide avenues for advancement, and a great atmosphere that makes everyone look forward to the workday. Get your share of our success by considering the opportunity to join our team as a Business Continuity Analyst II.

Position Summary:

The Business Continuity Analyst is responsible for supporting the Business Continuity Program (BCP) which includes Business Resumption, Disaster Recovery, Incident Management, BCP testing, Training and Awareness, and all day-to-day functions required to ensure Cenlar can prepare, react, and recover from any major incident or disaster scenario. This position is also responsible for the management of significant projects, including the annual plan update process, and for acting as the primary liaison between technology infrastructure and a specific business/functional area. Incumbents in this role identify business unit requirements, support project and process specifications, coordinate with project teams, and ensure that projects are recoverable and follow established BCP guidelines. The Analyst may also write or assist in the writing of technical documentation/materials required to support and recover processes, applications, and systems. Additionally, this role supports and/or facilitates and documents testing efforts throughout the calendar year to support the BCP Testing program.

Responsibilities:
Acts as the translator between business and technology in order to ensure that project requirements and objectives are in alignment with BCP standards
Assists the business with understanding and implementing the proposed solutions
Contributes to projects as needed to conduct tasks such as facilitating project meetings, taking meeting minutes, status collection, test plans and scripts, tracking, and reporting
Interfaces and communicates with multiple teams, departments, individuals, and Third Party entities to effectively execute according Cenlar standards
Manages Incident and Disaster Event response including assisting with communications, recovery plan implementation, post event activities
Assists with recovery efforts with corporate technology departments
Assists with implementing Business Continuity Training for Cenlar managers and employees
Manages the Cenlar Safety Website
Assists with Cenlar’s Area Safety Leader (ASL) Program
Ensures the development of the core set of Disaster Recovery plans (as a part of the overall DRP) to cover systems recovery
Monitors the technology environment for incidents and/or significant changes and ensures changes are evaluated and technical recovery plans and procedures are updated and maintained at acceptable levels in reference to such incidents or changes
Coordinates the inventory and documentation of the criticality ratings for applications and infrastructure components and ensures alignment with BCP supplied RTOs and RPOs
Assists with implementing Disaster Recovery training requirements for technology managers and employees
Continually monitors, updates, and improves Cenlar’s Disaster Recovery Plan and ensures that comprehensive plan updates occur, at minimal, on an annual basis
Identifies and documents dependencies for key technology vendors and ensures a valid recovery strategy is in place, maintained, and is viable
Assists with required recovery response for any significant technology outages or disaster events including initiating and assisting with recovery plan implementation, coordinating with technology partners, representing IT Security, Business Continuity Assurance and Disaster Recovery during events, and assisting with post-event closure and follow-up activities
Represents CSO and Business Continuity during initial project phases throughout the company
Develops and coordinates annual testing along with iterative testing as needed
Maintains and supports relationship with BCP vendors and coordinates planning and recovery efforts with corporate technology departments
Represents CSO and BCP when interacting with current and potential clients
Monitors external media sources for significant events affecting Cenlar and its employees, including significant natural events such as weather and acts of nature
Develops and manages Business Continuity Training for Cenlar managers and employees
Manages emergency communications via External Emergency Notification System, Employee Hotline updates, and Emergency conference calls
Manages the Cenlar Safety Website
Manages Area Safety Leader Program
Manages and implements Safety training as needed
Manages Cenlar Safety vendors as needed
Develops, manages and coaches assigned staff and/or contract resources.
Delegates tasks and monitors progress to support the accomplishment of program objectives and provides feedback and performance evaluation on a periodic basis
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree preferred; High school diploma or GED required
3 to 5 years of Business Analysis equivalency experience
Ability to manage communication with multi-faceted team members, analytical, leadership, and organizational skills
CBCP, PMP, or Lean Six Sigma certification preferred, but not required
Exhibits strong basic executional capabilities and who are beginning to take on more responsibility
Mortgage or Financial Services experience a plus
Strong communication to articulate details and perspectives
Exhibits strong basic executional capabilities and who are beginning to take on more responsibility
Ability to elicit, analyze, articulate and document requirements with clarity - from a foundation of unexpressed or ambiguous objectives
Ability to perform under direction of the Manager, Lead Analyst demonstrating a consistent progression towards greater independence for the role
Total Rewards:

Cenlar FSB offers outstanding benefits which may include paid medical/dental/life insurance, 401k, employee ownership, tuition assistance, a supportive work environment, and genuine opportunities for advancement. Cenlar is a Drug Free Workplace and an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer -- M/F/D/V/SO .

Visit www.cenlar.com for more details.

Position: Cost Analyst, Junior - FAA

Location: Washington, DC Area

Job Summary

This position will provide cost analysis and estimating support for the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA).

Years of Relevant Experience

The position requires 0-5 years of cost analysis and estimating experience.

Essential Job Functions

The following duties are normal for this position. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from this position if the work is similar, related, and/or a logical assignment for this position. Other duties may be required and assigned.

The Cost Analyst shall provide cost estimating related support and services. The Cost Analyst shall assist customers with developing procurement solutions through the use of mathematical, statistical, and operations research techniques. The Cost Analyst shall assist in the development of complex cost studies, prepare related documentation, and assist with analysis for systems and programs. The individual’s activities include but are not limited to:
Participate in cost teams performing cost estimating and cost analysis of FAA programs.
Understand and assist in the development cost models incorporating cost risk and uncertainty through Monte Carlo discrete event simulation, documenting and presenting results, communicating with stakeholders, and attending various program meetings.
Assist with identifying and collecting cost data, preparing Work Breakdown Structures, normalizing data, performing statistical regression analysis, learning curve analysis and other analyses.
Individual will perform cost analyst duties, responsible for overall development, evaluation, and quality assurance of cost estimates, including ad-hoc special studies.
Assist with database architecture plans and development.
Provide effective verbal and written correspondence, prepare reports and presentations, as required.
Support cost research and issue paper development.
Be able to effectively work in a team environment.
Education Requirements

Bachelor’s degree required in Mathematics, Business, Engineering, or related fields.

Skills Requirements
Demonstrated skill in conducting advanced mathematical, statistical, econometric, and other scientific methods. Familiarity with the “R” statistical computing language is preferred.
Demonstrated skill in creating and maintaining databases and working with spreadsheets and complex models.
High level of proficiency with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets. Familiarity with programming macros is preferred.
Demonstrated ability to work in a dynamic work environment and ability to coordinate and perform multiple assignments.
Possess good communication skills, both written and verbal.
Demonstrated capability to work both independently and under the direction of experienced analysts.
Security Requirements

Must be a US citizen or a legal resident for three of the past five years. Must meet eligibility requirements for a US Public Trust security clearance.

Travel

Occasional travel required as needed by client/s and/or company

What if you could use your technology skills to develop a product that impacts the way communities' hospitals, homes, sports stadiums, and schools across the world are built? Construction impacts the lives of nearly everyone in the world, and yet it's also one of the world's least digitized industries, not to mention one of the most dangerous. That's why we're looking for a talented Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join us on our journey to revolutionize a historically underserved industry.

As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, you'll partner closely with our Business Analyst and Information Technology teams to turn data into insights that shine light into the health of our business, the effectiveness of our processes and initiatives, and the behavior of customers. The ideal candidate is a team player who possesses a natural curiosity about data backed by the technical ability to process and make sense of large-scale data sets.

This position will report to our Analytics Manager, and has the opportunity to be based in our Austin, TX offices located at the heart of downtown; or our headquarters in Carpinteria, CA on the bluffs overlooking the Pacific Ocean . We're looking for candidates to join us immediately.

What you'll do:
Identify business intelligence, reporting, and data analysis needs
Develop a deep understanding of the business to effectively identify and address critical issues
Provide data that is accurate, congruent and reliable, and ensure the information is easily available to users for direct consumption or integration with other systems
Educate and train customers to use data as an analytical tool, displaying the information in new forms and content for the purpose of analysis and option exploration
Partner with Business Analysts to determine business requirements, priorities, define key performance indicators and develop business intelligence and data warehouse strategy
Design, and document dashboards, alerts, and reports
Provide leadership and independent initiatives in facilitating information gathering, structured documentation, and presentation of findings to all levels of management
Conduct analyses of functional business processes and requirements and participate in the development of business cases in the support of process changes and/or IT projects
What we're looking for:
Ability to thrive in a fast paced environment and work through ambiguity
4+ years in a data analytics role with strong problem-solving skills
Degree in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Business Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics or specialized training/certification); or equivalent work experience
Strong SQL knowledge with database design experience
Ability to recognize abnormalities in trends, boundary problems and thresholds
Ability to gather cross-functional requirements and translate them into practical engineering tasks and technical deliverables
Excellent verbal and written skills with the ability to present strong data-driven storylines and content to both general and senior audiences
Demonstrated experience understanding customer needs, and independently translating them into effective solutions
Knowledge of statistical techniques and concepts is a plus (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests, etc.)
Experience with Tableau, Looker, or similar BI/Data Visualization tool
Nice to have:
Experience working with Finance and other G&A teams to translate business requirements to technical deliverables a plus
Experience with ETL and data modeling
At least a basic familiarity with programming languages like Python, Ruby, C#, etc.
Familiarity with GIT and JIRA/Agile workflows
About Us

Procore Technologies is building the software that builds the world. We provide cloud-based construction management software that helps clients more efficiently build skyscrapers, hospitals, housing complexes, and more. Our headquarters is located on the bluffs above the Pacific Ocean in Carpinteria, CA, with growing offices worldwide. Check us out on Glassdoor to see what others are saying about working at Procore.

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome builders of all backgrounds. We thrive in a diverse, dynamic and inclusive environment. We do not tolerate discrimination against employees on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other classification protected by law.

Perks & Benefits

You are a person with dreams, goals, and ambitions—both personally and professionally. That's why we believe in providing benefits that not only match our Procore values (Openness, Optimism, and Ownership) but enhance the lives of our team members. Here are just a few of our benefit offerings: competitive health care plans, unlimited paid vacation, stock options, employee enrichment and development programs, and volunteer days.

Job Title: Business Intelligence Consultant III - Growing Healthcare Organization
Job Description:
About Fallon Health
Founded in 1977, Fallon Health is a leading health care services organization that supports the diverse and changing needs of those we serve. In addition to offering innovative health insurance solutions and a variety of Medicaid and Medicare products, we excel in creating unique health care programs and services that provide coordinated, integrated care for seniors and individuals with complex health needs. Fallon has consistently ranked among the nation’s top health plans, and is accredited by the National Committee for Quality Assurance for its HMO, Medicare Advantage and Medicaid products. For more information, visit www.fallonhealth.org.
The Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant works closely with business and IT teams to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions. They partner with the business to determine business needs, priorities, define KPI’s and establish BI strategy. This includes the design, and implementation of dashboards, reports and other various BI applications.
BI Consultants develop and implement BI solutions that enable the business to use data as an analytical tool, displaying the information in new forms for the purpose of analysis, exploration, prescriptive/predictive analytics and reporting. Key to this role is establishing the BI enterprise architecture and BI design standards that will support the Fallon Health BI strategy. The BI Consultant plays an important role in advancing the Fallon Health BI maturity path by providing the necessary consultation, education, and capabilities in order to meet our corporate and strategic goals.

• Works on highly complex, cross-functional, and enterprise BI solutions.
• Provides subject matter expertise for key BI functions.
• Provide expertise in design, development and implementation of Business Intelligence (BI) and analytics systems.
• Delivers BI architecture consultation, recommendations and designs.
• Implements report and semantic layer design standards and BI best practices.
• Establishes visualization best practices.
• Expertise in data warehouse concepts, dimensional, physical and logical models.
• Recommends quality metrics and ensures metrics are documented and tracked.
• Contributes to the BI strategic direction for the enterprise.
• Establishes the BI education series for the enterprise.
• Stays abreast of BI products/tools.
• Defines information quality metrics.

• Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent work experience.
• Expert knowledge of SAP Business Objects and other relevant BI solutions.
• Typically requires 7+ years of BI consulting and development experience.
• Healthcare background preferred.
• Business Object 4.2 - Web Intelligence, Crystal Reports
• SQL Server – SSMS, SSIS
• Alteryx
• Visualization tools
• MS Office including Visio
• Others
Fallon Health provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Job Description
The business development analyst role at Red Balloon Security is intended for an MEM or MBA with a desire to excel in the cyber security industry.
This role supports the activities of Red Balloon Security through analysis, business development, and project management. The analyst will support Red Balloon Security's contract negotiation teams, develop relationships with customers, and participate in trade shows and demonstrations. Business analysts are often called upon to assist with accounting and perform project management tasks. There is also the opportunity to help develop Red Balloon Security's high level business strategy. A person in this role will also research commercial and government markets for embedded devices and embedded device security. The business analyst will be expected to analyze collected data, determine what the data represents, identify trends, opportunities, and key decision makers, and present such findings to the internal management team.

Additionally, Business Development Analysts are expected to:
Become comfortable with cyber security culture
Be able to collect and synthesize data from a variety of sources using a variety of tools
Develop quality reports and presentations
Research and identify key decision makers, both within companies and within government
Be on top of industry publications, speaking and networking events
Required Skills and Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree
Excellent writing skills
High level of creativity, self-initiative and self-motivation
Preferred Skills and Qualifications
An understanding of embedded devices
An understanding of cyber security technology trends
Basic knowledge of contract law
Experience in project management
An understanding of accounting principles
MBA or MEM

POSITION: DIGITAL CHANNEL BUSINESS ANALYST

Summary:

The Digital Channel Business Analyst will be a part of the Digital Banking Team and will report to the Digital Channel Product Manager. The Digital Channel Business Analyst is responsible for all performance measurement and analytics functions that support the growth and ongoing management of the Digital Channels. The scope of this role includes performance reporting, cost analysis, trend analysis, customer relationship analytics, sales and service support tools management and preparing presentations.

Key Result Areas:
Support the Digital Channel Product Manager by analyzing data and preparing reports and presentations that help drive business outcomes as related to the strategic plan and initiatives
Create and publish daily and weekly performance reporting packs that include various analytics and KPIs designed to illustrate the overall performance of the Digital Channels
Make tactical recommendations to the Head of Digital Banking and the Digital Channel Product Manager of activities designed to address negative trends in performance
Develop monitoring processes to evaluate the impact of performance remediation activities that are implemented to address trends
Develop professional and persuasive PowerPoint presentations
Create a monthly, year over year, performance analysis illustrating performance trends in all Digital Channel categories
Responsible for conducting analyses that illustrate customer product and service usage trends and overall account opening and closing behavior at the customer level
Serves as Digital Channel’s primary liaison to the Bank’s Finance reporting group and Data Management team and collaboratively develops financial views of key information
Serve on various project teams that support key Digital Channel initiatives
Perform additional duties as required
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree plus 5+ years of analytical experience
5+ years of experience working with T-SQL and PL-SQL
Ability to analyze vast data sets and produce clear reporting based on intended objective
Proficiency all Microsoft Office Programs; high level of proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint
Effective project management skills and the ability to prioritize and organize multiple assignments
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively across multiple departments
Effective in making business decisions quickly and independently
Strong written communication skills
The above description covers the most significant responsibilities but does not exclude other occasional responsibilities and accountabilities, the inclusion of which would be in conformity with the major purpose of this job.

Location:

Waltham, Massachusetts

PRIMARY FUNCTION:

Senior PeopleSoft Business Analyst serves as a facilitator and functional resource for Jefferson’s PeopleSoft HCM application. The Sr. PeopleSoft Business Analyst provides functional application expertise for various PeopleSoft Modules (HR, Benefits Administration, Profile Management, Candidate Gateway, Performance Management, and Position Management). This position will provide leadership for reviewing new business processes and solution designs to ensure that cross-functional teams fully understand the impact of decisions made during system configuration. The Senior PeopleSoft Business Analyst will gather and document requirements, define and document setup and configuration, review technical specifications, and may conduct and facilitate fit/gap analysis and design sessions. This position will provide functional support for PeopleSoft enhancements and customizations from concept to completion, helping to drive the successful implementation and maintenance of the Oracle PeopleSoft HCM system.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Analyze business end-user needs, document requirements and translate into proper business user specifications.
Consult with business end-users regarding issue management, business process design and business optimization.
Support the implementation and maintenance of the Jefferson's PeopleSoft HCM 9.x system from a functional configuration perspective.
Act as a business advocate and liaison for various projects with varying budgets and durations.
Support and apply the appropriate project management methodology.
Responsible for functional product knowledge of HR applications and assist and educate end-users on the use of the system, including reporting tools.
Act as the primary liaison to business end-users and technical team through the project and project support life-cycle.
Ensure project and production support success through timely issue resolution and proactive assistance and monitoring of deliverables.
EDUCATIONAL/TRAINING REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor’s degree in business administration, computer science or a closely related field, Masters preferred

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, AND REGISTRATION:

Oracle/PeopleSoft HCM Certification preferred

EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
7+ years of PeopleSoft HCM Functional design experience
Previous experience in a HR business operations role, including a proficient understanding of business and industry issues.
Previous experience with at least 1 full-life cycle PeopleSoft implementation as a functional team member and/or team lead.
Previous experience with at least one, preferably two full-life cycles PeopleSoft upgrades as a functional team member and/or team lead.
High proficiency in PeopleSoft 9.x HRMS including core HR product, eApplications and other available HCM products (ie. Time & Labor, Workforce Analytics, ePerformance, etc.)
Highly proficient in the use of a full-system life cycle methodology; high exposure to project management methodology.
Experience in a consulting environment is a plus.
Experience in the health care or university setting is a plus.
Familiarity with technology and business use of technology is a necessity in order to provide direction for business processes and product enhancements.
Excellent organizational skills, proving efficiency in ability to multi-task, with attention to detail.
Display vision, initiative and practical application.
Have a strong customer focus and be results driven.
Proven ability to interact across multiple levels of the business.
Ability to work unsupervised.
Strong team building skills.
Strong analytical and decision making skills.
High proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Jefferson Health delivers state of the art healthcare services to patients throughout the Delaware Valley and southern New Jersey. Jefferson (Philadelphia University + Thomas Jefferson University) provides more than 8,400 full and part-time students from nearly 40 states and 40 countries with 21st century professional education. Combined, we have over 30,000 employees.

Jefferson Health, with 14 hospitals (seven are Magnet designated by the ANCC for nursing excellence) and 40+ outpatient and urgent care locations, offers a broad range of primary and complex, highly specialized care that touches the lives of more than four million patients annually. U.S. News & World Report has ranked Thomas Jefferson University Hospital among the nation’s best in eight specialties. Jefferson Health also includes the NCI designated Sidney Kimmel Cancer Center; it is one of only 70 such centers in the nation.

Thomas Jefferson University has ten colleges and three schools that offer more than 160 undergraduate and graduate programs. Our University is dedicated to inter-professional and transdisciplinary approaches to learning that offer a vibrant and expandable platform for professional education. Through this unique model, we are preparing our students for current and yet to be imagined careers.

As an employer, Jefferson maintains a commitment to provide equal access to employment. Jefferson values diversity and encourages applications from women, members of minority groups, LGBTQ individuals, disabled individuals, and veterans.

Job Description:
Building Bridges, Moving Ahead
Work hard. Play hard. Breathe Easy. That’s a nutshell description of the professionals who thrive at Resurgent. Regardless of their position, our people are ambitious and entrepreneurial, attracted to the fresh point-of-view of an evolving, growing company. They are personable and patient, attracted to the collaborative nature of our company. And they are centered, understanding the balance needed to achieve success at work and harmony at home.

Summary

This individual will leverage analytics, problem solving skills, and project management skills to execute and identify new business strategies that increase net revenue for our existing judgment portfolio. Critical thinking skills, Lean process improvement skills, and an ability to quickly understand new ideas or strategies are critical to success in this role.

Essential Functions/Responsibilities

Data Analysis and Reporting (35%)
Delves into business line reporting and data cubes to obtain data, identify trends, recognize anomalies, inform decisions for judgment recoveries
Aggregates large data sets and presents the best graphical depiction of performance in monthly meetings
