Designs experiments to test and monitor performance of potential strategies identifying the factors that drive
performance, and communicates results
Process Management (35%)
Acquires and maintains a working knowledge of existing business processes, servicer performance metrics, scorecard methodologies, and reporting
Partners with business partners to coordinate and mitigate downstream impacts of process improvement changes to other segments of business
Identifies and monitors key performance metrics that should be impacted by a process change and seeks to understand unexpected results
Understands the business application of predictive models
Stays abreast of industry and regulatory trends that may impact new and existing strategies
Project Management (30%)
Translates business requirements into detailed action items for those impacted by the change and works with them to create an implementation plan. Consults with subject matter experts to understand the impact of project initiatives to other business lines/processes.
Consistently demonstrates strong communication and listening skills, conveys new ideas to a diverse audience, understands potential concerns, anticipates, addresses and communicates obstacles encountered throughout the lifecycle of a project.
May travel to servicers with performance managers in order to assess new strategies, systems, or understand strategy adoption
Requirements/Skills
Bachelor’s Degree required (analytical or quantitative field preferred such as Economics, Finance, Engineering, Business, Mathematical Sciences, etc.)
1-4 years of experience in a related position preferred
Advanced skills in Excel (charts, formulas, pivot tables) required
Comfortable with “quick math”: the ability to quickly discern accuracy, spot trends/problems, and size up opportunity
Orientation for detail, coupled with organizational and project management skills
Ability to multi-task, respond well to pressure and deadlines, and work well individually and in a team environment
Flexible to changing priorities, project scopes, and deadlines
Strong business communication skills with an ability to work well in a collaborative environment
Capable of navigating data structures and organizing large data sets
Experience using programming languages or reporting software a plus

Position Purpose:

This is a highly visible role in the bank in which the incumbent will interact extensively with business units, and management throughout the bank. This positions primary focus is on the Operational Risk Department’s responsibilities related to the risk assessment process as well as overall enhancements to the Bank’s internal control environment.

Responsibilities/Duties/Function/Tasks:
Develops, recommends changes, and implements policies and procedures for improving the Bank’s operational risk management governance.
Develops and implements strategies for the identification, assessment, measurement, monitoring, and reporting of, operational risk across the Bank as well as evaluating the application of various risk mitigations.
Coordinate risk scoping, pre-planning, scheduling, and resourcing of risk assessment activities.
Leads facilitated risk assessment workshops with risk team members for completion of the annual risk assessment report.
Identify and evaluate material risks and associated controls; credibly challenge BU’s assessment when necessary.
Track and monitor action plans related to risk assessments; ensure adequate, timely closure.

Manages departmental internal controls and regulatory issues.

Strong verbal and written communications skills that promote effective working relationships in a team-oriented environment.
Strong organization and presentation skills.

Parchment is a Scottsdale, AZ based software-as-a-service education company. Our mission is to unleash education credentials by unlocking the critical data they embody. We are fundamentally changing how transcripts and other education credentials are moved and used. Our customers include more than 10 state departments of education, nearly 9,000 schools and universities and hundreds of thousands of individuals trust and rely on Parchment software to manage and deliver millions of transcripts and other student records each year.

The associate business analyst is responsible for overseeing the planning, requirements analysis, implementation and tracking of implementations of Parchment software for higher education clients.

Job Title: Management Consultant/Sr. Consultant (Life Sciences) NY, NJ and Boston
Job Description:
COMPANY SUMMARY

Acquis Consulting Group is a consulting firm specializing in strategy and implementation. We partner with clients to enable growth that is both measurable and meaningful. We help our partners create new ways to think about their business, but we don’t stop there. We see projects through and help implement business ideas, turning them into lasting business value.

Acquis serves both domestic and international organizations from our headquarters in New York City and offices in California, Massachusetts and New Jersey. Acquis supports industry leading enterprises through high profile projects that span strategy and execution.

COMPANY CULTURE

We sustain our culture through careful analysis of new and experienced hires and go to great lengths to hire individuals that will add to the experience of working at Acquis. Our core values at Acquis are People First, Advance Together and Think +Do.

People First:One of our greatest priorities is to attract, develop, and retain top talent. Accordingly, we have created a “second family” environment where each individual has an opportunity and obligation to contribute to our shared success. We measure this success not only through our delivery excellence but through the satisfaction of the people that work here. We believe that we have created a unique environment that balances autonomy with responsibility, offering the ability to learn by doing while providing a careful balance of oversight. Acquis is a learning organization that is built on the premise that our employees can add value from day one.

Advance Together: Acquis brings insight, passion, and intelligence to the lasting relationships we establish with leading enterprises. We measure ourselves through our clients’ success utilizing the agility, creativity, and focus of a smaller firm.

Think+Do: Acquis provides our clients with strategic insights and also helps deliver them. Acquis consultants can advise our clients on their critical business issues, develop creative ways to address their challenges, and help implement these solutions.

POSITION OVERVIEW

Acquis Consulting Group is seeking experience and skilled consultants to be an Associate/Senior Associate for our offices in New York, New Jersey, and Boston - Biotech/Pharma practice.

Candidates must have 4-6+ years of relevant consulting experience with a preferred focus on areas that include pharma, biotech, and medical affairs. Other required experience includes client interaction, project planning, project management, and strategic planning. Comfort with and at least conceptual understanding of technology, such as databases and statistical analysis tools, is preferred.

Credit Acceptance is proud to be an award-winning company! Our history of excellence and growth has resulted in many exciting career opportunities. Job Title: IT Business Analyst / Finance PM - Temporary
Job Description:
Gainsight™ is a venture-backed, fast growing tech company revolutionizing Customer Success for businesses. The Customer Success company helps businesses grow faster by reducing churn, increasing upsell, and driving customer advocacy. Gainsight provides a complete, end-to-end Customer Success solution through its services and technology. The industry-leading platform helps companies manage customers relationships effectively, track customer health and transform the way organizations orient around the customer. Gainsight is the platform of choice for many leading companies like Box, Adobe and Workday. The company has been recognized as one of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world by Forbes, one of the fastest growing private companies in America by Inc. Magazine, and as one of 20 Great Workplaces in Tech by Fortune Magazine. Gainsight's CEO, Nick Mehta, has been recognized as one of the Top SaaS CEOs in America. The company has offices in California, Phoenix, St. Louis, London and India.

With diversity and inclusion at the forefront of Gainsight's core values, we promote a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusiveness at Gainsight, regardless of, but not limited to, race, gender, sexual orientation, family status, religion, ethnicity, national origin, physical disability, veteran status, or age.

Job Description


Lead critical Finance projects working with the Finance team, other departments, and vendors to deliver improved processes and systems (including new implementations as needed). This role requires an excellent balance of financial expertise, financial systems experience, and project management skills. Should be comfortable with a global, fast paced, multi-tasking startup environment and possess excellent communication skills for any audience. Expertise in Revenue Accounting and Revenue systems is required. This position will support our RevPro implementation.

This is a 5 to 6 month Temporary Position.

What You'll Do
Lead Finance projects to support Quote to Cash, Revenue, Expense Management, Compensation, and other Finance related business processes. Immediate focus will be on our RevPro implementation and the Quote to Cash process/system changes needed to support it.
Projects may include finance operations, process analysis & optimization, systems implementation & testing, process documentation, and training.
Evaluate business processes, anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement, develop and implement solutions.
Prepare cost-benefit analyses for projects across departments and manage project financials.
Work with department managers, team members, and vendors to implement a project schedule and ensure that teams meet milestones throughout the project lifecycle.
Take an active role in preventing delays and ensuring that deliverables are completed according to schedule.
Build and work with cross-functional teams. Coordinate across departments and motivate staff members to complete projects according to both internal and external deadlines.
Communicate with both team members and executives during the project lifecycle. Present findings to stakeholders and effectively communicate between team members and departments.
Required Skills


What We're Looking For
Combination of Finance knowledge, system implementation experience, and project management skills.
Experience with 606 Revenue in general, with RevPro specific experience being highly desired.
A bachelor's degree in business or IT or an MBA or equivalent work experience.
A minimum of 10 years experience as a Finance or IT project manager or analyst
Knowledge and experience working with Revenue Accounting systems
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
Job Benefits


At Gainsight, we don't believe in doing things as a "means to an end." Life's too short to have anything short of a joyful work environment that we passionately believe in. We think that "work vs. life" is a false choice created by pundits, cynics and consultants. We also believe that any community (like a company) needs a ton of diversity and a very small number of things that bring us together.

Here are our 5 core values
Golden Rule: We try to practice the Golden Rule ("Do unto others..." and that sort of thing) by exercising reliability, trust and giving back to each other and our community.
Success for All: We believe that success for our stakeholders—whether our teammates, clients or shareholders—comes with a sincere focus on continuous learning, selfless teaching and making a difference in each other's lives.
Child-like Joy: We aspire to experience child-like joy in our work and lives, injecting a spirit of passion, optimism and laughter into everything that we do.
Shoshin: We believe in a beginner's mind. Don't surround yourself with people like you--diversity breeds creativity.
Stay Thirsty, My Friends: We believe in a totally internally-driven strive for greatness. The solution is think more, not doing more.
Why You'll Love It Here
Our Attitude: We've created a new industry from scratch, and we're on the fast track!
Our Leadership: We offer the leading tech solution for driving Customer Success.
Our ROI: Reduce customer churn, increase up-sell, and improve customer satisfaction.
Our Technology: Deep Salesforce.com hooks, predictive analytics, and a beautiful user interface.
Our Impact: We help our customers make millions of dollars more per year.
Our Clients: Big companies like Box, Adobe, Marketo, and many others.
Our Team: Tech all-stars from Facebook, Box, and others (and top consulting firms like BCG and McKinsey!).
Our Values: They are unique - Golden Rule, Success for All, Childlike Joy, Shoshin, and Stay Thirsty, My Friends
Our Office: If you showed up one day, you might find anything from karaoke performances to mini-golf championships.
Role is in our San Mateo, CA office.

Gainsight is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, where applicable, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

The Jr. Supply Chain Business Analyst (SCBA) is responsible for planning, developing and executing solutions that will focus on continuous improvements of the business’ entire supply chain, initiating with new product development, strategic sourcing and supporting effective demand planning through customer satisfaction. The Analyst will support and optimize parts order management, warehouse management, 3PL and logistics management systems. Also the JSCBA will assist and improve Vendor Managed Inventory (VMI) and support Vendor Performance Assessment process. Additionally this position will be responsible for monitoring progress on specific Supply Chain projects. Moreover, by partnering with both the IT and Supply Chain functions, this role will develop, implement, and provide training on supply chain application solutions.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following: Other duties may be assigned.
Compile and analyze data from all areas of supply chain and provide recommendations to gain efficiencies and provide more responsive execution of internal processes as well as external support to the AERCO commercial team.
Develop tools and methods that streamline maintenance and updating of master data.
Able to identify IT projects related to assigned applications to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of Supply Chain activities.

Develop reporting methods that allow for quick identification of issues and areas of improvement.

Prepare charts and diagrams to assist in data analysis; Use data for defined Key Performance Indicators such as: 1) Fill Rate Improvement (production downtime); 2) Backorder reduction; 3) Excess, slow moving and obsolete inventory 4) On time delivery improvements; 5) Inventory Turns, Total spend relative to demand and adjustments; 6) Supplier performance, and other KPI’s defined by the Executive team.

Define work plans; coordinate project status reporting and conducts user/team training on system capabilities.
Work with functional users in a variety of departments (e.g. Purchasing, Finance, Sales, Operations, etc) to gain a comprehensive understanding of their business processes and system needs. Use that knowledge to translate the business needs and create programs / systems.
Work with the Supply Chain Manager to Document business processes “as is” today against the future “to be” state. Critically review and recommend changes to processes in part or in their entirety.
Create and/or assist in developing written procedures for department.
Train users to best utilize business systems, processes, and reports.

Job Description

Assist and participate in project reviews, revisions, production problem corrections, enhancements, and usability testing of any functionality required to administer policy sales and servicing in the NPS and ANA operating systems. Assist as a liaison between developer and end-users, provide technical support to successfully implement system changes to the comprehensive policy and agency management system to comply with filed programs for multiple states, companies, products and lines of business. Increase business and system knowledge.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.
Prepare test plans and scenarios for usability testing, execute test scenarios, approve project implementation and verify the production output upon implementation
Responsible for verifying the accuracy of new states/ products, rate revisions, projects, and production problem corrections, to ensure a quality product
Formulate the test strategy for testing through analysis of system requirements which includes participating in meetings to discuss specifications
Assist in project planning, incorporating system considerations for various operational areas, and submit the request for programming changes
With supervision, coordinate and document the resolution of problems encountered during and subsequent to the usability testing
Assist in performing quality control procedures in the production environment
Perform other duties as requested
Minimum Skills and Competencies:

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Bachelor Degree or in-lieu of degree equivalent education, training and work-related experience
Strong attention to detail, organization skills, and timeliness in order to meet customer expectations
Demonstrates strong problem solving skills
Demonstrates effective listening, communicate, interaction, discretion, and diplomacy skills
Must possess effective verbal and written communication skills to interact with business and technical resources
Must perform well in high-energy, dynamic and team-oriented environment
Effective organization and time management skills with the ability to work under pressure and adhere to aggressive project deadlines
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to establish working relationships with individuals at varying levels within the organization
Demonstrates a general understanding of the insurance industry and organizational relationships of the company
Desired Skills:
Previous Property and Casualty Insurance experience strongly preferred
Prior project management experience preferred
Demonstrates the ability to understand and translate user needs into business specifications
Demonstrates working knowledge of company operating systems and processes including a working knowledge of the policy administration system
Demonstrates the ability to conduct investigation and research into system errors and discrepancies
Demonstrates skill in the development of test plans and test cases through thorough analysis of requirements

Successful completion of all preliminary actuarial exams and at least one Associateship level exam within the Casualty Actuarial Society

Understanding of and experience building Generalized Linear Models

Ability to present data and analysis results in a simple and clear manner

Ability to collaborate with others to solve business problems and gain buy-in

Paid training, tuition assistance and career development.
Casual dress (yes, you can wear jeans to work!)
Healthcare standard benefits (medical, dental, vision)

Here at Scotts Miracle-Gro there is no such thing as a typical day. Our culture is constantly energized by new and exciting growth opportunities and at a rapid pace. Every Associate plays an important role in providing innovative solutions for today’s gardeners and growers and contributing new ideas to improve operations. In our company you need grit, it is what we were founded on over 150 years ago and is what keeps us growing. Regardless of your level in the organization there is a platform for your voice to be heard and the ability to influence change. Family, community and hard working values are weaved into all that we do. Come grow with us, where we develop and nurture the next generation of leaders.

We are looking for an Analyst, Emerging Technology who will join our Information Technology team in Marysville, OH.

This position will be based at The Scotts Miracle-Gro world headquarters in Marysville, a suburb of Columbus, OH. Not familiar with Columbus? Visit columbusregion.com/columbus-2020/

In this position, you will help identify and research emerging technologies in the Information Technology (IT) industry that will enable Scotts Miracle-Gro to address current and future IT opportunities. You will be performing analysis and developing recommendations for technology use and performing proof-of-concept exercises for selected technologies. You will be documenting results and these are used by solution architects and others in making future technology decisions. You will be a member of a highly-collaborative and fast-paced team that is intensely focused on using IT to enable the Scotts Miracle-Gro business to grow and deliver ever-improving products and services to our customers.

What you’ll do in this role:
Maintain awareness of new technologies and their ability to provide a competitive edge.
Produce in-depth documents on key emerging technology topics, including analysis of technology, commercialization, application, and supply chain. These documents will identify the strengths of the new technology, the implications of their use, and cite the appropriate use cases for those technologies.
Produce a monthly report summarizing key developments across the emerging technology sector.
Look for opportunities to leverage technology to achieve business unit objectives.
Work with stakeholders and project teams to prioritize requirements.
Work with stakeholders to perform proof-of-concept exercises with selected new technologies.
Contribute short articles for other publications and blog posts.
What you’ll need to be successful:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math or Physical Sciences.
5 years of progressive experience in the areas of IT infrastructure and/or development areas
Excellent interpersonal skills are a critical success factor for this role.
Critical thinking and analytical skills.
Ability to consistently and clearly communicate verbally and in writing with a variety of audiences at their respective levels of technology understanding.
Ability to work independently as well as a member of a highly-collaborative team.
Excellent planning and prioritization skills to enable consistent and timely delivery of work products.
What we do for you (just to list a few cool ones):
Offer extremely competitive benefits including: Health, Dental and Vision coverage.
Onsite wellness center which includes: 24,000 sq. ft. fitness center, Walgreens pharmacy and Doctor’s office. Nutrition reimbursement program (up to $200 per associate and per spouse)
Beautiful campus and corporate offices designed like a log cabin offering free coffee, chef run cafe and the best crushed ice!
First day of hire, 401K match (up to 7.5%) and discounted stock purchasing program (15% discount).
Our commitment to diversity and inclusion includes four employee resource groups: Scotts Women’s Network, Scotts Black Employee Network, Scotts Veterans Network and Scotts Young Professionals.
12 SMG paid holiday days and generous vacation policy.

Job Description:
Company:
Arthrex
Requisition ID: 45464
Title: Software QA III
Division: Arthrex, Inc. (US01)
Location: Naples, FL

Main Objective:

Arthrex, a growing medical device manufacturer, is looking for an Integrations Test Analyst with the responsibility for leading and testing interfaces to/from SAP and to/from other software applications. The Integrations Test Analyst is expected to possess strong experience in interface/integration testing principles, processes and methods including a good understanding of middleware technology. The Integrations Test Analyst will perform coordination and collaboration functions across different SAP and Non-SAP application teams frequently interacting with internal customers (i.e Project Managers, Test Supervisors, Test Leads and Analysts, Business Analysts, and Developers) within the IT division of Arthrex and will lead a small offshore test team. The Analyst will be part of a dynamic software test team with established standards and processes in place supporting best practices in both manual and automating testing of new integrations, enhancements, upgrades, and fixes.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Work independently, often leading a test team, under general supervision of SQA manager or supervisor with latitude for independent judgement, to evaluate and test computer software applications used by various business units within Arthrex.
Apply test methodology, as well as business process and application knowledge, in the design of tests and testing strategies. Based on business and functional requirements, identify testing scenarios, determine all types of testing to be performed, and develop test cases or reviews those written by test team.
Execute planned and exploratory testing, utilizing manual and automated test cases, to assure the quality of an application’s usability, functionality and security. Document actual test results and defects.
Communicate issues identified during testing activities to application development team and provide recommended process/application improvements to management.
Estimate effort for tasks assigned, develop project schedule, assign tasks to testers, and provide status of daily progress to test lead or management.
Represent SQA on application/project teams and in software development, project planning, and requirement gathering meetings. Attend project status meetings and provide SQA status, work with PM to define SQA tasks and estimates for the project schedule. Manage SQA tasks and deadlines as test lead for assigned project(s).
Lead testing projects, especially medium to large projects, thus being responsible for all test planning and reporting activities and ensure Arthrex SQA standards and procedures are followed.
Define and track SQA metrics such as requirements coverage, test case readiness, test execution progress, and defect counts and statistics in the Arthrex Test Management tool(s).
Develop, and/or oversee the development of, all testing artifacts – test cases, automated test scripts, test plan document, test summary report, and requirement traceability matrix – in the Arthrex Test Management tool(s) and in the SQA/Arthex project repository systems using Arthrex standard templates.
Perform peer reviews and internal audits of project documentation.
Prepare knowledge documents and provide cross training to team members.
Act as application SME and therefore is the point of contact within SQA for education of testers on assigned applications.
Mentor junior-level analysts.
Recommend new internal projects to utilize or enhance automation and increase efficiencies.
May assist in release management /production deployment activities.
Follow SQA standards and procedures.
Incidental Duties:

The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed in this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, and indeed additional responsibilities may be assigned, as required, by management.

Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field required.
Minimum five years of experience in Software Quality Assurance performing GUI, Functional, Interface/Integration and Regression testing of SAP applications & and non-SAP applications (packaged and/or custom developed).
Integration/Interface/File Transfer and Data Migration (ETL) knowledge required.
Experience with testing relational databases, SQL, Oracle or XML. Basic to advanced database querying skills required.
Experience with testing business applications running on SAP & Non-SAP platforms required.
SAP ECC knowledge and testing experience required.
Knowledge of various middleware technologies (SAP PI, WebServices, ABAP-WS, Mulesoft, Oracle SOA, etc.) and end-to-end testing experience preferred.
Knowledge of EDI & IDOCs (Inbound and Outbound) preferred.
Experience with using HP ALM, Solution Manager 7.2 or equivalent Test Management tool required.
Experience with using (running scripts) and developing automation scripts in HP UFT, SOAPUI Pro, Worksoft, Tosca or equivalent Test Automation tool preferred.
Experience in testing emergency application defects in production systems, system patches, maintenance releases, enhancement releases, and implementations of new applications required.
Experience in analyzing business, functional, and technical requirements/specifications and developing and executing structured/methodical test cases to prove fulfillment of requirements and viability of application usage and functionality required.
Experience in leading testing projects and coordinating and managing tasks of team members with strong offshore-onsite coordination skills across different regions/countries and vendors.
Knowledge and Skill Requirements/Specialized Courses and/or Training:
Working knowledge of the Software Development Life cycle and SAP SQA’s role in it through proven explanation of the process.
Solid understanding of programming languages including application, database, and services layers.
Demonstrated ability to document test plans, test cases, test execution, defects & test results. As well as capability to create and maintain test data. Knowledge around Test Data Management.
Strong collaboration and coordination skills to follow up on test environment readiness.
Demonstrated problem solving, organizational, and analytical skills. High attention to detail and accuracy.
Project management skills with ability to identify urgencies, risks and competing priorities and constraints; to prioritize tasks for team members; and to meet project deadlines.
Excellent communication skills, presentation skills and a customer service orientation.
ISTQB Foundation Level certification (CTFL) preferred.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Job Title: Sr. Strategy and Business Development Analyst
Job Description:
Sr. Strategy and Business Development Analyst

The Senior Strategy and Business Analyst performs in-depth, highly sophisticated data analysis and research, in support of planning activities and strategic growth initiatives across the organization.

The Senior Analyst works as a member of the Strategy & Business Development team to create analytically rigorous, actionable insights and recommendations that identify and evaluate growth opportunities and drive business decision-making. Reports to the AVP, Strategy and Business Development and collaborates with Strategy and Business Development team members and others in analysis, strategic planning and business plan development activities.

PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Performs analysis by accessing a wide-range of quantitative and qualitative information, including market and trend data, physician productivity, and clinical technology. Acquires external benchmarks and information sets, including competitor market share and clinical service deployment.
Analyzes large data sources to understand key drivers of the business and trends and uses fact-based analysis to support and enhance decision making, support new program/service design and establish program/service performance benchmarks.
Manipulates and displays quantitative and qualitative information to reflect the synthesis, summary and translation of data to deliver a strategic actionable message and recommendations. Makes novel connections between data sets.
Tells compelling stories with data. Uses artistic visualization techniques and tools (e.g., Tableau, Mapping/GIS) to make information memorable.
Produces, develops and enhances routine reports issued by the department.
Conducts broad-based analysis across all clinical Institutes, leveraging experiences and learnings from one project to the next to participate in an ongoing cycle of improvement.
Identifies and develops opportunities for data transformation and process efficiencies to support departmental initiatives. Supports and enhances team’s data repository and associated reports; provides training and insights to other team members as necessary.
Delivers presentations.
Sources and maintains library of diverse data sources, model documents, templates, and other reusable knowledge assets.
Supports data/software users throughout organization to extract market and other data sets as well as managing and mining large data sources.
Ensures credible and current access to strategic market intelligence relative to competitors; monitors and analyzes trends in the environment (e.g. local, regional and national).
Support strategic and operating plan processes.
Completes core components of business plans (e.g., market and service assessments).
Generates adhoc reports independently.

Skills and Experience for success in this role:

Education:
Bachelor’s Degree in statistics, business, finance, healthcare economics, market research, or related field required.
Minimum of five years related professional experience in designing, producing, and interpreting quantitative and qualitative analysis required.
OR
MBA or MHA required. Minimum of three years related professional experience required.
Extensive experience in Health Care Strategic Planning or consumer marketing research will be considered.

Experience/Skills:
Healthcare industry knowledge, as exemplified by working knowledge of DRG's and ICD-10 codes, service lines, and specialty medicine required.
Demonstrates healthcare experience, with emphasis on business analytics and market assessment skills.
Demonstrates strong analytical, problem solving, strategic thinking, critical thinking, decision modeling and organizational skills.
Demonstrates ability to tell compelling stories using data and data visualization techniques.
Demonstrates the ability to understand broad strategic issues and apply analytics to deliver recommendations.
Demonstrates project development, facilitation and leadership, both with peers and senior level health system leaders.
Demonstrated knowledge of financial analysis, including ability to perform financial analyses to identify and evaluate business opportunities
Demonstrates proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Access. Proficiency with dashboard reporting software and data query tools (Tableau, Business Objects, AltoSoft, and/or SQL) is desirable but not required.
Demonstrates ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
Demonstrates excellent written and oral communication skills. Must be able to produce examples of written reports.
Demonstrates ability to prepare and present high level presentations. Must be able to produce examples of presentations and related support materials.
Experience with facility planning, contracts and strategies around facility growth

Trex Company, the world’s number one decking and railing brand, and leader in high-performance, low-maintenance outdoor living products, is seeking a Technical Support Analyst to monitor and maintain computer systems, and provide support to both local and remote employees.

Help us deliver what’s next in outdoor living by troubleshooting and assisting with systems, networks and peripherals.

As our next Technical Support Analyst, you are skilled at technical support and services, and you are comfortable with set up, maintenance, tracking and troubleshooting hardware and software for end-user devices. You have strong problem solving, communication and technical skills, and you are comfortable setting priorities.

Talented employees are just one of Trex Company’s trademarks. This is your chance to work for a company consistently awarded recognition for market leadership and innovation. Trex outdoor living products offer significant design flexibility with fewer ongoing maintenance requirements than wood, as well as a truly environmentally responsible choice. Trex decking products contain 95 percent recycled content and we are one of the largest plastic scrap recyclers in the U.S. Our organization kept more than 800 million pounds of plastic and wood scrap out of landfills annually.

Besides working for the company known for its recycling heritage and as a creator of amazing outdoor living spaces, Trex employees enjoy an industry-leading compensation and benefits package, bonuses and incentive programs, tuition assistance, a six percent 401(k) match, and more: trex.com/careers.

Key Duties and Responsibilities:
Prioritize and respond to IT help desk tickets.
Recommend, plan and implement Windows desktop and mobile device management changes.
Aid on Windows server and networking projects as needed.
Track, monitor and document interaction on tickets for timely resolution.
Diagnose and troubleshoot connectivity issues for employees.
Build out, configure and support new personal computers, mobile devices and barcode scanners.
Diagnose and troubleshoot desktop/laptop hardware, software and peripheral problems.
Diagnose and troubleshoot printer problems.
Diagnose and troubleshoot barcode scanner equipment issues.
Train new employees on the use of Trex information technology. (eg. PC, WiFi, VPN, etc.)
Interact with vendors as required.
Responsible for managing user accounts, including rights, security and system groups.
Manage inventory of desktop and mobile hardware, software and peripheral items.
Provide support to remote employees, fielding phone calls and email communications.
Maintain and uphold PC policies as needed.
Maintain inventory and order equipment as needed.
Assist in other IT projects that require infrastructure support.
Manage and perform monthly server patching.
Manage, monitor and document company backup environments.
Provide next-level support and guidance for junior team members.
Perform on call duties as required.
Perform other IT duties as required.
Provide SOX audit support.
Required Skills

Required Experience
Bachelor’s degree in computer science degree (or similar program), and three-or-more years’ experience maintaining PCs, printers and other handheld user devices.
Experience with creating and managing group policy, PowerShell scripts, and other advanced Windows administration.
Active Directory/Windows 2012 and up experience.
Must be able to communicate both verbally and in writing with users of differing technical knowledge to translate business requirements and information.
Experience in a manufacturing environment, the ability to quickly adapt and execute in an ever-changing environment, and end-to-end project management are a plus.
Job Location
Fernley, US-NV

Job Description:
Reports to
Credit & Collections Manager
JOB DESCRIPTION
Summary/Objective
We are actively seeking a Collections Analyst to support the collections function by ensuring that all aging targets are met. The role includes being the primary point of contact for customers in securing payments and working with internal teams to ensure timely resolution of outstanding issues. This is a senior position who proactively manages an assigned group of customer accounts receivables through direct customer contact to minimize past due balances, in addition to performing data analysis and process innovation for the collection function.


Following established guidelines, contacts assigned accounts directly to effectively collect outstanding monies. Exercises independent judgment in obtaining payments.
Ensures barriers to payment, such as proper approvals, expired PO's, and disputes are quickly identified and mediated. Communicates issues to appropriate party, conducts research as necessary and follows-through to resolution (successful collection and application).
Develops effective relationships with customers. Understands their process, key players and how to work efficiently within their system to collect outstanding balances effectively.
Keeps accurate records tracking progress and status of accounts.
Occasionally, performs other duties as assigned.

Knowledge typically gained through 3 years of experience in Credit and/or Collections
Knowledge typically gained through the achievement of an AA degree or equivalent
Ability to tactfully communicate (oral and written) with customers and make effective decisions in how the account should be handled, especially with large strategic accounts
Proficient in Microsoft Office and technology applications experience
Strong analytical skills are required
Ability to work in a team environment in making business decisions and implementing process improvements
Physical Requirements
All positions will require, to some degree, the physical abilities described below to perform the essential functions of the job.
Work the expected hours, consistently arrive at work at the agreed time and follow Company rules and guidelines regarding breaks and meal periods. Full time is typically considered to be 40 hours per week
Communicate effectively, both oral and written.
Move around and through all work areas as needed, may include climbing stairs or ladders.
Lift and/or move up to 10 pounds (i.e. books, reports, binders etc).
Regularly sit at the assigned workstation
Use keyboard or equivalent equipment, to access the computer,
Use hands to manipulate documents and general paperwork in order to view contents
Read documents, reports, files etc.
Communicate effectively using the telephone
Electro Rent is the largest, most comprehensive test equipment services provider for market-leading customers around the world. We are focused on delivering outstanding service for customers across a broad range of industries including Aerospace/Defense, Telecommunications, Mobile/Computing, Power & Industrial, Automotive, Medical, Education, New Space, Data Products Rental and more. With $1.1 billion of inventory, immediate shipping to over 100 countries, and a world-class accredited calibration and repair lab, our team of experts solve tough technical and financial challenges related to testing.
Electro Rent is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.

Position Description: Financial Analyst
Contracting Resources Group, Inc. (CRG) is a Woman-Owned Small Business, specializing in several core markets within the Federal Government. Our professional services depth includes program and project management, strategic planning, communications, acquisition management, financial management, program evaluation, and IT solutions. CRG is a leading management consulting firm, in part because of our ability to attract the highest quality team members through our emphasis on culture, competitive compensation, and benefits packages. Since 2002, CRG has consistently received top performance ratings from customers and teaming partners and industry awards, including Inc. Magazine’s 5000 list of the Fastest Growing Companies in America, the Department of Labor HireVets Platinum Medallion award, and the Washington Business Journal and Baltimore Sun’s Best Places to Work awards.
Description: CRG is seeking a Financial Analyst to support our Federal Government client onsite. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of three (3) years of financial support experience, one (1) year of experience with US Navy programs and operations, and strong organizational, analytical, and communication skills.
Duties include:
Measure organizational performance and assess the effects of various programs and policies on the budget.
Examine budget estimates or proposals for completeness, accuracy, and conformance with established procedures, regulations, and organizational objectives.
May employ cost-benefit analysis to review financial requests, assess program tradeoffs, and explore alternative funding methods.
Examine past and current budgets and research economic and financial developments that affect the organization’s spending.
Assist in development of guidelines and policies governing the formulation and maintenance of budgets.
Provide functional and technical support for standard financial reports and respond to customer inquiries in a timely manner.
Develop and/or respond to ad-hoc queries related to financial data calls.
Coordinate with department and office personnel in gathering and review of supporting documents required for the management of funds.
Conduct follow up actions for funding documentation and ensure fund document packages are complete, organized, and stored appropriately.
May conduct training sessions for company or government agency personnel regarding new budget procedures.
Location: Port Hueneme, CA
Required Qualifications:
Minimum of three (3) years of experience in financial support role.
Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, or other related field.
Experience providing advice and technical assistance in the preparation of annual budgets.
At least one (1) year of experience in U.S. Navy programs or operations.
DoD Secret Clearance.
Expert in Microsoft Office programs (Proficient in MS Excel).
Familiarity with Defense and Navy financial systems (i.e. Defense Civilian Payroll System [DCPS], Navy Enterprise Resource Planning [N-ERP], Defense Travel System [DTS], etc.)
Very strong interpersonal, oral, and written communications skills.
Able to use independent initiative, good judgment, and decision-making skills when setting priorities.
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.

Job Description:

Culture & Values:

In everything we do, we deeply believe all people possess a fundamental right to receive financial enlightenment - straightforward and simple. Management deeply believes in the power of inspired and motivated people - and in their ability to accomplish great things, both individually and together.

General Summary:

Under general supervision but in compliance with Credit Union policy and procedure, compiles, prepares, analyzes and presents management information to various audiences. This may include coordination of the annual budget process, maintenance of the product cost and profitability process, assistance with liquidity management, asset/liability management support, and/or strategic planning support.

Major Duties and Responsibilities:
Provide robust modeling and reporting to facilitate executive level decisioning. Prepare monthly financial reports and ad hoc reports to assist with business decisions. Responsible for analyzing financial data and preparing financial related reports, utilizing the ProfitStar software system. Work closely with the accounting team to ensure accurate financial reporting. Complete the quarterly NCUA 5300 report.
Supports asset/liability management using, as a primary resource, asset/liability modeling software. Forecasts balances of both assets and liabilities on a 12 to 24 month time horizon. Applies thorough knowledge of USSFCU’s asset/liability management policies and procedures to model assumptions. Assists in the preparation of A/L reports for presentation and analysis at ALCO/MALCO meetings.
Works with the CFO to develop liquidity policy recommendations. Monitors USSFCU’s liquidity position daily and makes recommendations to the CFO to manage both short-term and long-term liquidity positions in conjunction with the strategic plan objectives.
Oversees the credit union’s profitability function. Maintains the profitability and branch accounting module, and provides information and analyzes results of product profitability analysis using the profitability modeling software. Prepares profitability reports for analysis and presentation to executive management and the board. Works closely with managers, supervisors, and staff to identify changes in the way activities flow through USSFCU and how those activities affect their costs. Identifies cost saving and revenue increasing opportunities for USSFCU, using familiarity with operations and procedures.
Assists with the annual budget process for USSFCU. Works with the CFO to provide analysis of budget variances as well as propose budget plan adjustments. Responsible for maintenance and updating of USSFCU’s forecasting software and general ledger systems to ensure accurate assumptions and historical information are available for use as an integral part of budget process.
Assists in the evaluation of investment options and strategies. Monitor the purchase, settlement, safekeeping and sale of investments. Prepare investment related reports for management, the Board and regulatory reporting. Interpret application to the credit union for all existing and new investment related regulatory and GAAP requirements and oversees implementation of those requirements accordingly.
Provides assistance to long-range planning efforts. As the strategic focus of the Credit Union changes and evolves, assists management in identifying how these changes will affect the financial results of the Credit Union. Incorporates new information into the financial forecast that makes up the planning period.
Monitors loan and deposit rates against the competitive landscape to ensure that products are priced adequately to meet strategic and ALM goals.
Methodically reviews accounts payable entries to ensure accuracy of reporting; reviews and analyzes expenses.
Assists with the annual year- end accounting audit process and various other audits and exams conducted throughout the year.
Collects information from various databases and distributes pertinent information to other departments and the Leadership Team
Complies with all applicable Rules, Regulations and Statutes of the NCUA and other appropriate governing bodies to include but not limited to: the Credit Union Bylaws, Credit Union Code of Conduct, Credit Union Employee Guidebook, Bank Secrecy/Anti-Money Laundering Act, Fair Housing Act, Fair Lending Act, and Fair Credit Reporting Act.
Ability to perform duties defined in the Credit Union Security Program.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Required Experience:

Education: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Economics, Business Administration, Finance, or related field required.

Experience: Two (2) year’s general work experience and five (5) years of experience in financial institution investment, asset/liability management or financial analysis required.

Skills: High degree of analytical skill, able to work autonomously, and comfortable with detail. Ability to identify correlation between various groups of financial data. Strong ability to gather, analyze and present financial, statistical and economic data in a clear and concise fashion. Proficiency with PC applications including Word, Excel and Powerpoint required. Experience working with forecasting and analytical software, including Visible Equity, Profitstar, Symitar and others strongly preferred. Requires a working knowledge in the areas of liquidity management, asset liability management, data analysis, and financial institution accounting practices and work flows.

Communication: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills required.

Time in Service: None Required.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Job Description:
Company:
Arthrex
Requisition ID: 44090
Title: SC Business Analyst II- Manufacturing Operations
Division: Arthrex Manufacturing Inc (US02)
Location:
Ave Maria

Pendleton, SC

Main Objective:

The Business Analyst position works directly with business departments within Arthrex to build and manage a pipeline of Information Technology projects and enhancements . A successful candidate must have experience defining and operating business processes in one of the following areas: Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Maintenance or Quality. The position liaises with the technical organization to determine the scope, timing and cost of specific projects. Note: This role will work directly within business partner departments to ensure systems meet the requirements for their ongoing business needs.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

• Translate business goals and objectives into strategic business capabilities.

• Benchmark current and future processes against best industry practices.

• Develop a roadmap of projects and initiatives for enablement of new capabilities.

• Project Management small and large enhancements

• Engage in efforts to establish scope and business case for new programs and initiatives.

• Participates in the upstream of Demand IT Planning, Budgeting and Strategy sessions within business and Information Technology

• Ensures adoption of consistent processes, strategies and technology.

• Contribute to a design and delivery service in support to business priorities as defined by the business project portfolio and enterprise application landscape.

• Collaborate with internal and external technical resources performing analysis, design, configuration, development, testing, and deployment activities for applications.

• Follow the appropriate methodology for the identification and documentation of business requirements.

• Plan and manage user acceptance testing activities.

• Accountable for solutions supporting business departments.

• Provide the methodology, standards and tools for efficient and effective program management.

• Identify technical functionality that aligns with desired new business capabilities.

• Conduct research on emerging technologies in support of objectives and recommend technologies that will increase cost effectiveness, flexibility, and innovation.

• Identify opportunities to innovate and differentiate Arthrex from its competition.

• Up to 25% travel required

Incidental Duties:

The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed in this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, and indeed additional responsibilities may be assigned, as required, by management.

Education and Experience:
Bachelor's degree required, preferably in Business, Computer Science or related field required. MBA preferred
Two years of experience within a business function (MFG, Supply Chain, or Quality) with business analysis or business process improvement activity required
Demonstrated history of success leading a business through a significant transformation initiative.
Deployment and optimization of the following system required (SAP – PM)
Involvement in the deployment or optimization of any of the following systems preferred (ME, MII, BI, PP/DS, PP, MM, QM)
Ability to work comfortably at all levels within the organization up to the senior management level.
Knowledge of Program Management Office functions and practices. PMP certification a plus.
Previous position in Medical Devices or Pharma industry a plus
Knowledge and Skill Requirements/Specialized Courses and/or Training:
Experience with SAP ECC (QM), SAP IBP, SAP Ariba, SAP Digital Supply Chain preferred.
Experience with S/4HANA deployment preferred.
Understanding of Title 21 CFR 820 or ISO 13485 regulations and standards
Understanding of the major functions in a manufacturing organization.
Strong communication (written and oral) and presentation skills.
Ability to work comfortably at all levels within the organization up to the senior management level.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Job Overview & Purpose:
The role of the Business Analyst is to work with multiple project stakeholders to effectively gather, document, configure, test, and deliver trainings on the solution as it relates to the implementation of our flagship product, AmpliFund. In the event that new features are requested by the customer, this role would document the new requirements and transition this knowledge to the Product Development team. This individual will become a product subject matter expert to best understand and apply client goals to product abilities. Additionally, the Business Analyst may assist in additional project responsibilities, including but not limited to, project planning, creation of status reports, time tracking, project financials, creation and delivery of training materials, product support, etc.
This position works closely with the Implementation Team Leads, Project Managers, Customer Service Representatives, Product, and Development resources to ensure the successful implementation of AmpliFund. This position would ultimately report to the Director of Delivery.
Essential Job Duties:
Leads or actively participates in all requirement workshops
Responsible for documenting all findings and outcomes of requirement workshops
Work with AmpliFund Implementation Team to identify and document functional gaps
Elicit, document, and communicate functional and technical requirements
Analyzes functional system processes. Provide guidelines on business process mapping and process workflow documentations
Documents mapping of requirements to AmpliFund base and configurable system functionality
Builds and maintains requirements traceability matrix, gap analysis, issues and enhancement logs, and other internal and external facing tracking tools
Provides AmpliFund functional expertise to support client
Configures AmpliFund functionality per client’s requirements
Create and execute test cases to ensure solution meets the documented requirements
Documents any issues identified during testing and provides results to appropriate project team personnel for resolution
Deliver implementation, train-the-trainer, and end user training sessions based on team developed training strategies and scenarios
Communicate with the Product Development team to document new features and enhancements
Review and validate project-related new development to ensure the functionality meets the approved requirements
Document application defects that are a result of requirement non-conformance
Participate in project status meetings
Report project status and potential project risks to stakeholders on an ongoing basis
Non-traditional hours may be needed, but not weekends
Perform other job-related duties as assigned
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
2+ years implementing software solutions, ideally in an Enterprise-wide setting
2+ years related experience, preferably in within grants management, a nonprofit or public sector environment
2+ years experience in working directly with clients
Strong analytical and problem solving skills, particularly with requirements gathering and documentation for concurrent projects
Strong communication skills with the ability to present information in verbal, written or visual form to a variety of audiences, from the internal team to client executives
Ability to self-manage and be an independent member within the larger project team
The ability to interact with business clients and internal teams simultaneously to bridge gaps and manage communications
Ability to translate an idea or need into a completed solution
Familiarity with software design and development
Experience training or teaching customers/clients
Experience with database and report development preferred
Ability to travel up to 25%
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities Preferred:
Experience in the Nonprofit Sector & Public Sector
Basic Accounting knowledge a plus
Experience teaching and training—specifically virtually
Stable work history
Professional in nature, reliable and punctual
Passionate about exceeding goals and delivering a result
Team oriented and comfortable with regular performance feedback
Organized, focused and persistent
Flexible, adaptable and dedicated
Bilingual in Spanish a plus
Compensation Package:
A competitive base salary plus bonus
Unlimited PTO
The ability to immediately join our benefits plan, including a 401k plan
A newly renovated office environment in downtown Cleveland, overlooking Progressive field
Supplemented parking
Supplemented gym membership
Detailed attention to your personal development plan
Opportunity for advancement, based on performance
Sound like a good fit? Contact us to apply.

We are seeking a Business Analyst to join our team at Harris Govern!

As the Business Analyst your primary objective is to assist clients with implementing Harris Govern solutions by defining, analyzing and documenting requirements, clearly communicating this information to stakeholders, and partners, and managing the delivery of the requirements at the project level.

As a liaison between Harris Govern and our clients, you are responsible for evaluating solution architecture, communicating technical requirements, identifying gaps, creating the technical design, and resolving implementation roadblocks.

What your impact will be:
Functions as a core member of an enterprise project team which consists of Project Managers, Business Analysts, Applications Developers, and Client Teams.
Implement advanced strategies for gathering, reviewing and analyzing technical requirements
Create detailed technical specifications
Organize, prioritize, and manage technical delivery at the project level by providing work direction to development staff and/or assisting with development tasks in order to meet project deadlines.
Master strategic technical process modeling, traceability, and quality management techniques
Develop and execute test cases that confirm expected results
Participates in user acceptance testing and testing of new system functionality
Create tools and applying best practices for technical requirements gathering
Completing work breakdown structure for the estimation of efforts needed for each task
Communicating clearly the expectations to project manager and team members
Resolving issues and solving problems throughout the project cycle by leveraging advanced problem-solving techniques
Management of risk / issue tracking and remediation.
Provide technical assistance in training, mentoring, and coaching professional and technical staff
What we are looking for:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems or related field from an accredited institution
5+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst or similar
Experience in technical analysis including translating user needs into functional or technical requirements
Proficient with Word, Excel, PowerPoint required, Visio and Team Foundation Server (TFS)
Excellent written and verbal communication, including technical writing skills
Understanding of systems engineering concepts
Enterprise technology delivery experience
Government contract and delivery experience preferred
Ability to operate independently, with minimal supervision in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
Management skills
Must be able to travel 25 to 50% (When travel restrictions are not in place.)
What will make you stand out:
Ability to learn on the fly,
Customer focused
Can manage competing priorities.
What we offer:
A competitive compensation package
A casual work environment
Full range of employee benefits 401(k), Health Insurance (medical, dental, vision, life, short and long-term disability, AD&D)
Paid Vacation
About us:

Since 1975, Harris Govern has provided end-to-end software software for over hundreds of Local Government agencies in the United States and Canada. Our systems help agencies increase revenue and efficiencies through workflow automation, GIS integration, and document management.

Our headquarters in Allen, TX and Montreal, QC and regional office in Fort Collins, CO allows us to provide you with the operational support that you need to keep your agency and teams running smoothly. All of our software solutions come backed with the best team of technical experts who provide ongoing support throughout the lifecycle of your contract.

Harris is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state or local law.

If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at (1)-613-226-5511 or at HarrisTalentAcquisition@harriscomputer.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

Open Position: Senior Business Analyst

Headquartered in Arlington, Virginia, Promontory Interfinancial Network – the nation’s largest deposit allocation service provider and the inventor of reciprocal deposits – provides dynamic, all-weather balance sheet and liquidity management solutions to help financial institutions grow franchise value. The company, chosen by thousands of banks since its founding nearly two decades ago, has assembled the largest bank network of its kind. Its solutions help institutions to acquire high-value, local relationships; purchase funding; and reduce collateralization costs.

At Promontory Interfinancial Network, we prosper by working hard in an open and creative environment. Our efforts to create and maintain a culture that values our people have led us to be designated among the top fintech companies to work for by American Banker. Promontory Network has also been recognized as one of the best places to work by the Washington Post’s Top Workplaces and the Washington Business Journal’s Best Places to Work. Our company is also recognized among Fortune’s lists of Best Workplaces—Small & Medium Businesses and Best Workplaces in Financial Services and Insurance.

What is the role?

You would be a key member of our IT development team, which is responsible for the definition and development of internal and external business applications. Your primary role will be to manage the analysis and oversee the facilitation required to develop new services and products, as well as meeting the diverse needs of a growing network of customers. You will also be responsible for the delivery and maintenance of these services and products, including post-production support and triage. Working with both the development and operations teams, you will help define the tools and strategies used by IT to foster a culture that embraces automation and DevOps processes. At Promontory Network, you can have a challenging, impactful career. You should possess the experience and qualifications to perform core responsibilities, such as:
Work with top talent in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment where automation and technical craftsmanship are a top priority.
Exhibit strong leadership abilities - inspire, motivate, and provide coaching as appropriate.
Triage and lead support for pre- and post-production release issues, which may include defect resolution, emergency enhancement requests, and data patching.
Write and review database patches, scripts, and queries to answer business inquiries, facilitate data-driven decisions, and resolve incidents.
Take responsibility for the overall application development lifecycle, including ensuring that project deliverables meet or exceed company policies, procedures, and standards.
Collaborate with Development Team managers to ensure high-quality software is designed, developed, and maintained in an efficient manner.
Partner with and support the Operations, Security, and Corporate IT teams to ensure that overall strategic goals are achieved and a highly collaborative culture of continuous improvement is constantly demonstrated.
Independently complete functional analysis for new features; document functional and system requirements; and produce supporting artifacts, including user stories and acceptance criteria, story maps, data flows, process flows, etc.
Usher feature development from inception to release. Continually engage in the development process. Be able to answer questions, provide detail, address changes to requirements, and facilitate dialog across teams when issues and challenges are encountered to ensure the end product is delivered as specified.
Be able to operate across multiple projects simultaneously and perform a variety of tasks from addressing production issues to designing new applications.
What qualifications are required?
Experience: Extensive experience with Agile methodologies, specifically Scrum. Ability to independently create user stories, manage a product backlog, and ensure that regular backlog grooming is effectively performed. Experience querying databases, using Excel for data analysis, and writing basic SQL scripts. Demonstrated leadership during production support, production releases, and/or user testing cycles.
Abilities: Exceptional written and oral skills sufficient to communicate effectively with nontechnical and technical business clients and team. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Outstanding customer and interpersonal skills. Proactive. Self-directed. Able to manage a cross-functional team of varied technical skill sets. Work independently or within a group of people as the situation requires.
Technical Skills: Strong skills with writing SQL queries required; experience with Oracle desired. Knowledge of Amazon Web Services and willingness to learn related technologies is helpful. Hands-on experience with MS Office, especially Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint. Five+ years of experience in computer programming or related technologies.
Education: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience, preferred expertise in Economics, Finance, and/or Computer Science.
How do I apply?

Don’t just settle for a job, explore our career opportunity.

APPLY

Promontory Interfinancial Network, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, religion, age, veteran status, disability or sexual orientation in employment of the provision of services

Description
Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?

Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 5th largest financial group in the world (as ranked by S&P Global, April 2018). In the Americas, were 13,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, developing positive relationships built on integrity and respect. Its part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. Were a team that accepts responsibility for the future by asking the tough questions and owning the solutions. Join MUFG and be empowered to make your voice heard and your actions count.

Financial Crimes Business Analysis, Director

Job Summary:
As a part of Compliance Technology, the Director of Financial Crimes Business Analysis will build and lead a team of business analysts (BAs). The BA team will help Financial Crimes Office Americas (FCOA) design technology solutions to address risks and control deficiencies. The BAs will act as expert consultants and advise FCOA on the best ways to meet their needs, presenting various options. The BAs will then work with Compliance Technology developers to refine designs and create detailed business requirements. The ability to quickly grasp Compliance concerns and synthesize options is critical. The Director must work closely with geographically disbursed stakeholders across a variety of businesses and functions, including Home Office staff in Tokyo.

The Director will also serve as Chief of Staff for Compliance Technology and oversee planning and execution for all Compliance Technology projects. The Director must have strong track record of leading teams, and mentoring and developing direct staff. Polished oral and written communication skills and the ability to build relationships are essential. The Director must be experienced in presenting to executives and department heads, have a minimum of 10 years in-depth experience in banking and Compliance, and be a proficient risk manager. The Director should also be experienced in various Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies, including Waterfall and Agile, and have a solid understanding of technology and data.


Major Responsibilities:
Develop team members to be effective business analysts
Define team procedures and standards
Oversee reporting to senior management; including the Chief Information and Operations Officer (CIOO)
Oversee project planning and execution and escalate risks and concerns
Refine proposed solutions and estimate resource requirements in consultation with technology leads
Act as an expert resource to ensure that the project meets business objectives
Qualifications
10+ years experience implementing technology solutions at large banks or financial institutions
5+ years experience directing managing staff
In-depth knowledge of Compliance Risks and Risk Management, including AML, Sanctions, and Anti-Bribery and Corruption
Experience developing business requirements to solve complex problems in consultation with business partners
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Experience writing detailed business requirements and functional requirements
Experience presenting to executive level management and department heads
Experienced in SDLC methodologies including Waterfall and Agile
Knowledge of SQL and experience analyzing data
Bachelors degree preferred
CAMS certification preferred

Description:

CyberCore Technologies seeks a Business Analyst to support various clients and projects across our customer base by developing and documenting business requirements through a variety of means such as, but not limited to user interviews, surveys, workflow reviews, research on industry best practices, and user workshops. This individual will be part of a team, taking direction from the Senior/Lead Business Analyst and providing guidance to junior team members.

Bachelor's Degree and 5 years of experience, or 9 years of business analyst experience
Use business analysis methodologies to identify and develop requirements based on interviews, current business processes, and existing documentation

Dailymotion is the leading video discovery destination & technology that learns about your tastes over time; constantly surfacing the best, most relevant content on the web.
Our mission is to provide the best video user experience for consumers on the market, connecting publishers and advertisers to engaged viewers who turn to Dailymotion for their daily fix of compelling music, entertainment, news and sports content around.

Through partnerships with the world's leading publishers and content creators which include: CBS, CNN, Fox Sports, GQ, Mashable, Universal Music Group, VICE and more, Dailymotion commands 4 billion monthly pageviews across its mobile app, desktop and connected TV experiences. Job Description

Within the Dailymotion’s AdTech department, we are looking for someone to join the Business Operations & Analytics team in our NYC office. The team’s mission statement is to drive growth, deliver insights & scale efficiency for the AdTech, Sales & Content tribes.

As Sr. Business Operations Analyst – Programmatic, you will act as a true internal consultant to support our Programmatic Business and actively contribute to the success of the Programmatic Partnerships team driving revenue growth as your #1 priority.

You will have to wear 2 hats to be successful at this job:

· Business Analyst: provide relevant and actionable insights, drive better business understanding and help the team make data-driven decisions

· Project Manager: identify pain points, implement your recommendations concretely and drive efficiency, by providing both strategic thinking and structured project management capabilities

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

· Partner closely with the Programmatic Partnerships team to develop and execute their roadmap and business plan

· Monitor frequently our multiple buyers spend and improve reactivity of the team to fix issues

· Perform regular analysis of our Programmatic Business and provide recommendations on how to unlock more revenue

· Develop our Business insight via better Reporting & Dashboarding using both our internal and external data

· Drive large cross-functional projects, partnering with multiple stakeholders to implement your business recommendations

· Help our Operations team develop our Programmatic Marketplace and facilitate the go-to-market of new offers to our different demand sources

· Scale tools and processes to improve the DSPs/SSPs relationship cycle (automation, CRM, regular business reviews…)

· Provide high quality consulting and analytics support across a variety of strategic team initiatives

Qualifications

WHAT THE IDEAL CANDIDATE LOOKS LIKE..

· Master’s degree from a Top Business or Engineering University

· At least 4 years of experience in a strategy consulting firm, investment bank, or renowned tech company at a strategy, operations or analytics position

· Prior experience in the AdTech / Programmatic industry isrequired

· Strong SQL skills and knowledge of data visualization tools (Tableau is a plus)

· Great rigor, structured approach to problem-solving and very strong attention to detail

· Amazing ability to synthesize complex subjects into a couple of key comprehensive message

· Excellent communication skills and great ability to cooperate efficiently with people from different backgrounds (tech, operations, sales, finance, legal…) and seniorities (from juniors to C-level

· Creative and entrepreneurial mindset, highly autonomous and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously

· Fluency in English (written and oral)

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU

· Join Dailymotion during a key period of growth and development with multiple key projects being launched from the ground-up to achieve very ambitious goals over the next few years.

· Join a growing team with many processes to improve and projects to implement, with the opportunity to play a key role and bring new ideas to the table!

Additional Information

Location: New York
Type of contract: Full-time
Start Date: ASAP
Flexible time off; vacation, holidays, sick-leave, etc..
Fitness club membership
100% healthcare coverage starting day 1
Commuter benefits
401k Contribution
