FULLY stocked kitchens with free snacks and drinks!

This job is an individual contributor primarily responsible for completing and reviewing various unique appraisals in the agricultural lending area as well as determining and securing appropriate collateral for lending needs. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, reviewing and analyzing technical and legal documentation, using judgement to identify appropriate comparables, determining appropriate entries into appraisal software, entering into contracts with external appraisers and communicating throughout the appraisal process with both internal staff and customers.

In this job, you will:
Perform internal appraisals of agricultural properties, research and analyze subject property data and market data to provide current collateral valuations.
Engage appraisers from approved list of appraisers, manage bidding process, award process, and report delivery process.
Respond to inquiries from appraisers regarding property data and appraisal assignment conditions.
Review and analyze appraisals performed by external appraisers in compliance with appropriate compliance and/or regulatory rules and confirm appraisal valuation is accurate/acceptable and collateral is acceptable as related to the scope of the assignment to meet investor requirements (includes analyzing market analysis and approaches utilized to value property to provide estimated value).
Prevent delays by providing notification and appropriate coaching for requested revisions.
Drive panel performance by developing and managing high-trust vendor relationships.
Communicate with loan officers regarding appraisal assignment requirements, conditions and status.
Respond to inquiries from credit analysts, loan officers, and members of senior management in order to resolve appraisal disputes and concerns.
Serve as a peer and subject matter expert for QC escalations from our appraiser panel.
Build and maintain professional relationships with internal staff, customers, and vendors.
Complete all required qualifying and continuing appraisal education to receive &/or stay current with appraisal license.
Other duties as assigned.
Here’s what you’ll need to be considered:

Education

Required – Bachelor’s degree in Agriculture, Finance, Business, or related field.

Experience

Required – None.

Preferred – Experience in agriculture.

License/Certification

Required – Valid driver’s license and satisfactory driving record.

Required – State Certified General Appraisal License or ability to pursue and obtain license and continued education.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Working knowledge/Ability to quickly learn various aspects of appraising agricultural collateral.
Advanced mathematical skills (calculate figures and amounts, such as discounts, interest and percentages).
Proficient computer skills, including working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (including Excel, Word, Outlook, Adobe and use of internet search functions).
Effective interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with the ability to interact with all levels of people within and outside the organization (including ability to effectively speak before groups of customers and others).
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret various resources, such as instructions, third party data, various legal documents, general business periodicals and governmental regulations.
Ability to interpret data and incorporate into valuation review.
Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of situations where only limited standards exist.
Ability to utilize analytical thinking; find facts and solve problems.
Ability to work both in an office setting and outdoors in a farm environment.
Ability to perform independent research and analysis.
Works effectively under pressure and able to work within tight deadlines.
Ability to plat and read legal descriptions and draw maps/aerial photographs.
Here’s additional information you need to know:
This is a full-time position working out of our Louisville, KY office location.
Travel, up to 10-20% travel required; most travel is within two hours driving distance of the assigned office. Some out of town travel may be required for trainings/meetings.

Job Description:
Cambridge Systematics, Inc. is shaping the future of transportation. We are industry leaders, transportation specialists dedicated to ensuring that transportation investments can deliver the best possible results. By providing innovative policy and planning solutions, objective analyses and technology applications, we help our clients anticipate and meet future transportation needs while improving the performance of existing infrastructure and operations. Above all, we are committed to our clients’ success in making transportation better for future generations.

The Integrated Planning & Policy group provides fully integrated planning and management as well as project development services for our clients. The group encompasses three national practice areas: Planning and Policy, Freight and Economics and Transit and Shared Mobility. We apply our national knowledge and leadership while leveraging the strength of regional expertise to bring experience from across the country and extensive Federal level to understand our client’s needs.

We are looking to add a Transportation Analyst onsite at our client’s location in Tallahassee, FL. The Transportation Analyst works under the general supervision of project managers on assignments pertaining to community planning, resilience and safety. They handle assignments of a quantitative and qualitative nature; learn to use, understand, and appropriately apply new tools and communicate effectively with project staff and/or clients. The Transportation Analyst reports to a Regional Staff Manager responsible for managing ongoing professional development and growth. While business development and project management are not typically a part of this role, the Transportation Analyst may be asked to assist with such activities at the discretion of the Regional Staff Manager or other senior consultants.

Project Delivery
•Produces and delivers exceptional quality work that is thorough, polished, and reflects well on CS •Provides exceptional value-added service to project managers and/or clients and communicates consistently with internal and external team members •Actively listens and seeks to understand client or project manager needs •Meets chargeability expectations

Position Requirements

Bachelor's degree required
Master's degree preferred
3+ years of experience in local government and community planning or resilience

Description

The Application Analyst II - Human Resources provides support for assigned Human Resource systems with an advanced understanding of Infor and its related third party business applications which include functionality, system design, technical architecture, testing, workflow, modification, routine and non-routine processing, and business system structure. The Application Analyst II is responsible for advancing the functionality and operational efficiency of the use of Infor CloudSuite. This entails advising and assisting customers in the operation and administration of their system; collaborating with internal customers to enhance their work methodologies and tools; and maintaining a customer-centric technical knowledge and focus when contributing to the analysis, design, development, testing, documentation and implementation activities including recurring Customer Updates of the Infor CloudSuite software.

The Application Analyst II must possess sufficient detailed expertise to support multiple applications, preferably with functional expertise in payroll, timekeeping, or other HRIS systems.Primary areas of focus will be payroll, timekeeping, talent acquisition, and human resources modules. The Application Analyst II provides response and resolution to application problems and requests for change to Infor. This position works in a collaborative team setting, creating and sharing information and assisting team members while providing quality support with a focus on customer service and timeliness. The Application Analyst II must possess detailed human resources knowledge and systems expertise to implement medium to high complexity assignments with minimal guidance.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop and document product definitions, stakeholder needs, product features, and corresponding functional specifications.
Solid understanding of Human Resource management functions
Collaborate and build proactive, positive relations with peers, managers, and cross-functional teams to ensure that consistency within defined processes is maintained; help determine best practices; and work efficiently.
Assist in installation, configuration, administration, and maintenance of the ERP.
Ability to work with aggressive timelines in a team environment with a desire to learn and grow.
Proactively review, test, and communicate significant system updates ensuring system integrity is maintained.
Document issues and resolutions for future reference; help create and maintain FAQ.
Focus on providing a friendly, courteous, and polite customer service experience at all times. Contact vendors regarding service issues to receive support information or assistance as required. Assist users with optimizing the use of assigned applications Set priorities, plans and manages a diverse set of tasks.
Follow the outlined Service Management Processes during outage events.
Participate in after-hours support by rotating call schedule on a regular basis.
May be required to travel to perform some job functions.
Perform other duties and as requested.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree or 6 or more years of related experience in application analysis, or Human Resources
Possess an understanding of and/or experience in the following: payroll, timekeeping, talent acquisition, or human resources management
Relevant Bachelor degree may substitute for relevant years of experience.

Job Description:
Join a fast growing company that is transforming its industry! Financial Recovery Technologies has become a trusted partner to hedge funds, mutual funds, custodians, sovereign wealth funds, and other institutional investment firms, and our best-in-class people and technology have made FRT a market leader. We are seeking a motivated financial analyst to join our growing team. This role will collaborate with departments across the business to perform analyses, build financial planning tools, develop metrics and dashboards, and assist with creating and presenting outputs used to support management and the executive team in making timely and informed decisions related to our strategic objectives.

The role: As a Financial Analyst at FRT, you will:
Own financial planning and budgeting across the business
Develop department-level and company-level financial planning analytics, including budget/forecast, variance and sensitivity analyses, and identification of KPIs and other key metrics
Own variance analysis, forecasting/reforecasting, and financial performance reporting and communications to functional leaders, the executive team, and the FRT Board
Develop models to be utilized for the annual budget/forecast as well as potential strategic initiatives
Identify issues, opportunities, and trends and prepare analyses to guide strategic business decisions
Review and analyze internal financial data to identify issues, opportunities and trends to provide the executive team and others with financial analysis input that will drive decision making including project profitability, productivity analysis, and return on investment
Prepare analyses incorporating external benchmarks, market and competitor data, and potential M&A or new business development opportunities to guide business decisions
Review corporate development opportunities, including M&A
Analyze potential deals as they arise to determine proper valuation or other deal terms
Perform ad hoc tasks as assigned by the Controller and CFO
Our ideal candidate has:
A Bachelor’s Degree in finance, accounting, economics or another analytical discipline; MBA or CFA preferred
A minimum of four year of progressive finance experience; experience in financial services and/or fintech highly desirable
Experience in building and managing finance processes, including forecasting, budgeting, and capital planning
Strong MS Office skills; specifically advanced Excel skills with the ability to create financial models and analytics out of disparate and raw data sets and effectively present findings in an efficient and effective manner to members of management
Advanced analytical and project management skills
Excellent written and verbal communications
Passion and an ability to work in an entrepreneurial and fast-paced environment
Drive – you are self-motivated, hard-working, and able to work independently
A collaborative style, prioritizing collaboration over credit, with an interest in building strong relationships with peers at all levels across corporate functions;
Intellectual curiosity, with a demonstrated commitment to continuous growth; and
Of course, a desire to join a growing company with a vibrant, entrepreneurial culture, dedicated to being the top provider in the class action recovery space.
WHAT FRT OFFERS:
Competitive salary and bonus
Health, dental, vision
401k (with company match)
Income protection plans (life, accidental death and dismemberment, short- and long-term disability) and access to a suite of voluntary benefits
Close to public transit (walking distance to Wellington T on Orange Line)
Free drinks and snacks
Free parking onsite
Free access to onsite gym
Fun, smart, diverse colleagues

Cherokee Town & Country ClubinAtlanta, GAis looking to hire afull-time Financial Analystto engage directly with department leaders across the entire organization in support of our efforts to ensure financial stability and member satisfaction. Are you an energetic self-starter? Do you want to be part of an ambitious and close-knit team? If so, keep reading!

ABOUT CHEROKEE TOWN & COUNTRY CLUB

Chartered in 1956, Cherokee Town and Country Club is recognized as one of America's premier private clubs. Our Town Club occupies the famed Grant Estate on West Paces Ferry Road in Buckhead and our Country Club is located near the Chattahoochee River in Sandy Springs. The excellence of our facilities, combined with our commitment to the highest standards in dining and member services, has brought the club an extraordinary number of honors and awards throughout the years.

We are in the "happiness business" and believe in a positive "What can I do? How can I help?" attitude. We refer to our high expectations for our staff as the "Cherokee Standard". Wevalue our employeesfor their hard work and dedication. Here at Cherokee Town & Country Club, we are proud of ourtop-notch working environmentsupported by a high-quality team management approach that includescompetitive wagesandawesome perks.

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A FINANCIAL ANALYST

As a Financial Analyst, you use accounting, finance, and business knowledge along with your good judgment to drive our financial success. It's a good thing that you have an analytical mind because you spend much of your time interpreting information. Utilizing Excel, you create complex models and capture key business drivers, forecast and monitor the capital and operational budgets, and calculate KPS's to measure performance and identify opportunities for growth. Occasionally, you support the accounting team with transaction processing to ensure timely and accurate financial results.

While you do spend a lot of time analyzing information, sharing and explaining your findings to our CFO, COO, and department leaders is an equally important part of your job. The information you provide allows us to make strategic decisions. When it comes to key stakeholders, you ensure ongoing communication and dialogue. You strive to improve the data gathering, visualization, and presentation processes, automating whenever possible. You drive improvements in reporting accuracy, timeliness, and insightfulness. You get a great deal of satisfaction out of ensuring that our country club has the revenue necessary to continue serving our members at the highest level!

QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in finance
At least 1 year of FP&A / financial modeling experience
Advanced Excel skills
Recent graduates with applicable internship experience and course work will also be considered. Experience with Microsoft B, Python, R, and/or Tableau is a plus! Do you have a broad understanding of finance and accounting principles? Do you have an inquisitive and analytical mind? Do you have experience with advanced analytics and data visualization tools? Do you have strong interpersonal and communication skills? Are you organized and able to follow up? Are you a creative and resourceful problem solver? If so, you may be perfect for this accounting position!

Job Description:
TheAmerican College of Radiology (www.ACR.org), a professional association for radiologists, is a world leader in radiology clinical research. The Center for Research and Innovation located in Philadelphia, administers research for numerous commercial and grant funded entities. Cancer research efforts include studies performed through the prestigious RTOG Foundation (www.RTOG.org), commercial sponsored research awarded to ACR for diagnostic imaging, and a number of NCI awards to, NRG Oncology Group (www.NRGOncology.org), IROC Group (www.IROCQA.org), and ECOG-ACRIN (www.ECOG-ACRIN.org). In addition, ACR CRI conducts research in cardiology, neurology, pediatrics, and other body systems and also has led validation efforts for advancing new software and Artificial Intelligence algorithms.

As aBusiness Analyst at ACR you will be supporting the Center for Research and Innovation project portfolio. Telework available upon successful completion of new employee orientation/training period.

As a member of the ACR team you will:
Understand the structure, policies and operations of an organization to recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals.
Improve systems/processes by studying current practices and designing modifications.
Prepare process and systems, streamline alternatives and recommendations to stakeholders.
Conduct business process/systems analysis through user story workshops or otherwise.
Document use cases, business/system/functional requirements, requirements traceability matrix and test cases.
Use the SCRUM methodology to document requirements - Epics, Themes, User Stories and Personas.
Support the Product Owner/Manager in validating the completion of requirements.
Verify user stories are delivered per acceptance criteria.
Mockup requirements where necessary to help Developers and business understand the requirements
Document business processes by creating workflow diagrams and flow charts
Plan and oversee SDLC process, release artifacts, release notes and user guides for the product
Develop patterns and concepts within the application which may be re-used for future features
Collaborate with stakeholders, developers and UX/UI designers to perfect the user experience using user-centric wireframes/mocks
Performing user acceptance testing of Sprint deliverables
Keep abreast of latest technology trends and developments
Act as a communication bridge between business and IT.
Act as a SME on behalf of the Customer to IT.
Qualified candidates will possess the following:
Bachelor’s degree in Information systems or related field;
3+ years of directly relevant experience in developing requirements and performing system analysis;
Experience working in Agile environment using SCRUM methodologies;
Competent with Microsoft Project, Visio, and Office software;
Salesforce experience and certifications are a PLUS.
Organizational and analytical skills;
Ability to clearly communicate ideas and solutions;
Ability to clearly communicate ideas and solutions;
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills;
Ability to work as part of a team and individually.
If you would like to put your experience to great use in a professional team-oriented environment, please apply online. To learn more about ACR’s rewarding employee experience, culture, and benefits, visit: https://www.acr.org/About-ACR/Work-With-Us

ACR offers a rewarding employee experience: innovative culture, professional growth potential, competitive compensation and an exceptional benefits package, including a defined contribution pension plan, 403(b); generous paid time off package; insurance plans with the leading providers; flexible spending; tuition reimbursement; training opportunities; and wellness reimbursement.

Why work for Brilliant Corners?

Organization Overview

Founded in 2004, Brilliant Corners provides innovative housing and housing-related services to those transitioning from or at risk of homelessness or institutionalization. We develop, own, and manage multi-family supportive housing and licensed residential care homes. Additionally, we implement a broad array of scattered-site, one-on-one supportive housing, and clinical case management programs through partnerships with developmental services, homeless services, veteran services, and health care sectors.

In short, we do good work.

We have offices statewide with a staff of passionate people. While we are growing rapidly, we are also selective: Were seeking inspired, talented people who want to be effecting profound change and who have fun doing it.

Position Summary
The Budget Analyst's primary objective is to develop key program budgets, to provide analysis on business trends, and to monitor the program budget/expenses on a monthly basis. The Budget Analyst will report directly to the Controller and will work closely with a team of accountants and program managers.

Responsibilities
Analyze monthly departmental financial reports, investigate actual to budget variances, and communicate with managers/directors in order to maintain expenditure controls and forecast financial trends.
Assist in the development of the annual budgets and manage program-based, multi-year forecasts for expenditures and revenues.
Monitor and update program budgets within the agencys accounting software and funders online budget portal.
Provide support to the Director, Associate Director, Controller and/or Chief Financial Officer to assist with special studies that require data compilation; analyze and interpret information in oral and written presentations.
Utilize and ensure compliance with cost allocations across various funding streams in accordance with the OMB Uniform Guidance Regulations.
Be aware of and adhere to multiple contract budgets with their own specified individual requirements and parameters. Maintain confidentiality of information as appropriate.
Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities. Read applicable contract agreements to ensure all revenues and billable expenditures are maximized.
Contribute to departmental and organizational goals and mission by completing related tasks as needed.
Other tasks as assigned.
Requirements
Bachelors Degree in Accounting or related field required
3+ years accounting management and financial analysis experience
Familiarity with Intacct; and other accounting software packages
High level of proficiency with Excel.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.

Job Description Summary

The Senior Analyst, Investor Relations will work closely with the SVP and VP of Investor Relations and will be responsible for providing direct support for all Investor Relations activities including quarterly earnings, competitor analysis and special projects. The Senior Analyst will also work closely with others within the finance organization, as well as the enterprise business units.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
Develops collateral materials for quarterly earnings, other investment community communications and senior management.
Tracks industry trends, performs in-depth competitive analysis and provides market intelligence.
Conducts financial modeling on Travelers and peers.
Maintains and analyzes database of analyst models.
Summarizes and provides analysis of analyst research reports.
Utilizes third party market intelligence tools for research and analysis.
Maintains and updates the external IR website
Creates weekly market updates.
Manages various logistical aspects of quarterly earnings process.
Supports investor and analyst activities including conferences and non-deal roadshows.
Responds as necessary to shareholder services requests.
Support ad-hoc projects for senior management.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelors degree required.
2 years minimum working in a finance or related role.
Education, Work Experience, & Knowledge
Bachelor's degree in in Finance, Economics, Accounting, Business Management, Engineering or business-related degree preferred.
3+ years of experience working in a related role preferably for a financial services firm such as asset management, accounting firm or investment banking, or a finance function in a corporate setting (such as corporate finance, treasury or FP&A)
Experience in (re)insurance preferred
Moderate understanding of current financial market and economic events.
Job Specific Technical Skills & Competencies
Deep understanding of financial statements and financial modeling.
Knowledge of capital markets.
Ability to distill vast amounts of data into financial and economic concepts and present them in business terms.
Ability to conceive, design and execute on research solutions.
Advanced skills with Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel and PowerPoint.
Ability to self-start and work independently with limited direction or supervision.
Strong communication skills such as written, verbal, listening, and presentation.
Strong attention to detail.
Ability to interact and build relationships with people across the firm at different levels of seniority.

Are you looking for a challenging role as a Sr. Business Intelligence Developer? InterVision Systems is a strategic service provider committed to unlocking value by delivering innovative technology through a consultative approach. We believe we will transform businesses through the evolutionary power of technology. Our people are the best in their field!

If you are looking for a career changing opportunity, we want to meet you!

The Sr. BI Developer is responsible for analyzing data and reporting on trends and activities for various departments within the organization. This includes collecting, tracking, analyzing and disseminating information that provides support to a variety of stakeholders i.e. Finance, Sales, Operations, HR, Architecture, Engineering, PMO, Marketing, etc.

The Sr. BI Developer must be able to think critically to deliver existing performance analysis on trends and will make recommendations. They must be able to acquire data from multiple sources including Microsoft SQL and Postgres databases. They must be able to understand the data gathered from ERP, CRM, HR and other applications to create insightful reports, presented in a variety of formats for both internal and external customers. To be effective in this role, the candidate needs to be attentive to detail in a dynamic work environment, balancing multiple projects and work activities.

The role will assist in full life cycle analysis to include requirements, design and activities related to implementation of databases, data collection systems, reporting and presentation systems. You must be comfortable working with a variety of teams and be able to communicate succinctly with technical and non-technical departments. Strong communication, organization, documentation, and analytical skills are required to fulfill the duties expected of this position.

Do you have the Right Skills and Experience for our Team?
Bachelors or Associates Degree or equivalent experience.
At least five (5) years related experience and background in a data intelligence position in a multitasking environment, preferably within a technology or services environment
General knowledge of data assets, data requirements, and data reporting
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (PowerBI and Sql Server Reporting Services (SSRS), databases (Microsoft SQL (MSSQL), Postgres), SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) and similar applications
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience with ServiceNow, Salesforce, or Great Plains, a plus
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft office products required with advanced skills in Excel
Previous experience and understanding of technical service tickets preferred
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Organize and think through desired end to end outcome before starting a task
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and the ability to communicate with a range of customers
Ability to work in a high-pressure environment on non-repetitive tasks
Dependability excellent attendance record, follows instructions, responds to management direction and solicits feedback to improve performance
Must be extremely detailed oriented with exceptional focus on accuracy and quality output. Produces work that is accurate and thorough and monitors own work to ensure quality
Excellent organizational skills - ability to anticipate and prioritize daily workflow to effectively meet deadlines
Ability to tolerate peak workloads, multiple assignments and projects from multiple leaders, and produce results with accuracy and reliability. Ability to demonstrate a calm demeanor and retain composure in dynamic work environment
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced team environment with minimal supervision
Professional presence and demeanor; strong commitment to provide exceptional customer service
What GREAT things will you be doing?
Collaborate with managers to define reporting requirements
Design and develop core organization reports, working to improve the quality of information provided to both internal and external customers
Identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and clean data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to locate and correct issues and providing quality insurance of data
Create and Analyze reports and performance data to provide assessments of trends, and to identify and explain variances from goals and prior periods, and to identify indicators of possible performance issues or changes in future business activities from multiple sources
Collaborate, coordinate, and communicate across departments regarding data availability and the delivery of management reports
Increase effectiveness, accuracy, and speed of all reporting/analytics requirements by automating reporting requirements
Work closely with other teams in a team-oriented environment, but also able to function independently
Take ownership of projects and prioritize assignments
Train end users on new reports and dashboards
Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines
Performs other duties as assigned and required. Duties and responsibilities may change from time to time without notice and include, but are not limited to, the duties described above.

Job Description:
Who We Are


WillowTree is an award-winning digital product agency driven by innovation and grounded in strategy and user-centered design. We create long-term partnerships with the world's leading brands to design and build digital flagship products crucial to their core business. We are one of the largest independent digital firms in the US. Our clients include HBO, National Geographic, Nestle, PepsiCo, and many more.

The Opportunity


As a Senior Digital Analyst, you'll help our clients track and measure user behavior and engagement within their flagship digital products. You'll use tools such as Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Amplitude, and Mixpanel. You'll create comprehensive analytics strategies and uncover product insights to help us build and optimize the best digital products possible for our clients and their customers.

*This is a full-time opportunity on-site at our headquarters in Charlottesville, VA.

Responsibilities
You'll lead workshops with clients to understand their business and user goals and translate them into trackable outcomes within their digital products
You'll audit our clients' existing analytics strategies. You'll recommend the best analytics tools (e.g. Adobe Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude, Google Analytics) to suit their unique needs
While you won't be writing code, you'll collaborate closely with engineers to dive into technical documentation and provide guidance on how to integrate analytics into the codebase
You'll find meaningful and actionable insights from the data, and create user-friendly dashboards to illustrate your findings
You'll effectively present recommendations and tell the story behind the data to our clients and teams
Qualifications
You have 3+ years of experience leading the digital analytics strategy for clients and/or digital products
You've developed strategies to capture user behavior and engagement on digital platforms such as web or mobile
You've partnered with stakeholders from business, marketing, and/or engineering teams to guide product decisions and roadmaps
You can effectively translate business objectives into trackable metrics
You're a strong communicator and presenter who can tell the story behind data so that it's meaningful and actionable
You've familiar with a breadth of digital analytics tools specifically for measuring user data on digital platforms e.g.Amplitude, Mixpanel, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc and can guide clients in selecting the ideal tool for their needs
You're a data advocate and can both articulate and demonstrate the value of data to clients and project teams
Bonus Points
You've worked with marketing teams to implement growth marketing specific tools or platforms like Segment, Braze, or Branch
You have in-depth experience capturing and measuring user behavior on native mobile
You've helped a client migrate from one analytics tool to another
You've worked on eCommerce digital products
P.S. In an ideal world, you have all the bullet points we listed, but hey we know that's a lot of bullets. If you feel confident about a good amount of them, we can ramp you up on the rest.

WillowTree celebrates our differences and provides equal employment opportunities to all team members and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Here at Scotts Miracle-Gro there is no such thing as a typical day. Our culture is constantly energized by new and exciting growth opportunities and at a rapid pace. Every Associate plays an important role in providing innovative solutions for today’s gardeners and growers and contributing new ideas to improve operations. In our company you need grit, it is what we were founded on over 150 years ago and is what keeps us growing. Regardless of your level in the organization there is a platform for your voice to be heard and the ability to influence change. Family, community and hard working values are weaved into all that we do. Come grow with us, where we develop and nurture the next generation of leaders.

We are looking for a Senior Financial Analyst who will join our Manufacturing and Distribution Finance Team and grow at our corporate office in Marysville, Ohio.

This position will be based at The Scotts Miracle-Gro world headquarters in Marysville, a suburb of Columbus, OH. Not familiar with Columbus? Visit columbusregion.com/columbus-2020/

The Senior Financial Analystis responsible to assist multiple facilities (manufacturing and distribution) (local and non-local) in financial performance tracking and reporting. This role supports the Controller of Scotts Miracle-Gro.

In this role you will:
Assist in the monthly close process, including general ledger accounting, account reconciliation, variance analysis and plant reporting.
Assist in monthly forecasting and annual budgeting process.
Work with plant cost center owners in compliance with forecast and budget spending.
Individual must be capable of assisting in identifying, creating and implementing cost savings opportunities, process and procedure improvements and enhancing financial reporting.
Must be able to work on accounting and operational issues that require communicating with various levels of the organization (production associates to Corporate finance).
Responsible for interacting with a wide variety of people and functions.
Special projects.
The perfect person will have:
Two - seven years of professional accounting or finance experience.
Bachelor's Degree in accounting or finance
High degree of financial analysis to help interpret financial data.
Demonstrates passion for customers, consumers, and associates.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Strong and effective communicator internally and externally.
Operates with a sense of ownership.
Some other nice to have’s:
Manufacturing accounting/finance experience.
SAP / R3 experience.
Business warehouse skills.
CPA, CMA, MBA or other professional designation .
What we do for our associates (just to list a few cool ones):
Offer extremely competitive benefits including: Health, Dental and Vision coverage.
Onsite wellness center which includes: 2,400 sq. ft. fitness center, Walgreens pharmacy and Doctor’s office.
Beautiful campus and corporate offices designed like a log cabin offering free coffee, chef run cafe and the best crushed ice!
Unbelievable 401K match and discounted stock purchasing program.
Our commitment to diversity and inclusion includes four employee resource groups: Scotts Women’s Network, Scotts Black Employee Network, Scotts Veterans Network and Scotts Young Professionals.
Generous vacation day policy.
Various associate engagement activities throughout the year including intramural sports leagues.
Not interested in this role? Stay up to date on future opportunities by joining our ScottsMiracle-Gro and Hawthorne Gardening talent networks.

Job Segment:
Systems Analyst, Manager, CAPA, Law, Technology, Management, Quality, Legal

Monday, May 4, 2020

Market monitoring is responsible for protecting both consumers and market participants by identifying and reporting market design issues, market manipulation, and evaluating market performance. In fulfilling this role, we rely on a multidisciplinary team with expertise in economics, financial analysis, engineering, data science and law.


How You Will Make an Impact

Routine monitoring of market outcomes and participant behavior, and performing in-depth empirical analysis of market performance and efficiency. Apply economic principles to practical and challenging electricity market issues. Work with large and complex data, and develop a detailed understanding of wholesale electricity market mechanics and the interactions between markets.

• Market Surveillance

• Continuously track market outcomes, identify and explain trends and outliers

• Design, develop and run screening tools to identify market performance issues, non-compliance with market rules and uncompetitive behavior

• Identify and source relevant data through research and proactive engagement with colleagues

• Build data queries and analysis in a programming language

• Economic Analysis

• Scope and perform empirical analysis of market performance, market efficiency and behavior

• Evaluate current and new market rules changes and recommend enhancements

• Reporting

• Present complex and technical content to a diverse audience through written reports and presentations

• Write clear and insightful content, collaborate with colleagues to make connections between report sections

• Investigations

• Identify market outcomes and market participant behavior that warrants further investigation and analysis

• Conduct investigations and make referrals to the federal energy regulator


What We Are Looking For

• Master’s Degree in Economics or Finance.

• Strong quantitative skills with emphasis on analysis using SAS or similar programming language.

• Experience working with very large and complex data sets desirable.

• Ability to conduct forensic-like investigations of market outcomes and participant behavior.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to communicate complex findings and ideas, in plain language, at an executive, board member or regulator level.

• Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment.

• Ability to change direction quickly in response to changing information, priorities, policies, rules or the results of an analysis.

• Proactively seek clarification of requirements and direction; take responsibility when needed.

The position is open to qualified candidates at various levels, ranging from Associate to Senior Analyst. The level depends on a number of considerations, including, but not limited to:
• experience in a similar role

• technical proficiency

• academic background

• ability to manage and lead projects

• ability to mentor analysts, and

• level of communication and interpersonal skills.

ISO New England oversees the 24/7 operation of the power grid that covers the six-states of New England and administers the region’s $10+ billion “stock exchange” for the buying and selling of wholesale electricity. The power system is constantly evolving as new technologies emerge and energy policies evolve. There is a lot going on at our organization behind the scenes to make sure the grid continuously yields reliable electricity at competitive prices while addressing the unique challenges that come along with our industry.

What We Offer: ISO New England is located in Holyoke, MA. The company provides a base salary plus bonus, competitive Medical and Dental plan, paid vacation, 401k with company match, retirement plan and more. All benefits start on your first day.

Equal Opportunity

Job Title: Accounting Analyst / Sr. Analyst High Risk Assets Capital Accounts
Job Description:
At Farm Credit Mid-America, we believe people are our strongest asset. We are consistently looking to hire individuals from a wide range of experience and capabilities who have a desire to serve. Currently, we have over 1,100 employees across Indiana, Ohio, Kentucky and Tennessee.

BASIC FUNCTION:
Provides accounting services to Farm Credit Mid-America offices by analyzing requests, reconciling loan and general ledger related accounts, maintaining efficient and accurate financials in connection with high risk assets, participations, syndications, investments, providing phone support to retail offices and/or customers, creating accounting system entries using the appropriate procedures and accounting principles, provide cash management support to Agribank and retail offices, and ensuring the work is accurate. This position is expected to resolve a wide variety of accounting, accounting system, and treasury management issues and refers to the director for resolution. This position is also responsible for training other staff (central and retail office) and monitoring their work quality, track basic work quality progress of other accountants for the director and assists in the completion and dissemination of accounting requests between accountants.

SUPERVISES:
The employee does not directly supervise any employee, but they are responsible for coaching others as part of the team environment. The employee will coordinate and communicate with members of the Financial Operations team, senior management, retail leaders, and Louisville office support leaders. They will also represent the High Risk Accounting & Capital Accounts (HRACA) group on cross-functional teams, and attend meetings on behalf of the director and the HRACA team.

The Senior High Risk Accounting & Capital Accounts Analyst is also responsible for training other staff (Louisville and retail office), monitoring work quality and tracking basic work quality progress of other accountants in partnership with the Director. They will also be responsible for departmental project work, and representing the HRACA team on cross-functional teams and projects. This position assists in the completion and workload distribution of the HRACA requests between team members. Attends advanced training courses to prepare for advancement and build competency in serving as a backup for the Director.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide quality service and support to Farm Credit Mid-America staff, customers, AgriBank staff, and outside vendors by answering questions, researching problems, and providing solutions from multiple sources including email, multi-line phone queue, and internal software systems. Maintain expertise in accounting systems, association practices and procedures and cash management protocols to provide technical support to Farm Credit Mid-America staff, Agribank staff and Farm Credit Mid-America customers.
Process/approve remittances and other transactions to identify fees payable to the Association, State specific programs, and other third-party partners while also validating the external transactions generated by other HRACA teammates.
Acquire and maintain knowledge of general ledger, sold records, interest rates, capital markets, syndications, investments, and agribusiness in order to identify and resolve problems utilizing accounting systems and other resources.
Perform HRACA servicing actions, loan modifications, and reconciliation of high-risk asset and capital accounts based on analysis of accounting requests that require the application of ASC 310; 360; FCA 620, and other Accounting or regulatory standards. These Accounting requests will require analyzing legal documents, document validation for data integrity, and complex problem solving.
HRACA Analyst will prepare and submit accounting entries involving complex calculations and transactions (including gains, losses, charge offs, reserves, income recognition, and loan/investment modifications).
Monitor credit bureau compliance surrounding loan servicing while also adhering to RESPA & CFPB compliance standards. Update and maintain credit bureau reporting for discharges, releases, past due counters and other legal actions while assuring high data integrity standards.
Enforce association fraud prevention and compliance by processing and obtaining approval for outgoing wires, ACH disbursement setups, fraud analyst review, and internal/external fraud review.
Analyze association-rejected transactions in relation to fraud monitoring protocols and Accounting guidelines. Monitor, document, and report changes that could impact financials
Monitor, process entries, and maintenance association Other Real Estate Owned properties to correctly treat assets in financial reporting and GAAP guidelines under ASC 310;360.
Analyze reporting for loans requiring servicing actions, charge offs, reserves, and disqualification. Review association loan portfolio for potentially distressed accounts, delinquencies, and loans that require special handling under FCA 621.
Acquire and maintain expertise in accounting systems, association practices and procedures, GAAP/ASC guidelines, and cash management protocols to provide technical support to Farm Credit Mid-America staff and internal/external bank staff, while maintaining the integrity and control processes surrounding treasury and cash management functions
Create reports and data monitoring tools via the Data Warehouse or other data retrieval options to maintain the integrity of the Accounting system and related applications. Maintaining data integrity in third party reporting in regards to delinquencies, IRS reporting, and other internal/external reporting.
HRACA Analyst will monitor reports and reconcilements for accurate financial reporting complete loan loss analysis, cash basis testing for the association, and any other reports needed to prevent data misstatements. Maintain regulatory compliance for consumer (CFPB & RESPA) loans.
Audit completed HRACA servicing actions and HRACA reconciliations by other team members for accuracy, timeliness and production analysis
Represent HRACA in meetings with external/internal auditors, Internal Control reviewers, and other accounting projects and cross-functional teams.
Train and mentor new team members.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Additional responsibilities of the Senior Accounting Analyst includes:

Participates actively in and/or facilitates team meetings to support the Director and identify issues for discussion and training.
Represents HRACA team and the Director on cross-functional team projects. Projects could represent Association or District initiatives.
Support and facilitate the training and mentoring of new team members.
Monitoring and Reviewing HRACA team process and manuals for accuracy and facilitates the updates for changes in process and/or accounting practices.
Shows significant experience and expertise in the major responsibilities above

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Associate’s Degree or equivalent classroom hours plus four years of experience in relevant loan servicing, accounting, banking or financially related customer support while using a variety of business software, demonstrating proficiency in Excel; one to two years of Association experience desired or Bachelor’s Degree plus two to three years of experience in loan servicing, accounting, banking or financially related customer support using a variety of business software, demonstrating proficiency in Excel; one to two years of Association experience desired .

Farm Credit Mid-America is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other category protected by law.

About Us
Dama Financial is a financial technology startup focused on partnering with banks to serve business customers around the country. Given the nature of our partnership model, the settlement function is critical to the success of our business. With that in mind, we are looking for a CDD/EDD/KYC Compliance Analyst with the experience and energy necessary to help build a CDD/EDD/KYC function that can scale and support the rapid growth of our business.
Seeking Kansas City and Surrounding Area Candidates for this position.
Relocation assistance is not offered.

Duties & Responsibilities
The CDD/EDD/KYC Compliance Analyst assists in the day to day onboarding account process. This position within the Corporate Risk Management team will report to Chief Risk Officer at Dama Financial. This role involves reviewing Know Your Customer (KYC) documentation and conducting customer due diligence (CDD) and Customer Identification Program (CIP) during onboarding and on a risk-based frequency for existing Customers. Provides subject matter expertise to Risk Management Team and enablement partners to ensure documentation meets regulatory requirements. Individuals in this role must possess strong time management skills and be able to balance a variety of competing tasks. Attention to detail, strong writing skills and the ability to work in a sensitive, deadline-driven environment are a must

Duties of the position will include, but are not limited to:
Understanding of prospective, new or existing partners relationship with applicant including AML/BSA and risks associated with provided products and service.
Receiving and completing requests for of prospective, new, and existing applicants.
Conducting research using open source information, and multiple internal systems to complete CIP/CDD/EDD reviews.
Ensuring all applicants, their beneficial owners, and account controllers undergo screening when appropriate, Adverse Media searches, that the dispositions of false-positives are documented and possible matches are escalated appropriately
Assessing the risk and proposing mitigations or controls based on the body of evidence collected
Concluding the CIP/CDD/EDD review with clear written communication and documenting evidence in the system of records.
Reviewing applicant contracts and assessing, CIP/CDD/EDD questionnaires, and risk appetite to ensure compliance with AML/BSA and regulatory requirements.
Advise C.O.R.E Team regarding US client onboarding, customer due diligence and enhanced due diligence standards and requirements.
Complete CIP/CCD/EDD reviews in a timely and efficient manner. Suggest process enhancements and/or research tools to increase efficiency and/or accuracy.
Providing recommendations on modifications required to CIP/CDD/EDD questionnaires, and Standard Operating Procedures based on changes in the AML/BSA regulatory environment
Promote a risk-aware culture; ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and practices.
Recommend enhancements for marketing materials for products and services to ensure compliance requirements are considered or included;
Review and contribute to compliance training materials for staff, as needed;
Participate in meetings with co-workers, individually or in a group, to identify gaps within current practices and regulatory requirements and then rectify the process to assure regulatory compliance;
Review and make recommendations for policies and procedures to meet current regulatory expectations or and assist in making updates as regulatory changes occur;
Monitor new and any proposed laws and regulations in a timely manner and establish compliance obligations to allow Dama to effectively meet these requirements;
Review and understand consumer complaints received by the organization so accurate and compliant responses are communicated to consumers;
Conduct research and data gathering for the completion of compliance requirements for new products & services; and
Other duties as assigned.

Knowledge & Skills
Minimum
Working knowledge of compliance regulations governing Bank Secrecy Act & Anti-Money Laundering (BSA/AML), Patriot Act (CIP), Treasury Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC), FFIEC advisory guidelines regarding Know Your Customer (KYC), Customer Due Diligence (CDD), Enhanced Due Diligence (EDD) and other areas to include consumer banking, credit card, prepaid card, and third-party risk management.
Ability to develop and maintain rapport with co-workers to effectively obtain and communicate compliance information.
Identify and assess regulatory compliance risks and develop appropriate strategies to mitigate risk.
Effectively detect patterns and conditions through observing processes.
Organized with ability to maintain a complex annual review calendar.
Ability to work independently.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and computer proficiency.

Preferred
3+ years of experience or equivalent in audit program development, internal control consulting, or risk management utilizing.
CAMS or relative certification various automated tools and techniques.
Experience within credit card industry.
Exhibit superior time management skills (measured by deadlines and quality of progress and projects completed).
Advanced decision-making aptitude.
Demonstrates ability to deal with and meet tight deadlines with limited resources.
Demonstrates ability to manage multiple projects.

Requirements
Minimum
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration (w/
strong emphasis in Accounting or Finance).
• 2+ years of BSA Analyst with BSA/AML/OFAC experience within a bank setting.

Target Competencies
• Achievement Orientation
• Communication/Interpersonal Skills
• Demonstrates Integrity
• Initiative
• Internal Partnering
• Problem Solving
• Teamwork and Cooperation
• Business and Industry Acumen
• Technology Proficiency
• Project Management
• Leadership/Management

Work Environment
Ability to handle highly confidential and sensitive information; possess skills to work independently or in a group setting; Flexible personality, as needs change depending on needs of the organization; can Influence a large span of relationships and levels; general business office environment.

Due to the nature of financial systems, you will be required to pass a background check.
Benefits
Healthcare
401K

Position Summary

As a key member of Internal Audit, this role will explore innovative ways to leverage data as well as design and develop analytics/automation that will improve and optimize Internal Audit initiatives in helping to achieve the objectives of the annual audit plan. This role will also explore efficiencies in current activities by exploring automation, and influence the ways we think about data and use technology in the audit process. This position provides a unique opportunity to leverage data skills and advance one’s audit skills through exposure to the company’s many different functions.

Duties and Responsibilities
Identifying, designing and developing analytics protocols, standards and reporting to support Internal Audit activities.
Using technology tools to automate audit testing and develop techniques for continuous auditing and analyzing large volumes of data.
Planning, performing, drawing conclusions and reporting on internal audits as assigned in accordance with the annual audit plan.
Researching current internal audit and financial best practices/techniques with each engagement.
Following up on audit recommendations to ensure resolution.
Building/maintaining effective professional relationships within Internal Audit and Senior Leadership.
Assisting in preparation of quarterly reports to the Audit Committee and Senior Leadership.
Assisting external auditors with audits they have Internal Audit perform for their annual audit.
Attending training/webinars/seminars to obtain appropriate level of annual Continuing Professional Education hours, with learning to be applied in the workplace.
Providing input on department’s risk assessment and annual plan.
Taking on special projects or assignments as requested.

Position Qualifications
Competencies

For all GreatAmerica team members: Honesty/Integrity, Customer Oriented, Accountability, Tenacious, Communication Skills (Oral & Written), Adaptability

For this position: strong communication skills – both verbal and written, strong quantitative analytical and problem solving skills, detail-oriented, ability to see the big picture/think critically, and ability to get along well with others at all levels of the company/team player.

Education: Bachelor’s degree in a Business-related field (Accounting, Finance, Information Systems) or STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) is preferred.

Experience 2 - 3 years of relevant experience, advanced Excel, technical and/or data analytics knowledge a plus. Certification, or a desire to obtain certification preferred. Knowledge of the lease industry a plus.

Skills and Abilities

A mixture of multidisciplinary skills, ranging from data analytics, accounting, internal controls, auditing techniques and communication/presentation is preferred.

Advanced proficiency in Excel (Visual Basic and Pivot Tables), with general knowledge of Microsoft Suite preferred.

Data Visualization experience with tools such as Tableau is a plus.

Data Analytics / Business Intelligence experience is a plus.

Experience acquiring data via SQL routines is a plus.

Other Requirements

Good interpersonal and communication skills (both written & verbal), Ability and willingness to travel which is only occasional. Willing to work more than 40 hour weeks as the demands and the expectation of the department dictate

Collaborates with HR, Finance and IT stakeholders, providing subject matter expertise. Plans, organizes, and supports current requirements and long-term objectives. Partners with stakeholders to play a significant role in helping to plan and manage projects related to new functionality, process improvement and system update release management. Implements system support initiatives and optimization projects, supporting HR and Payroll systems and related projects.

Job Description:

Acts as primary analyst in support of the Kronos Workforce Dimensions application and Intouch 9000/9100 timeclocks with secondary support for Workday.
Supports full service end user support for systems end users in HR and business users by troubleshooting problems, analyzing root cause, answering questions, thoroughly testing solutions, creating and/or modifying reports, and planning/creating documentation as needed related to the Kronos timekeeping application functions supporting timekeeping, attendance, leave of absence and analytics.

Maintains professional and technical knowledge by: review of professional publications; staying current on industry trends/research; participating in educational workshops/ training courses; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional/ technical user and management groups; establishing/maintaining personal networks and user group memberships.

Experience in configuring and testing of Workday modules, including (but not limited to) one or more functional areas: HCM, Recruiting, Benefits, Compensation, Talent, Performance, Payroll, Learning.

Knowledge of reporting, analytics and use of related tools.
Strong presentation and communication skills with experience presenting to mid-level and senior management.
Experience developing and implementing business and system process improvements and setting standards.
Experience working with business users in understanding and resolving process and system issues.
Must have the ability to work effectively under and manage to strict production, time and performance deadlines at times.
Ability to effectively function both individually and in a team environment.
Self-motivated with ability to prioritize and manage changing priorities.

Ability to adjust from “leading” to “doing” (and vice versa), comfortable supporting needs and resources as they evolve and grow/shrink.
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills breaking down complex problems into essential elements, using data and information to communicate business needs/value, drive design decisions, or isolate execution issues.
Proven ability to maintain confidentiality of data, reporting results and other company sensitive issues.
PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES (Specialized education, specific software experience, etc.)

Experience with Dell Boomi integration development
Kronos Workforce Dimensions and Workday Pro certifications

Job Description:
JOB TITLE:

International Business Development Analyst (Japan)

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Execute business development and corporate market research programs by devising collection methods and then collect targeted data to identify and evaluate potential Japan-based corporate partners for participation in Plug & Play’s IoT Acceleration program. The purpose is to work with these companies to develop potential partnerships/investment opportunities with Plug & Play’s existing portfolio of over 900 start-up companies. Research recent corporate acquisitions by Japan-based companies. In doing so, review key metrics for consideration (including company revenues and profitability, and in particular the year-over-year growth in these metrics; industry-specific key performance indicators in comparison to incumbents and other technology companies; and qualitative factors including company personnel, product/service key differentiators obtained through direct person-to-person interviews). Follow the buyer's market and trends for startups being acquired. Present acquisition trends to internal team members and to portfolio company founders that are at an exit stage and ready to be acquired. Reach out to new Japan-based corporations across multiple technology sectors and introduce Plug and Play's general portfolio to determine matching needs. Prepare short reports and present market findings to Plug & Play management. Work with Plug and Play’s dedicated Marketing team to evaluate the text, other content, and “look and feel” of webpages targeted to the Japan-based companies.

Conduct market research and analyses of IoT sector startup companies to determine their viability for participation in Plug & Play’s IoT Acceleration Program. Afterwards, continue analyses and communicate with selected program participants to support the program’s market exploration and investment activities: Comparative and statistical review of start-up activity (overall volume, distribution across faculties, industry focus, Intellectual Property generation, etc.). Review business plans of start-up companies (Market potential, scalability, and financial modeling/profitability analysis)—for purpose of vetting and assessing viability of business for obtaining investment, valuation, and etc. Conduct comparative review and analyses of economic data (activity levels across countries, technology sectors, public and private investment flows, etc.). Conduct comparative review of venture funding availability and levels, and return on venture investments. Present market findings to Japan-based corporate partners.

Conduct deal flows by matching startup technologies to the interests of large Japan-based corporations in the IoT sector. The goal is to find and match companies with complementary technologies and/or aligned business objectives: Analyze and assess technological compatibility and integration possibilities between startups’ technologies and the larger corporations’ portfolio of technologies. Valuate and analyze startup’s technologies and companies that fit within the larger corporations’ focus and direction, for possible collaboration efforts, investment, and/or acquisition. Present value propositions of startup companies to Japan-based corporate partners.

Travel to Asia required 2-3 times per year to visit clients and potential clients.

JOB LOCATION:

Plug & Play, LLC.; 440 N. Wolfe Rd., Sunnyvale, CA 94085.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Economics, or a related field. Fluency in Japanese and English is required.

TO APPLY:

Mail Resumé to Jobs; Plug & Play, LLC.; 440 N. Wolfe Rd., Sunnyvale, CA 94085. Please identify job that you are seeking.

Credit Acceptance is proud to be an award-winning company! Our history of excellence and growth has resulted in many exciting career opportunities. For the 7th year in a row, we have been named one of Fortune Magazine’s 100 Best Companies to Work For. Our team members have created a world-class culture that promotes a positive workplace and drives us to succeed, making us one of the largest used car finance companies nationally.

Our Operations teams work with our consumers to promote great service, encourage them to bring their accounts current and resolve escalated issues. Team Members specialize in various segments of the contract life cycle to achieve the highest levels of performance. We are committed to providing career growth opportunities to our Team Members and we are proud of our record of promoting from within. Our flexible schedules, casual work environment and culture of having fun make this a Great Place to Work!

The growth of Credit Acceptance continues to create opportunities within our Dealer Service Center. Our program empowers car dealers nationally to help consumers purchase a vehicle. Team members in the Dealer Service Center enroll dealers quickly and assist them to grow their business while delivering superior customer service. The team is key in driving our contract volume and promotes a culture that has landed us on the Great Place to Work list for Best Workplaces for Millennials.

About this Position:

The Bilingual Credit Analyst position will be responsible for accepting assignment of contracts from car dealers. The contracts are sent to our Dealer Service Center (DSC) by auto dealers. The role of an analyst in the DSC is to help our dealers DEVELOP and grow their businesses in a manner that is compliant and efficient while delivering superior customer service.

Review, validate and verify information through document review, internet searches and phone calls.

Keep the dealer’s pipeline open by managing any license, title, audit and inventory issues.
Welcome and onboard new dealers by offering initial funding assistance.

Experience using Excel and Word.

Document records clearly and efficiently.
Learn quickly and apply knowledge learned.

Handle difficult conversations professionally.

Experience reviewing contracts/legal documents with a strong attention to detail.

Our Company Values:

To be successful in this role, Team Members need to demonstrate the characteristics of PRIDE in their work:
Positive: Maintain a positive attitude by focusing on solutions and promoting a collaborative and enjoyable environment.

Role Summary


The Senior Business Analyst will work closely with CommerceHub's Retail partners to understand and document their requirements during initial integration and well after they become longstanding partners with new feature functionality to aid their growth in the online marketplaces. Duties will include preparing and navigating requirements documentation through the contract process and then remaining close to the project as it progresses through deployment and handover to Customer Support.

Specific Duties


Responsible for the following:
Understanding, utilizing, and providing guidance on key data store and database technologies
Organize and host meetings with Retail Partners to understand and document their project requirements. Expect domestic and international travel up to 20%. The Senior Business Analyst should be comfortable being onsite with the client—with business, technical, and executive audiences to elicit requirements.
Collaborate with internal teams and subject matter experts to determine an engineering solution.
Work with internal teams to establish a level of effort and timeline to deliver the solution.
Prepare Business Requirements Documentation and Statements of Work to present back to the client. Knowledge of BPMN / UML diagramming tools a plus.
Assist and guide Engineering Quality Assurance by providing Use Case diagrams and documentation. Perform a final review of the engineered solution before delivering to the client for acceptance testing.
Requirements


Successful candidates for the position must meet the following requirements:
Excellent client management skills (Prompt, Comprehensive and Professional)
Strong organizational skills with ability to participate in and facilitate cross-functional teamwork and deliver outcomes
An engaging personality that brings passion while maintaining an uncompromising level of professionalism
An ambitious, and self-motivated team player who has vision and demonstrates strong leadership
Specific knowledge regarding ecommerce, order fulfillment, logistics, supplier management, and consumer product preferred
BA/BS degree in related field required. PMP training or accreditation a plus.
3+ years of Business Analysis experience in e-commerce marketplace retail or a related field
Mastery of business requirements elicitation techniques required.
Knowledge of relational databases and data analysis (Proficiency in SQL preferred)
Experience interpreting structured data formats (XML, JSON, EDI, etc.)
Ability to think critically and bridge technological solutions with business problems
Knowledge of Scrum Agile methodology and SDLC processes is a strong plus.
Demonstrate outstanding technical writing and verbal communication skills.
Be an engaging, confident public speaker, particularly in front of clients.
Excellent decision making, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Be able to work efficiently in a time-sensitive environment, both as part of a team and independently.
Strong knowledge and experience establishing metrics and reporting to assess and track results.
Demonstrated attention to detail and commitment to high quality work, with a strong focus on internal/external customer satisfaction.
Ability to demonstrate and articulate creative thinking and a willingness to implement new approaches.
Maintain composure in critical situations and communicates well with both internal and external clients
Additionally, knowledge of and/or experience with the following is a plus:
Commerce, Retail industry and/or supply chain experience is a strong plus.
Knowledge of Scrum Agile methodology and SDLC processes is a strong plus

Jenzabar is seeking an enthusiastic, self-motivated Business Systems Analyst to work closely with the users of our various Enterprise Systems to develop and improve cross organization operational processes and systems implementations with a strong focus on NetSuite and Salesforce.

Reporting to the Director of Information Technology, you will work directly with all interested parties to document functional and technical requirements that meet business needs, provide creative solutions, as well as conduct analysis and define business cases related to the implementation of new solutions. You will have the opportunity to evaluate and conduct a detailed analysis of comparable solutions for various business teams. The role also entails performing NetSuite and Salesforce application configuration, including simple to complex workflows, roles and permissions, and defining and configuring applications to support data models and structures. In this role, you must have excellent business analysis, project management, and technical capabilities.

As the Business Systems Analyst, you will:
Collaborate with project teams, business user groups, technical teams, and solutions providers.
Identify opportunities for process optimization, process redesign, or development of new process / use cases and user stories, writing requirements, building prototypes and leading business process discussions.
Create and maintain documentation, process workflows, charts, models, technical designs, and user stories.
Develop and nurture training program to enhance user adoption, ease on-boarding of new users, and ongoing awareness of new features and functionality.
Utilize a broad portfolio of technologies and ensure that they are all operating efficiently to meet business needs.
Act as a subject-matter expert for solutions owned by the team.
Administer and configure business systems such as NetSuite, Salesforce, and Boomi.
Prepare and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential trouble areas in operating systems across the organization.
Create and maintain project plans, schedules, and other key documents that keep the project on track for successful execution and on-time delivery.
Develop and sustain strong working relationships with all project stakeholders in a specific project area.
Assist as needed with backlog prioritization and the resolution of defects.
Perform user acceptance testing, as required
Stay abreast of changing technologies and marketplace solutions and IT-related business opportunities to support the IT leadership and serve as a pathfinder and technical expert to the leadership and the IT team.
Requirements
5-7 years experience in Business Analyst role
NetSuite Suite Foundation Certification required; NetSuite Administrator Certification preferred.
Ability to transform business objective use cases to user story solutions.
Exposure to Sales, Sales Operations, Finance and Customer Support processes.
Experience with enterprise system implementations, business analysis and solution architecture for global companies.
Experience with NetSuite platform, including administration, configuration and implementation experience required.
Experience with Salesforce.com platform, including administration, configuration and implementation experience required.
Ability to understand project scope to enable change identification and risk escalation.
Experience managing and delivering end user expectations.
Preferred Qualifications
Salesforce Administrator certification desired.
Experience with Professional Services Automation tools.
Self- starter who is able to work independently with minimal supervision. Able to manage multiple tasks and prioritize time appropriately.
Work effectively with engineering teams.
Naturally organized, analytical and detailed oriented. Energetic self-starter passionate about professional integrity and excellence with a positive attitude and contagious enthusiasm.
Strong relationship building/partnering skills and the ability to work with varying levels of individual contributors and management. Comfortable presenting to executives.
Ability to influence peers and managers while dealing with ambiguity.
Ability to communicate business needs to technical people and to communicate and simplify complex technical information for non-technical people.
Ability to learn quickly in a dynamic environment.
Excellent spoken and written communication as well as receptive listening skills, with ability to present complex ideas in a clear, concise fashion to technical and non-technical audiences.
Excellent team player able to work with virtual and global cross functional teams.
Project estimation, planning and management skills, time management, and resource assignment. Ability to understand internal and external customer needs, to establish and maintain a high level of customer trust with all staff and confidence in the team's knowledge of and concern for business requirements and user experience.
Prior experience with HubSpot, Conga, Data Management/Integration tools would be a plus.
