The Compensation Analyst, reporting directly to the Director of Compensation, assists in the implementation and administration of competitive and legally compliant compensation program. Collaborates with Talent Acquisition and HR Business Partner team members to conduct job evaluations, determine competitive pricing that is in line with market trends and provide sound compensation analysis. Prepares compensation recommendations requiring a solid understanding of compensation techniques, methods, and practices. Typically provides compensation analysis and support as a Center of Excellence for HR Business Partners and Talent Acquisition, as well as assigned client groups. Utilizes analytical methods and tools to ensure enterprise level compensation programs are administered consistently and reflect Empower’s compensation philosophy.

DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES/ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Under general direction of the Director of Compensation, assists with the administration of the company-wide compensation function which includes creating, implementing and administering market competitive fixed and variable pay programs that comply with applicable laws and regulations.
Provide guidance to HR Business Partners, Talent Acquisition and managers, typically for assigned client groups, to develop compensation solutions and comprehensive pay decisions, along with educating on factors that should be considered in such decisions.
Partners with other HR groups, leaders or managers to provide support of and execution on major project initiatives including, but not limited to: automation and HR systems; the annual merit, bonus and equity cycle; annual salary survey participation; job architecture ; data integrity ; due diligence in support of the company's annual salary policy recommendations; and mid-year promotions and salary adjustments. This may involve developing project plans, monitoring progress toward on-time completion, and preparing standard and ad hoc reports.
Conducts market analysis and makes recommendations to management. This includes job evaluations on new and existing positions, including content review, bench marking, market pricing, FLSA determination and alignment within internal salary structures, bonus and equity programs for the company.
Performs data compilation and analysis to ensure internal equity and external competitiveness.
Serves as systems administrator for applications/systems related to the administration of merit, bonus and stock (Workday); market pricing (PayScale/MarketPay), and any other compensation related systems.
Ensure that jobs are properly documented and structured. Participates in compensation and salary budget surveys. Prepares salary data for submission, matches Empower positions to survey benchmarks, maintains documentation on participation and survey reports and assists in analyzing results.
Assists in the administration of the annual salary review cycle and the annual performance bonus cycle including managing timelines, auditing data, creating draft communications, creating and delivering training, supporting the Advanced Compensation module in Workday, meeting with senior leaders, and other responsibilities.
Maintains understanding of applicable laws and regulations including FLSA, Equal Pay Act, minimum wage, etc.
Assist in audits and reviews to ensure pay compliance.
Perform analysis on ad hoc requests and projects.
Perform other duties as assigned.
EDUCATION:
Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent HR and compensation experience.
OTHER PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
3-4 years Compensation experience, preferably in a multi-state environment.
Experience with variable pay plans, budget and structure activities, and job evaluation (market pricing methodology) preferred.
Proven analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Extremely detailed and accurate, coupled with the ability to see the broader picture.
Strong communication skills and the ability to easily and clearly convey data analysis into an understandable format.
Sound judgment and a high level of integrity with the ability address sensitive and confidential information, and make good decisions under pressure.
Team collaboration skills are a must.
Must be comfortable with general analytics and reporting methodologies.
Ability to sort and sift data and make logical conclusions.
Understanding of DOL/FLSA guidelines and its application.
Proven accuracy with data entry.
Systems knowledge: Proficiency in Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, etc) is required. Intermediate-to-Advanced Excel skill is a plus.
Workday knowledge highly preferred and Workday Advanced Compensation desired.
Certified Compensation Professional (CCP) is a plus.
AUTONOMY:

The Compensation Analyst will be relied on at times to work fairly independently and exercise sound judgment, particularly as it applies to compensation program decision making.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
While performing the duties of this job, the associate may be required to stand, walk, and sit. The associate is frequently required to use hands to touch, handle, and feel, and to reach with hands and arms. The associate must be able to occasionally lift and/or move up to 25lbs/12kg.
The associate will be required to: read; communicate verbally and/or in written form; remember and analyze certain information; and remember and understand certain instructions or guidelines.
The physical and mental demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include vision at varying distances both close and far, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
We are an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity. All individuals, regardless of personal characteristics, are encouraged to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Who we are:

As the first and largest specialty pharmacy integrator and accelerator, Shields Health Solutions sits at the nexus of the $200B specialty pharmacy industry. Shields builds and manages hospital-owned specialty pharmacies for health systems who want to offer coordinated care services for patients with chronic illness. Shields Health Solutions' patient-centric TelemetryRx platform enables health systems to improve medication adherence, reduce patient readmission rates, and ultimately improve health outcomes through the collection and distillation of clinical, behavioral, and financial data. Shields Health Solutions is one of the fastest growing healthcare companies and has proven its immense impact on patients' lives

Whom we are looking for:

We are searching for an energetic and detail-oriented team-member who is looking for a challenging career with a fast-growing company in health tech. We want to meet with those of you who measure yourself on results and quality. You should be as excited by data analytics as we are; gleaming insights from noise to portray a story that informs how we think about our business. Having the foresight to anticipate potential issues and the action-bias to propose solutions. We want to rely on you to complete your work without constant oversight; we will guide you along the way to success but do not micromanage. Most importantly, we all work together as members of a close-knit team, supporting and learning from one another. If you smile reading through this, we want you on our team.

What you will do:

Enable the success of our Data Analytics team including our innovative TelemetryRx platform. We will ask to you complete analyses of opportunities to attract new patients, improve our care model, and analyze the financial success of our business. Importantly, you will be a key member of the team that completes the detailed business and financial analyses critical to our business development team, helping them understand each new opportunity as they are uncovered.

What you need:
2-4 years of experience in finance- or business-related role
Specific analytical experience in developing financial and business analyses, beyond working from a template
Undergraduate degree in finance, business, economics, or similar discipline
An analytical mind with detailed understanding of business and financial analysis
Good judgement; you will be asked to make decisions without constant oversight
Microsoft Office Suite skills, especially Excel modeling and data analysis
Energy and attention to detail; this is a fast-moving environment and getting the small things right is critical for success
Going the extra mile; high-achievers who go beyond the minimum
Details on the role:
Enables the expansion of and improves our care model to new patients by contributing information and detailed data analysis
Completes opportunity sizing analyses for potential health system partners
Problem-solve with team-members using data-driven approach
Develops and implements financial and operational forecasting models; tracks performance and communicate discrepancies to the team
Guides other teams by researching, analyzing and interpreting data
Applies observations and recommendations to increase productivity
Protects organization by keeping information confidential
Expands knowledge of Shields and specialty pharmacy by participating in the educational opportunities we offer and reading professional publications
Other projects as divvied up by the team

Job Title: IT Business Analyst / Finance PM - Temporary
Job Description:
Gainsight™ is a venture-backed, fast growing tech company revolutionizing Customer Success for businesses. The Customer Success company helps businesses grow faster by reducing churn, increasing upsell, and driving customer advocacy. Gainsight provides a complete, end-to-end Customer Success solution through its services and technology. The industry-leading platform helps companies manage customers relationships effectively, track customer health and transform the way organizations orient around the customer. Gainsight is the platform of choice for many leading companies like Box, Adobe and Workday. The company has been recognized as one of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world by Forbes, one of the fastest growing private companies in America by Inc. Magazine, and as one of 20 Great Workplaces in Tech by Fortune Magazine. Gainsight's CEO, Nick Mehta, has been recognized as one of the Top SaaS CEOs in America. The company has offices in California, Phoenix, St. Louis, London and India.

With diversity and inclusion at the forefront of Gainsight's core values, we promote a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusiveness at Gainsight, regardless of, but not limited to, race, gender, sexual orientation, family status, religion, ethnicity, national origin, physical disability, veteran status, or age.

Job Description


Lead critical Finance projects working with the Finance team, other departments, and vendors to deliver improved processes and systems (including new implementations as needed). This role requires an excellent balance of financial expertise, financial systems experience, and project management skills. Should be comfortable with a global, fast paced, multi-tasking startup environment and possess excellent communication skills for any audience. Expertise in Revenue Accounting and Revenue systems is required. This position will support our RevPro implementation.

This is a 5 to 6 month Temporary Position.

What You'll Do
Lead Finance projects to support Quote to Cash, Revenue, Expense Management, Compensation, and other Finance related business processes. Immediate focus will be on our RevPro implementation and the Quote to Cash process/system changes needed to support it.
Projects may include finance operations, process analysis & optimization, systems implementation & testing, process documentation, and training.
Evaluate business processes, anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement, develop and implement solutions.
Prepare cost-benefit analyses for projects across departments and manage project financials.
Work with department managers, team members, and vendors to implement a project schedule and ensure that teams meet milestones throughout the project lifecycle.
Take an active role in preventing delays and ensuring that deliverables are completed according to schedule.
Build and work with cross-functional teams. Coordinate across departments and motivate staff members to complete projects according to both internal and external deadlines.
Communicate with both team members and executives during the project lifecycle. Present findings to stakeholders and effectively communicate between team members and departments.
Required Skills


What We're Looking For
Combination of Finance knowledge, system implementation experience, and project management skills.
Experience with 606 Revenue in general, with RevPro specific experience being highly desired.
A bachelor's degree in business or IT or an MBA or equivalent work experience.
A minimum of 10 years experience as a Finance or IT project manager or analyst
Knowledge and experience working with Revenue Accounting systems
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
Job Benefits


At Gainsight, we don't believe in doing things as a "means to an end." Life's too short to have anything short of a joyful work environment that we passionately believe in. We think that "work vs. life" is a false choice created by pundits, cynics and consultants. We also believe that any community (like a company) needs a ton of diversity and a very small number of things that bring us together.

Here are our 5 core values
Golden Rule: We try to practice the Golden Rule ("Do unto others..." and that sort of thing) by exercising reliability, trust and giving back to each other and our community.
Success for All: We believe that success for our stakeholders—whether our teammates, clients or shareholders—comes with a sincere focus on continuous learning, selfless teaching and making a difference in each other's lives.
Child-like Joy: We aspire to experience child-like joy in our work and lives, injecting a spirit of passion, optimism and laughter into everything that we do.
Shoshin: We believe in a beginner's mind. Don't surround yourself with people like you--diversity breeds creativity.
Stay Thirsty, My Friends: We believe in a totally internally-driven strive for greatness. The solution is think more, not doing more.
Why You'll Love It Here
Our Attitude: We've created a new industry from scratch, and we're on the fast track!
Our Leadership: We offer the leading tech solution for driving Customer Success.
Our ROI: Reduce customer churn, increase up-sell, and improve customer satisfaction.
Our Technology: Deep Salesforce.com hooks, predictive analytics, and a beautiful user interface.
Our Impact: We help our customers make millions of dollars more per year.
Our Clients: Big companies like Box, Adobe, Marketo, and many others.
Our Team: Tech all-stars from Facebook, Box, and others (and top consulting firms like BCG and McKinsey!).
Our Values: They are unique - Golden Rule, Success for All, Childlike Joy, Shoshin, and Stay Thirsty, My Friends
Our Office: If you showed up one day, you might find anything from karaoke performances to mini-golf championships.
Role is in our San Mateo, CA office.

Gainsight is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, where applicable, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Help design the grid of the future. ISO New England's Operations Analysis and Integration (OAI) team is looking for an experienced candidate that can help ensure reliable operation of the Bulk Electric System through efficient administration of the Wholesale Markets. An analyst in the OAI group will do these things by leading our team in the design, testing, and analysis of software and processes for incorporating the resources of the future. This includes the integration distributed energy resources, energy storage, and a high penetration of renewable resources. Join us, and be part of this opportunity to meet the many challenges facing the electric sector in the coming years.

How you will make an Impact
Review existing software and processes used by Control Room Operators for managing the dispatch of resources and real-time operation of the Bulk Electric System
Collaborate with IT, Project Management, Market Development, and Market Administration to design and implement multi-year projects that will set up the Control Room Operators for reliable and efficient operations
Perform thorough testing and review of proposed changes to Control Room software and processes, while identifying and mitigating gaps pro-actively
Design and perform recurring or ad-hoc data and operational analysis to support sound operational decision making while challenging long standing practices
Act as a subject matter expert to assist with internal and external training related to major projects or derived from completed analytical findings
What we are looking for
Extensive knowledge of ISO New England Market Rules and Procedures
Experience operating a generation or transmission facility, overseeing the operation of a generator or transmission/distribution system, or working in a real-time Control Room environment preferably utilizing an Energy Management System
Proven project management, organizational, and leadership skills
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Demonstrated skills communicating complex concepts in simple terms, both written and verbally
Ability to manage multiple complex tasks, assess time and resource constraints, and adapt to shifting priorities
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Engineering, or related field preferred

ISO New England oversees the 24/7 operation of the power grid that covers the six-states of New England and administers the region’s $10+ billion “stock exchange” for the buying and selling of wholesale electricity. The power system is constantly evolving as new technologies emerge and energy policies evolve. There is a lot going on at our organization behind the scenes to make sure the grid continuously yields reliable electricity at competitive prices while addressing the unique challenges that come along with our industry.

What We Offer: ISO New England is located in Holyoke, MA. The company provides a base salary plus bonus, competitive Medical and Dental plan, paid vacation, 401k with company match, retirement plan and more. All benefits start on your first day.

The Jr. Supply Chain Business Analyst (SCBA) is responsible for planning, developing and executing solutions that will focus on continuous improvements of the business’ entire supply chain, initiating with new product development, strategic sourcing and supporting effective demand planning through customer satisfaction. The Analyst will support and optimize parts order management, warehouse management, 3PL and logistics management systems. Also the JSCBA will assist and improve Vendor Managed Inventory (VMI) and support Vendor Performance Assessment process. Additionally this position will be responsible for monitoring progress on specific Supply Chain projects. Moreover, by partnering with both the IT and Supply Chain functions, this role will develop, implement, and provide training on supply chain application solutions.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following: Other duties may be assigned.
Compile and analyze data from all areas of supply chain and provide recommendations to gain efficiencies and provide more responsive execution of internal processes as well as external support to the AERCO commercial team.
Develop tools and methods that streamline maintenance and updating of master data.
Able to identify IT projects related to assigned applications to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of Supply Chain activities.
Work tasks may include the following:

Develop reporting methods that allow for quick identification of issues and areas of improvement.

Prepare charts and diagrams to assist in data analysis; Use data for defined Key Performance Indicators such as: 1) Fill Rate Improvement (production downtime); 2) Backorder reduction; 3) Excess, slow moving and obsolete inventory 4) On time delivery improvements; 5) Inventory Turns, Total spend relative to demand and adjustments; 6) Supplier performance, and other KPI’s defined by the Executive team.

Define work plans; coordinate project status reporting and conducts user/team training on system capabilities.
Work with functional users in a variety of departments (e.g. Purchasing, Finance, Sales, Operations, etc) to gain a comprehensive understanding of their business processes and system needs. Use that knowledge to translate the business needs and create programs / systems.
Work with the Supply Chain Manager to Document business processes “as is” today against the future “to be” state. Critically review and recommend changes to processes in part or in their entirety.
Create and/or assist in developing written procedures for department.
Train users to best utilize business systems, processes, and reports.

Understanding of Supply Chain Management methodologies and processes related to all areas of Supply Chain beginning with new product development, sourcing, forecasting/demand planning, inventory management through to shipping, logistics, and distribution processes.

Self-driven, strong problem solving abilities, project and time management skills, fast learner, organized, creative, team worker, good communications and meeting facilitation skills .

Must embrace change

Job Description
Primary Purpose:

Assist and participate in project reviews, revisions, production problem corrections, enhancements, and usability testing of any functionality required to administer policy sales and servicing in the NPS and ANA operating systems. Assist as a liaison between developer and end-users, provide technical support to successfully implement system changes to the comprehensive policy and agency management system to comply with filed programs for multiple states, companies, products and lines of business. Increase business and system knowledge.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.
Prepare test plans and scenarios for usability testing, execute test scenarios, approve project implementation and verify the production output upon implementation
Responsible for verifying the accuracy of new states/ products, rate revisions, projects, and production problem corrections, to ensure a quality product
Formulate the test strategy for testing through analysis of system requirements which includes participating in meetings to discuss specifications
Assist in project planning, incorporating system considerations for various operational areas, and submit the request for programming changes
With supervision, coordinate and document the resolution of problems encountered during and subsequent to the usability testing
Assist in performing quality control procedures in the production environment
Perform other duties as requested
Minimum Skills and Competencies:

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Bachelor Degree or in-lieu of degree equivalent education, training and work-related experience
Strong attention to detail, organization skills, and timeliness in order to meet customer expectations
Demonstrates strong problem solving skills
Demonstrates effective listening, communicate, interaction, discretion, and diplomacy skills
Must possess effective verbal and written communication skills to interact with business and technical resources
Must perform well in high-energy, dynamic and team-oriented environment
Effective organization and time management skills with the ability to work under pressure and adhere to aggressive project deadlines
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to establish working relationships with individuals at varying levels within the organization
Demonstrates a general understanding of the insurance industry and organizational relationships of the company
Desired Skills:
Previous Property and Casualty Insurance experience strongly preferred
Prior project management experience preferred
Demonstrates the ability to understand and translate user needs into business specifications
Demonstrates working knowledge of company operating systems and processes including a working knowledge of the policy administration system
Demonstrates the ability to conduct investigation and research into system errors and discrepancies
Demonstrates skill in the development of test plans and test cases through thorough analysis of requirements

ABOUT THE ORGANIZATION | Federal Government Experts, LLC (FGE) is a SBA certified 8(a), Service Disabled Veteran Owned (SDVOSB), Veteran Owned Small Business (VOSB), Historically Underutilized Business Zone (HUBZone) Small Business concern - which specializes professional support services in acquisition, information technology, program & engineering management, human resources as well as financial, legal support services. Our mission focus is to provide the best talent and processes in order to effect a superior product and service to our clients on time and every time, while simultaneously affording a ‘World Class, Customer Service Experience.'

DESCRIPTION | If you are working or aspiring to work in today's United States Intelligence Community...we have the opportunity you’ve been looking for. FEDERAL GOVERNMENT EXPERTS, LLC (FGE), has an immediate opening for a Senior All Source Analyst. Responsible for a multiple-discipline skill set using Structured Analytic (SA) techniques by sorting, convergent/divergent thinking, and competing hypotheses analysis to merge data into tailored, near and long-term assessments with confidence ratings derived from Director of National Intelligence (DNI) standards. Throughout this process, analysts focus and generate a common operational picture depicting fused intelligence and information into finished products.

What You'll Get to Do:
All Source Analysis of USCENTCOM AOR and USCENTCOM Areas of Responsibility
Researches, analyzes, interprets, evaluates, and integrates extremely complex all-source intelligence data pertaining to order of battle, force structure, strategic and conventional military capabilities and key military leadership. Prepares extensive assessments and documents and disseminates information through reports and briefs.
Develops complex analytical approaches to problems and situations for which data is incomplete, controversial, or which no precedent exists.
Assesses capabilities of doctrine and strategy production, joint forces operations, force structure, manpower; joint exercises, readiness training; and intentions.
Advises and briefs senior leadership regarding critical military capabilities issues.
Represents the Agency's position concerning military capabilities to senior policymakers.
Provides input to policymakers on key foreign military capabilities trends.
Develop innovative approaches to analysis and validates analytical conclusions.
Maintains and updates extensive intelligence databases, systems, and mechanisms for sharing relevant intelligence information to support ongoing and projected projects.
May require to work shifts for extended periods of time.

What We Can Offer You:
Our employees value the flexibility at FGE that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.
We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS |
You'll Bring These Qualifications:
Active TS/SCI Clearance with CI Poly.
Bachelor or Master's degree with 8+ years of intelligence analysis experience or specialized training & 10+ years intelligence analysis experience or equivalent intelligence/academic experience credentialed subject matter expert or recognized specialist in relevant field.
Due to contract requirements, as an essential job function you must be qualified and able to travel to OCONUS locations on short notice.Failure to meet such qualifications may result in termination.
Due to contract requirements you must maintain a valid United StatesPassport and remain qualified to travel OCONUS on short notice.

JOB LOCATION: US-Tampa-FL-TAMPA-ST. PETERSBURG
SALARY RANGE: $65,000 - 80,000 yearly

FGE employs a diverse range of talent to create an environment that fuels innovation and fosters continuous improvement and success. At FGE, you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. FGE is proud to provide dynamic careers for employees worldwide. FGE is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

Job Title: Small Business Consultant - Eastgate FC/Cincinnati OH
Job Description:
Job Description:

At Bank of America, we handle the finances of over 67 million client relationships every day, including helping them save, borrow and invest for today and for their future. We stand by our clients each and every day giving them the power to realize their personal and business financial goals and help make their financial lives better. If you join our team, we’ll count on you to care for, advise and guide our small business clients when they need us most – whether they’re just starting out, expanding or managing the day-to-day. We’re looking for people with passion and drive to provide comprehensive financial solutions to our small business clients. You’ll be empowered to deliver the full spectrum of business and personal financial solutions to meet our client’s needs and help make their financial lives better.

As part of the Bank of America team, Small Business Consultants have access to industry-leading products and services, award-winning platforms and client education – all designed to meet the unique life priorities of our clients. Small Business Consultants partner closely with financial center employees as part of one team that delivers exceptional client care – your role will be to acquire and deepen small business relationships through face–to- face meetings. You’ll actively connect with our clients through outbound telephone calls and execute consistent follow-up routines to meet their needs. The Small Business Consultant role is a great step toward a rewarding and successful career. At this stage, you’ll start building the relationships that can shape your career, and be exposed to the products, platforms, and tools needed to serve clients.

From day one, you’ll receive training from our award-winning Academy at Bank of America, including hands-on practice, personalized coaching and dedicated support throughout your on-boarding experience. With demonstrated success, you’ll have the opportunity to advance into leadership roles such as a Small Business Banker Manager, or advance into other client professional roles– with unlimited opportunity to grow throughout the company.

We’ll help you
• Get training and one-on-one coaching from managers who are invested in your success. You’ll enroll in The Academy to develop as a consultant.
• Build a quality external network of business relationships within your small business banking community.
• Leverage the power of our company by working closely with internal and external partners to take advantage of the full capabilities of the bank.
• Provide small business related guidance to financial center associates through huddles and team meetings.
• Effectively balance sales performance, operational risk and client relationship care.

As a consultant, you can look forward to
• Unlimited potential for financial growth and incentive awards for meeting goals.
• Growing your network to eventually grow your business. Leverage our relationships with one out of two U.S. households. You’ll interact with banking clients and small business owners alike. You will also tap into a range of experts, from lending officers to financial solutions advisors.
• Robust marketing support to reach wider audiences with greater appeal.
• Ongoing professional development to deepen your skills and optimize your talent as the industry evolves and changes.

We’re a culture that
• Believes in responsible growth and has a proven dedication to supporting the communities we serve.
• Provides continuous training and developmental opportunities to help people achieve their goals, whatever their background or experience.
• Believes diversity makes us stronger, so we can reflect, connect to and meet the diverse needs of our clients and customers around the world.
• Is committed to advancing our tools, technology and ways of working. We always put our clients first to meet their evolving needs.

Required skills:
• Has demonstrated experience and proven success with business to business sales, or small business banking.
• Has strong communication skills with the ability to effectively influence clients.
• Has effective customer service skills with ability to manage the full client end-to-end experience and problem resolution.
• Has a proven sales track record.
• Is able to build productive partnerships and working relationships.
• Is experienced with outbound phone sales.

Desired skills:
• Experience with financial information, spreadsheets and financial skills.
• Experience with inperson customer service and sales.
• Experience working with small business clients.
• Experience meeting or exceeding goals.
• A working knowledge of small business products and services.
• Bilingual skills.

Shift:

1st shift (United States of America)

Hours Per Week:

40

Learn more about this role

Job Title: Business / Data Analyst, Commercial Lines Operations
Job Description:
Monday, June 1, 2020

Our Shared Services department is seeking a Business/Data Analyst to join our growing team in our Worcester, MA offices.
Position summary:


This person will be responsible for providing analytical support to Commercial Lines Operations leaders for operational reporting and metrics, resource modeling, strategic and tactical initiatives, and process solutions. This position will maintain and build operational reports and models for Service Operations and Underwriting Operations; provide weekly and monthly analysis and insight into metrics, trends and issues; and support and develop tools to monitor and track operational milestones and metrics.

Incumbents serving in the Business Analysis job family are responsible for the collection, development, analysis, documentation, and communication of business needs and requirements. Throughout an assignment, Business Analysts may act like a liaison while they interface and work collaboratively with technology and business organizations. Business Analysts usually assess the needs of the assignment by directly interacting with management, leadership, technology, the business and the customer. Business Analysts are also expected to use their working understanding of information systems, business operations, and processes to analyze requirements, develop specifications, story-boarding and prototyping to facilitate the design of integrated solutions. Their knowledge of business analysis, business processes and project methodologies is applied to all of their assignments.

This is a Full-time, Exempt role.

Responsibilities/Essential Functions:

Acquire knowledge of basic performance metrics and analytical concepts/methods pertinent to the commercial insurance industry
Become comfortable with company data structure and definitions; Understand the relationship between the business issues and the available data
Develop/build reports, tools, and automations to insure and monitor the success of strategic initiatives
Provide analytical support on routine and ad-hoc requests from Operational leaders
Effectively summarize and communicate findings of analysis to business and operational leaders
Obtain proficiency in the various software applications required to perform daily work
Actively participate in cross-functional projects.

Position Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree and 1 – 3 years of Analyst experience, or equivalent
Strong analytic and problem-solving skills
P&C Insurance Industry knowledge
Advanced Excel skills
Familiar with Microsoft Access and PowerPoint
Experience with Software Automation a plus (Automation Anywhere, specifically)
Effective communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to collaborate and build relationships with others at different levels of the organization
Acts resourcefully to ensure that work is completed in keeping with specified time and quality expectations
Creates a sense of energy, ownership, and personal commitment to the work.

The New Tech for Restaurant and Hospitality

Fourth is the first global cloud-based intelligent back office platform in the restaurant and hospitality. We’re no ordinary software company! We pride ourselves on the culture we have created and work hard to ensure this is never compromised. This is a place where our people want to work; where they enjoy and develop in their roles; where our people pull together to work as a team and ultimately be a company we are all proud to be a part of.

By developing innovative products, building relationships with our customers and enabling great careers; we are focused on building lifetime loyalty with our customers and each other. The vast majority of us have worked within the industry; we believe we need to be passionate about and have experienced the industry in order to help our customers grow their businesses successfully.

When recruiting, we look for those who want to join our journey; those who want to be a part of our personality and culture; those who are professional; have energy, enthusiasm, and ambition, are entrepreneurial and those who can show they can live by our company values each day. Working at Fourth + HotSchedules provides an opportunity to build a successful career where our people develop and grow in a dynamic, fast paced environment.

The Benefits Analyst II is responsible to assess, configure, and maintain the paperless benefit enrollment system(s) and related files, reports and data exchanges with brokers, consolidators, and carriers as well as responsibilities for analyzing, auditing, evaluating and resolving reported errors within benefits administration business systems or third party vendor programs, including resolving, reporting and/or escalating appropriately. Other key responsibilities include ACA, DataBridge, and support of benefit renewals.
Our Story
In July 2019 Fourth joined forces with HotSchedules to become the global leader in end-to-end restaurant and hospitality management technology solutions. Together, the merged company now represents the world’s largest and only provider of end-to-end restaurant and hospitality management solutions for customers across the globe and of all sizes—from a single location or franchisee restaurant to a global restaurant or hotel chain. The combined company’s complete software-as-service (SaaS) solution suite including: scheduling, time & attendance, applicant tracking, training, inventory management / procurement, HR / benefits and payroll services now serves customers in 120,000 locations worldwide and is supported by a dedicated, unified team across offices in the US, UK, Bulgaria, China, Australia and UAE."

Company:
Arthrex
Requisition ID: 45464
Title: Software QA III
Division: Arthrex, Inc. (US01)
Location: Naples, FL

Main Objective:

Arthrex, a growing medical device manufacturer, is looking for an Integrations Test Analyst with the responsibility for leading and testing interfaces to/from SAP and to/from other software applications. The Integrations Test Analyst is expected to possess strong experience in interface/integration testing principles, processes and methods including a good understanding of middleware technology. The Integrations Test Analyst will perform coordination and collaboration functions across different SAP and Non-SAP application teams frequently interacting with internal customers (i.e Project Managers, Test Supervisors, Test Leads and Analysts, Business Analysts, and Developers) within the IT division of Arthrex and will lead a small offshore test team. The Analyst will be part of a dynamic software test team with established standards and processes in place supporting best practices in both manual and automating testing of new integrations, enhancements, upgrades, and fixes.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Work independently, often leading a test team, under general supervision of SQA manager or supervisor with latitude for independent judgement, to evaluate and test computer software applications used by various business units within Arthrex.
Apply test methodology, as well as business process and application knowledge, in the design of tests and testing strategies. Based on business and functional requirements, identify testing scenarios, determine all types of testing to be performed, and develop test cases or reviews those written by test team.
Execute planned and exploratory testing, utilizing manual and automated test cases, to assure the quality of an application’s usability, functionality and security. Document actual test results and defects.
Communicate issues identified during testing activities to application development team and provide recommended process/application improvements to management.
Estimate effort for tasks assigned, develop project schedule, assign tasks to testers, and provide status of daily progress to test lead or management.
Represent SQA on application/project teams and in software development, project planning, and requirement gathering meetings. Attend project status meetings and provide SQA status, work with PM to define SQA tasks and estimates for the project schedule. Manage SQA tasks and deadlines as test lead for assigned project(s).
Lead testing projects, especially medium to large projects, thus being responsible for all test planning and reporting activities and ensure Arthrex SQA standards and procedures are followed.
Define and track SQA metrics such as requirements coverage, test case readiness, test execution progress, and defect counts and statistics in the Arthrex Test Management tool(s).
Develop, and/or oversee the development of, all testing artifacts – test cases, automated test scripts, test plan document, test summary report, and requirement traceability matrix – in the Arthrex Test Management tool(s) and in the SQA/Arthex project repository systems using Arthrex standard templates.
Perform peer reviews and internal audits of project documentation.
Prepare knowledge documents and provide cross training to team members.
Act as application SME and therefore is the point of contact within SQA for education of testers on assigned applications.
Mentor junior-level analysts.
Recommend new internal projects to utilize or enhance automation and increase efficiencies.
May assist in release management /production deployment activities.
Follow SQA standards and procedures.
Incidental Duties:

The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed in this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, and indeed additional responsibilities may be assigned, as required, by management.

Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field required.
Minimum five years of experience in Software Quality Assurance performing GUI, Functional, Interface/Integration and Regression testing of SAP applications & and non-SAP applications (packaged and/or custom developed).
Integration/Interface/File Transfer and Data Migration (ETL) knowledge required.
Experience with testing relational databases, SQL, Oracle or XML. Basic to advanced database querying skills required.
Experience with testing business applications running on SAP & Non-SAP platforms required.
SAP ECC knowledge and testing experience required.
Knowledge of various middleware technologies (SAP PI, WebServices, ABAP-WS, Mulesoft, Oracle SOA, etc.) and end-to-end testing experience preferred.
Knowledge of EDI & IDOCs (Inbound and Outbound) preferred.
Experience with using HP ALM, Solution Manager 7.2 or equivalent Test Management tool required.
Experience with using (running scripts) and developing automation scripts in HP UFT, SOAPUI Pro, Worksoft, Tosca or equivalent Test Automation tool preferred.
Experience in testing emergency application defects in production systems, system patches, maintenance releases, enhancement releases, and implementations of new applications required.
Experience in analyzing business, functional, and technical requirements/specifications and developing and executing structured/methodical test cases to prove fulfillment of requirements and viability of application usage and functionality required.
Experience in leading testing projects and coordinating and managing tasks of team members with strong offshore-onsite coordination skills across different regions/countries and vendors.
Knowledge and Skill Requirements/Specialized Courses and/or Training:
Working knowledge of the Software Development Life cycle and SAP SQA’s role in it through proven explanation of the process.
Solid understanding of programming languages including application, database, and services layers.
Demonstrated ability to document test plans, test cases, test execution, defects & test results. As well as capability to create and maintain test data. Knowledge around Test Data Management.
Strong collaboration and coordination skills to follow up on test environment readiness.
Demonstrated problem solving, organizational, and analytical skills. High attention to detail and accuracy.
Project management skills with ability to identify urgencies, risks and competing priorities and constraints; to prioritize tasks for team members; and to meet project deadlines.
Excellent communication skills, presentation skills and a customer service orientation.
ISTQB Foundation Level certification (CTFL) preferred.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Senior R&D Analyst (III) to Lead R&D Analyst (IV) - Progressive Home

Pay Grade: 044 / 046
Location: St. Petersburg, Cleveland or possible remote / WFH

If you enjoy developing product solutions that contribute to top-line growth, analyzing data to identify trends and improve products, then we have a role for you. ASI/Progressive Home is seeking an R&D Analyst to help answer business questions and drive process improvement. A well-qualified candidate is intellectually curious, skilled at finding creative solutions to problems, detail oriented, strives for constant improvement and excels in a highly collaborative culture.

This role will be responsible for researching and developing enhancements to our current rating models and then supporting our state Product Managers as they implement those enhancements. Additionally, if monitoring reveals that we're not getting the results expected then this role will assist with ad hoc analysis to identify the root cause. As such, this position requires strong skills in pulling and manipulating data, performing root cause data analysis, and building predictive models.

Strong communication skills are also important so that you can clearly communicate the results of your analyses or explain components of our product to various stakeholders. Additionally, as state Product Managers present unique, state-specific challenges the ability to collaborate and collectively solve problems is necessary in order to deliver model enhancements as quickly as possible while being compliant.

Educational and/or experience:

PhD with emphasis in Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Economics, Engineering or Operations Research
In lieu of PhD, Master's degree with emphasis in Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Economics, Engineering or Operations Research plus at least three years of analysis experience
In lieu of PhD or Master's degree, Bachelor's degree with emphasis in Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Economics, Engineering or Operations Research plus either
Three years of analysis experience in a Product, Pricing or Actuarial role with Property and Casualty Insurance, or
Successful completion of all preliminary actuarial exams and at least one Associateship level exam within the Casualty Actuarial Society
Preferred skills:

Prior Property & Casualty insurance experience strongly preferred
Understanding of and experience building Generalized Linear Models
Experience in root cause data analysis
Experience in extracting data using SQL
Experience in statistical programming with languages like R, Python or SAS
Experience with Excel
Ability to present data and analysis results in a simple and clear manner
Ability to simplify analyses for complicated business problems
Ability to collaborate with others to solve business problems and gain buy-in
Benefits and Perks:

Annual Gainshare bonus based on company performance up to 30% or 40% of your salary depending on the pay grade.
401k which includes dollar-for-dollar company match of up to 6% that is 100% vested
Dedication to work/life balance which includes flexible work arrangements
Dynamic culture that encourages engagement, supports Employee Resource Groups, values your input and embraces a relaxed atmosphere
Onsite gym and wellness programs with discounts & rewards
Paid training, tuition assistance and career development.
Casual dress (yes, you can wear jeans to work!)
Healthcare standard benefits (medical, dental, vision)
* Sponsorship is not available for this position. **

Here at Scotts Miracle-Gro there is no such thing as a typical day. Our culture is constantly energized by new and exciting growth opportunities and at a rapid pace. Every Associate plays an important role in providing innovative solutions for today’s gardeners and growers and contributing new ideas to improve operations. In our company you need grit, it is what we were founded on over 150 years ago and is what keeps us growing. Regardless of your level in the organization there is a platform for your voice to be heard and the ability to influence change. Family, community and hard working values are weaved into all that we do. Come grow with us, where we develop and nurture the next generation of leaders.

We are looking for an Analyst, Emerging Technology who will join our Information Technology team in Marysville, OH.

This position will be based at The Scotts Miracle-Gro world headquarters in Marysville, a suburb of Columbus, OH. Not familiar with Columbus? Visit columbusregion.com/columbus-2020/

In this position, you will help identify and research emerging technologies in the Information Technology (IT) industry that will enable Scotts Miracle-Gro to address current and future IT opportunities. You will be performing analysis and developing recommendations for technology use and performing proof-of-concept exercises for selected technologies. You will be documenting results and these are used by solution architects and others in making future technology decisions. You will be a member of a highly-collaborative and fast-paced team that is intensely focused on using IT to enable the Scotts Miracle-Gro business to grow and deliver ever-improving products and services to our customers.

What you’ll do in this role:
Maintain awareness of new technologies and their ability to provide a competitive edge.
Produce in-depth documents on key emerging technology topics, including analysis of technology, commercialization, application, and supply chain. These documents will identify the strengths of the new technology, the implications of their use, and cite the appropriate use cases for those technologies.
Produce a monthly report summarizing key developments across the emerging technology sector.
Look for opportunities to leverage technology to achieve business unit objectives.
Work with stakeholders and project teams to prioritize requirements.
Work with stakeholders to perform proof-of-concept exercises with selected new technologies.
Contribute short articles for other publications and blog posts.
What you’ll need to be successful:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math or Physical Sciences.
5 years of progressive experience in the areas of IT infrastructure and/or development areas
Excellent interpersonal skills are a critical success factor for this role.
Critical thinking and analytical skills.
Ability to consistently and clearly communicate verbally and in writing with a variety of audiences at their respective levels of technology understanding.
Ability to work independently as well as a member of a highly-collaborative team.
Excellent planning and prioritization skills to enable consistent and timely delivery of work products.
What we do for you (just to list a few cool ones):
Offer extremely competitive benefits including: Health, Dental and Vision coverage.
Onsite wellness center which includes: 24,000 sq. ft. fitness center, Walgreens pharmacy and Doctor’s office. Nutrition reimbursement program (up to $200 per associate and per spouse)
Beautiful campus and corporate offices designed like a log cabin offering free coffee, chef run cafe and the best crushed ice!
First day of hire, 401K match (up to 7.5%) and discounted stock purchasing program (15% discount).
Our commitment to diversity and inclusion includes four employee resource groups: Scotts Women’s Network, Scotts Black Employee Network, Scotts Veterans Network and Scotts Young Professionals.
12 SMG paid holiday days and generous vacation policy.
Not interested in this role? Stay up to date on future opportunities by joining our ScottsMiracle-Gro and Hawthorne Gardening talent networks.

Job Description:
Level to be determined based on qualifications relevant to the role.
Summary
Responsible for the management and assessment of information that is necessary to enable data driven decisions and provide insights for the company. Develop clever tools and content to support senior management decision making within Regenerons Integrated Product Supply (IPS) Planning processes. Lead the standardization of how data is consumed by clearly defining the assessed outcomes to senior management within the IPS process. Supports the development of Supply Chain metrics to identify gaps in current processes, improve service levels to internal and external customers, reduce waste, and improve the value chain efficiency.

Responsibilities
• Perform quantitative data analysis and build algorithms to design ways to consolidate data associated with the IPS process; manage systems that facilitate transfer of demand and production requirement information across Product Demand, Product Supply, Raw Materials Planning and Supply Integration.
• Work with cross-functional teams to ensure effective and disciplined planning.
• Responsible for supporting supply chain with the process by being the expert on data and how to use data to support decision making within the organization
• Assist in creating reports which for example will provide inventory insight into clinical and commercial products.
• Analyze information to conceptualize and define operational problems, identify underlying principles, and determine most appropriate analytical methodologies.
• Research, design, develop, validate, and implement statistical and simulation models, optimizations, and algorithms to predict, quantify, or forecast various operational and performance metrics.
• Collect, validate and organize data for monthly metrics as well as Dashboards; creates charts for trending and forecast comparisons. Creates tables to summarize Clinical Study details and Commercial Demand Assumptions.
• Support Compliance activities for Supply Chain.
• Design novel data models, tools and templates by leveraging Business Intelligence (BI) tools
• Develop and track metrics to measure the timeliness, accuracy and integrity of data from stakeholders.
• Provide impactful graphical data visualizations intuitively communicating analytical insights, telling compelling stories, reinforcing logical recommendations, and driving informed actions.
• Provide support and subject matter expertise to develop additional databases / reports.
• Embrace and promote the IOPS culture and the Regeneron Way
• Assist in deploying IOPS Regenerons Values and culture throughout the Supply Chain team

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

• Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Suite

• Ability to interpret complex data and communicate recommendations

• Working knowledge of supply chain management with emphasis in master production scheduling (MPS), material requirement planning (MRP), demand management, inventory management.

• Ability to manage multiple complex projects and changing priorities

• Strong analytical skills and ability to communicate details clearly and effectively.

• Excellent time management, organizational skills, and written and verbal communication.

• Oracle and BI data model experience a plus

• Lean/Six Sigma/Continuous Improvement knowledge a plus

• APICS or other related purchasing certifications a plus
Education and Experience
• Associate Analyst: Requires Bachelors degree in Math, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Business, or Science background and 0-2 years of experience in Supply Chain Management; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Analyst: Requires Bachelors degree in Math, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Business, or Science background and 2+ years of experience in Supply Chain Management; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Senior Analyst: Requires Bachelors degree in Math, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Business, or Science background and 5+ years of experience in Supply Chain Management; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Pharmaceutical or biotechnology experience a plus

About the Business Analyst Position

The Business Analyst role is a highly collaborative position with insight into and collaboration with all roles within the organization. This position serves as a primary facilitator for cross-team communication and collaboration. The Business Analyst must familiarize him/herself with scope, objectives and architecture of each project to gain a cohesive, detailed and accurate understanding. Business Analysts must have focused attention to detail and must work well in teams or on solo tasks.

The Business Analysts' primary responsibility is gathering and analyzing detailed functional requirements. As a result the Business Analyst will produce functional specifications for client approval that clearly denote scope and requirements to aid user interface, engineering, and quality analysis teams in project development. The Business Analyst owns/organizes all project-related documentation. The Business Analyst is responsible for answering scope and functionality related questions, as well as to provide oversight to the successful completion of the project.

Approximately less than 20% travel required per year.

Responsibilities
Documentation
Responsible for drafting and updating all functional specification documentation including use cases, process and data workflows, as well as relationships between content structures for a site
Work closely with the Technical Architects and to obtain the technical details for the necessary planning deliverables before the implementation phase.
Ability to identify gaps, overlaps, and conflicting information in scope and requirements. Work closely with the team to resolve project issues.
Ability to outline basic test scenarios, provide functional and technical recommendations as necessary.

Communication/Collaboration
Facilitating cross-department communication is key to this role.
The Business Analyst leads project handoff and retrospective meetings with members of the Engineering, Quality Analysis, Project Management and Creative teams. Will be responsible for capturing & following-up on any action/blocking items.
The Business Analyst will be the main information resource for project functionality and scope specific questions.
Must be able to effectively communicate and document complex user interaction scenarios.
The Technical Business Analyst is a client facing role. Frequent communication with the client is necessary for gathering requirements and making recommendations. They will also be responsible for explaining gaps and technical concepts for an often nontechnical audience.
Qualifications
Bachelors Degree in related field, specialized training, or 3-6 years of equivalent work experience in IT/software industry.
Exceptional organizational and communication skills, with the ability to cultivate relationships with internal departments.
Excellent attention to detail.
Ability to gather, analyze and document information clearly and efficiently.
Proactive nature to actively seek gaps and issues, and make recommendations to functionality.
Candidate should possess a solid understanding of front-end development (XHTML, CSS, JS) and have exposure to middle tier and back end development (ASP.NET, C#, SQL). Although development knowledge is desirable, development will not be a focus of this role.
Experience with Content Management Systems and integrations (Sitecore, Episerver or Insite) is not essential but is a big plus.
Familiarity with both agile and waterfall development methodologies is a plus.
Experience with project life-cycle management tools such as JIRA and Confluence would be a plus.
Must be an innovative, self-motivated, and hands-on professional who excels with new and changing technologies in a rapidly growing and fast moving company.
Multi-day domestic, and sometimes international travel will be a requirement for some projects

Now Hiring Business Systems Analyst
Kent, WA

Oberto Snacks Inc., known for our high quality, delicious meat snacks are currently hiring for a Business Systems Analyst at our Kent, Washington headquarters and manufacturing facility.
The primary responsibilities of this role are to ensure that end users can use the Company’s software and systems to accomplish business tasks. This position will work with and support the senior analyst and will work closely with users of our enterprise systems and will gain knowledge in identifying solution requirements, and designing, configuring, and training on the solutions. The position will employ both traditional and Agile Project management methodologies when working on projects. The Business Systems Analyst position will be expected to develop expertise across multiple functional areas, in both business process and technical configuration knowledge for Oberto’ s ERP system (QAD) and supporting systems. This role will also consult with and provide advice to end users and manage small projects under general supervision.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Assists in identifying and initiating innovations and solutions utilizing the ERP and other systems where precedents and procedures may not exist. Works cross-functionally to solve problems and implement changes.
Provides day-to-day support to a variety of business users of the company enterprise systems, including access requests, troubleshooting errors, and aiding in their use.
Identifies and responds to requests for systems training needs; develops and provides both group and individual training to end users.
Configures ERP as needed to implement process improvements.
Actively participates in cross-functional groups to solve problems.
Identifies the people critical to resolving problems and reaching decisions and brings them together.
Mediates stalemates within and among groups to move group forward to successful business process improvements.
Apply systems analysis techniques and procedures, including consulting with users, to determine software, hardware or system functional specifications
Under direction, evaluate and recommend new technologies; analyze new software releases for implementation issues, including suitability to need, training, budget and other concerns.
Research third party solutions to problems and to enhance productivity, making effective use of vendors to provide timely progress on projects and increase user acceptance.
Consult with end users to define requirements for software applications.
Develop requirements. Write specifications for developers, under general supervision.
Configure, test and implement software to meet customer requirements.
Redirects and escalates application problems to senior Analyst or third parties (vendors, contractors, and others) as necessary when additional assistance is required.
Understand business processes across functional teams.
Fields incoming requests as needed from end users via both telephone and e-mail in a courteous manner.
Documents problems, resolution, and new solutions for future reference using service management tools and resources.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience
APICS Certified Supply Chain Professional (CSCP) a plus
1 – 2+ years’ work experience with ERP and other business systems
Testing, developing test plans
QAD Standard/Enterprise Edition experience preferred
Excel Power Query, Excel pivot tables, Excel Power Pivot a plus
Exposure to process flowcharts or process maps
Knowledge of various business processes, such as order to cash, procure to pay, forecast to delivery, plant to inventory
Strong knowledge/experience with MS Office Suite.
Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills
Strong customer service focus, delivering value to the business
Takes ownership of responsibilities
Must have keen attention to detail and be well-organized
Must have initiative, be a self starter and able to balance multiple and shifting priorities and deadlines
Able to work cooperatively with others as well as independently, without close supervision and exercise independent judgment and discretion
Able to speak, read and write in English
Strong communications skills, including presentation and meeting facilitation abilities
ABOUT OBERTO: We offer a creative environment filled with other talented people. We are committed to rewarding our teammates for their hard work, enthusiasm and professional excellence. Company perks include:
Competitive salary
Annual performance incentive
401K Plan with company match
Employee Stock Program
Excellent benefits including: medical, dental, vision, prescription coverage, short term and long-term disability and life insurance.

TO APPLY: Go to www.oberto.com/careers to see the full job description and apply for the position. Please include a resume with your application. This role will be responsible for developing requirements and use cases in support of Kyriba product vision and roadmap, and customer requested enhancements for the Kyriba connectivity platform. The Ring Alarm Business Intelligence Team aims to provide self-service analytics and reporting at an enterprise level to help drive quality, reliability, usability and profitable growth of the Ring Alarm product, a connected, DIY home security system.

The primary role for the Business Intelligence Engineer is to provide technical and business expertise in integrating data from a variety of source systems and presenting it through an array of self-service applications. The BI Engineer will support all development efforts as well as the creation of interactive dashboards and data visualizations that are widely used throughout the organization. Additionally, the BI Engineer will be instrumental in the creation of a reliable and scalable infrastructure for ongoing reporting and analytics.

Responsibilities
· Develop an in-depth understanding and interpretation of data within the related data warehouses
· Provide technical expertise in extracting, integrating, and analyzing critical data
· Analyze large data sets using a variety of database query and visualization tools
· Perform ad hoc analysis to quickly identify high priority and time sensitive operational issues relating to the Ring Alarm product
· Clearly communicate any potential data discrepancies and/or reporting downtime, including specific root cause, steps to resolution, and resolution date
· Design and develop key performance metrics and indicators
· Partner with key stakeholders to document and translate business requirements into technical requirements
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS


· 3+ years of experience as an analyst or engineer in the data/BI space
· Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
· Experience with SQL
· 5+ years of software development background in programming distributed systems or mobile applications
· 5+ years of experience writing and reviewing detailed architecture specifications
· 5+ years of experience in software development methodologies and tools; able to deploy best practices
· 5+ years of experience in software release and deployment process and tools
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS


· Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Business Intelligence, or Computer Science
· 3+ years of transforming datasets into visualizations using Tableau or a similar tool
· SQL development experience using Amazon Redshift, PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL Server, or similar engines
· Front-End/Self-Service BI visualization development experience using Tableau
· Knowledge of fundamental relational database technology and terminology
· Database development experience in Amazon Redshift, Athena, or similar data warehouses
· Ability to analyze complex data sets, business processes, and quickly adapt to the use of new technologies
· Ability to analyze current work processes and systems and clearly articulate potential improvement opportunities to leadership
· Ability to work directly with key stakeholders to gather and interpret functional requirements
· Strong organizational skills, detail oriented, and process-driven, with an orientation toward continuous process improvement
· Proactive and self-directed in work habits

Since its founding in 2013, Ring has been on a mission to make neighborhoods safer. From the video doorbell, to Ring Alarm, which was named #1 in Customer Satisfaction for DIY Home Security Systems by J.D. Power, Ring’s smart home security product line, as well as the Neighbors app, offer users affordable whole-home and neighborhood security. Job Title: Sr. Strategy and Business Development Analyst
Job Description:
Sr. Strategy and Business Development Analyst

The Senior Strategy and Business Analyst performs in-depth, highly sophisticated data analysis and research, in support of planning activities and strategic growth initiatives across the organization.

The Senior Analyst works as a member of the Strategy & Business Development team to create analytically rigorous, actionable insights and recommendations that identify and evaluate growth opportunities and drive business decision-making. Reports to the AVP, Strategy and Business Development and collaborates with Strategy and Business Development team members and others in analysis, strategic planning and business plan development activities.

PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Performs analysis by accessing a wide-range of quantitative and qualitative information, including market and trend data, physician productivity, and clinical technology. Acquires external benchmarks and information sets, including competitor market share and clinical service deployment.
Analyzes large data sources to understand key drivers of the business and trends and uses fact-based analysis to support and enhance decision making, support new program/service design and establish program/service performance benchmarks.
Manipulates and displays quantitative and qualitative information to reflect the synthesis, summary and translation of data to deliver a strategic actionable message and recommendations. Makes novel connections between data sets.
Tells compelling stories with data. Uses artistic visualization techniques and tools (e.g., Tableau, Mapping/GIS) to make information memorable.
Produces, develops and enhances routine reports issued by the department.
Conducts broad-based analysis across all clinical Institutes, leveraging experiences and learnings from one project to the next to participate in an ongoing cycle of improvement.
Identifies and develops opportunities for data transformation and process efficiencies to support departmental initiatives. Supports and enhances team’s data repository and associated reports; provides training and insights to other team members as necessary.
Delivers presentations.
Sources and maintains library of diverse data sources, model documents, templates, and other reusable knowledge assets.
Supports data/software users throughout organization to extract market and other data sets as well as managing and mining large data sources.
Ensures credible and current access to strategic market intelligence relative to competitors; monitors and analyzes trends in the environment (e.g. local, regional and national).
Support strategic and operating plan processes.
Completes core components of business plans (e.g., market and service assessments).
Generates adhoc reports independently.

Skills and Experience for success in this role:

Education:
Bachelor’s Degree in statistics, business, finance, healthcare economics, market research, or related field required.
Minimum of five years related professional experience in designing, producing, and interpreting quantitative and qualitative analysis required.
OR
MBA or MHA required. Minimum of three years related professional experience required.
Extensive experience in Health Care Strategic Planning or consumer marketing research will be considered.

Experience/Skills:
Healthcare industry knowledge, as exemplified by working knowledge of DRG's and ICD-10 codes, service lines, and specialty medicine required.
Demonstrates healthcare experience, with emphasis on business analytics and market assessment skills.
Demonstrates strong analytical, problem solving, strategic thinking, critical thinking, decision modeling and organizational skills.
Demonstrates ability to tell compelling stories using data and data visualization techniques.
Demonstrates the ability to understand broad strategic issues and apply analytics to deliver recommendations.
Demonstrates project development, facilitation and leadership, both with peers and senior level health system leaders.
Demonstrated knowledge of financial analysis, including ability to perform financial analyses to identify and evaluate business opportunities
Demonstrates proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Access. Proficiency with dashboard reporting software and data query tools (Tableau, Business Objects, AltoSoft, and/or SQL) is desirable but not required.
Demonstrates ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
Demonstrates excellent written and oral communication skills. Must be able to produce examples of written reports.
Demonstrates ability to prepare and present high level presentations. Must be able to produce examples of presentations and related support materials.
Experience with facility planning, contracts and strategies around facility growth

Trex Company, the world’s number one decking and railing brand, and leader in high-performance, low-maintenance outdoor living products, is seeking a Technical Support Analyst to monitor and maintain computer systems, and provide support to both local and remote employees.

As our next Technical Support Analyst, you are skilled at technical support and services, and you are comfortable with set up, maintenance, tracking and troubleshooting hardware and software for end-user devices. Talented employees are just one of Trex Company’s trademarks. This is your chance to work for a company consistently awarded recognition for market leadership and innovation. Trex decking products contain 95 percent recycled content and we are one of the largest plastic scrap recyclers in the U.S. Our organization kept more than 800 million pounds of plastic and wood scrap out of landfills annually.

Besides working for the company known for its recycling heritage and as a creator of amazing outdoor living spaces, Trex employees enjoy an industry-leading compensation and benefits package, bonuses and incentive programs, tuition assistance, a six percent 401(k) match, and more: trex.com/careers.
