Job Description:
Reports to
Credit & Collections Manager
JOB DESCRIPTION
Summary/Objective
We are actively seeking a Collections Analyst to support the collections function by ensuring that all aging targets are met. The role includes being the primary point of contact for customers in securing payments and working with internal teams to ensure timely resolution of outstanding issues. This is a senior position who proactively manages an assigned group of customer accounts receivables through direct customer contact to minimize past due balances, in addition to performing data analysis and process innovation for the collection function.


Following established guidelines, contacts assigned accounts directly to effectively collect outstanding monies. Exercises independent judgment in obtaining payments.
Ensures barriers to payment, such as proper approvals, expired PO's, and disputes are quickly identified and mediated. Communicates issues to appropriate party, conducts research as necessary and follows-through to resolution (successful collection and application).
Develops effective relationships with customers. Understands their process, key players and how to work efficiently within their system to collect outstanding balances effectively.
Keeps accurate records tracking progress and status of accounts.
Occasionally, performs other duties as assigned.

Knowledge typically gained through 3 years of experience in Credit and/or Collections
Knowledge typically gained through the achievement of an AA degree or equivalent
Ability to tactfully communicate (oral and written) with customers and make effective decisions in how the account should be handled, especially with large strategic accounts
Proficient in Microsoft Office and technology applications experience
Strong analytical skills are required
Ability to work in a team environment in making business decisions and implementing process improvements
Physical Requirements
All positions will require, to some degree, the physical abilities described below to perform the essential functions of the job.
Work the expected hours, consistently arrive at work at the agreed time and follow Company rules and guidelines regarding breaks and meal periods. Full time is typically considered to be 40 hours per week
Communicate effectively, both oral and written.
Move around and through all work areas as needed, may include climbing stairs or ladders.
Lift and/or move up to 10 pounds (i.e. books, reports, binders etc).
Regularly sit at the assigned workstation
Use keyboard or equivalent equipment, to access the computer,
Use hands to manipulate documents and general paperwork in order to view contents
Read documents, reports, files etc.
Communicate effectively using the telephone

As a Senior Business Analyst you will support a rapidly growing team extract insight from data to directly impact business results. This role will partner with cross functional teams across the company including Marketing, Product, Customer Management, Finance, Growth and Engineering to tell stories with data and drive better decision making ranging from the design of our products to the engagement with our customer base. You will be the data and reporting expert on our team, working to retrieve, integrate, visualize, and present critical data in a way that is immediately useful to improve the business decision making process. You will create reports, dashboards, metrics, and models that ensure we are focused on the right things for our customers.

The ideal candidate will have a mix of strong analytical skills, good business sense and the ability to understand business challenges and tie together data from across the EZ Texting platforms to enable effective decision making. They will have a strong track record of partnering with technical and non-technical internal customers and stakeholders and translating their data into actionable reporting and insights. You must have experience working with large data sets and the technical tools needed to analyze with them. They will be extremely organized and drive towards simple, scalable solutions to difficult problems, have excellent project management skills, and be able to communicate complex analytical results, both written and verbally, in a clear and easy to understand way. The successful candidate will be a self-starter who enjoys working with large-scale data and is excited to partner with key stakeholders to dig deep into data to understand their space and identify insights to direct strategy and measure impact. This person will be a creative problem solver who is resourceful, proactive, and collaborative with proven ability to work independently on multiple projects under tight time constraints.

Primary Responsibilities:
Reporting & Analysis Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources, identifying key indicators and actionable insights, and effectively communicating the most important information to drive decisions. Design, develop, and evaluate recurring and ad hoc reporting / dashboards to drive and monitor the business and our products using best practices in data visualization and reporting tools, including Tableau, DataStudio, Power BI or similar.
Process Documentation - Work with various functions and end users to identify, document, and communicate standard business processes.
Project Management - Produce detailed business requirements, coordinate and manage user acceptance test plans, and participate in stakeholder management.
Problem Solving - Demonstrate good judgment in solving problems as well as identifying problems and possible mitigation plans in advance. Strong desire and ability to dive deep into a given problem statement.
Subject Matter Expert Develop deep knowledge of the EZ Texting and related sub brands data architecture, system map and relation to product/feature use by customers. Act as a trusted adviser to internal stakeholders by sharing best practices and requirements for optimal use of these systems and data.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelors degree
5+ years of relevant professional experience as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, or related role
Expert in SQL
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools like Tableau, DataStudio, PowerBI
Strong business analysis and functional experience, including requirements gathering, creating/deploying solutions to end users, writing user acceptance test scripts and facilitating UAT sessions
Proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously and work well in an ambiguous and dynamic environment.
Ability to use data to develop insights, recommendations, and business cases
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including translating findings into compelling recommendations, polished deliverables, and actionable solutions.
Ability to partner with and communicate across business functions,
Excellent problem-solving skills
Willingness to roll up your sleeves and do whatever is necessary
Preferred Qualifications:
Proven ability to communicate with business and technical audiences at all levels, including demonstrated success influencing senior leaders and decision makers
Demonstrated ability to dive deep in understanding our business, projects, and opportunities to improve the outcomes of our largest strategic projects and programs
Experience with open source data scripting languages (Python, R etc.) or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS, or Matlab)
Experience with data mining and analytics techniques
Benefits:

And many more perks...

Overview

SIG is hiring a Technical Business Analyst - Tax Systems to administer, support and evolve our Global Accounting, Tax & Financial Systems. As a part of the Corporate Systems team, you will lead projects that include upgrades and enhancements to existing platforms as well as the opportunity to work directly with end users on all-new applications and process improvements. You will have the freedom to think outside the box with the ability to customize or build solutions that will directly impact the usability of the systems to meet business needs.

If you join us, you will:
Leverage your knowledge of Financial systems and regulations to provide ad-hoc analysis, systemic support and development/implementation of new functionality across our General Ledger, AP, Fixed Assets and Procurement / Inventory systems

Build integrations with other systems (both third party and internally developed) in order to streamline and improve business processes
You’ll design, manage and implement solutions such as
Developing web applications to expedite State Apportionment and M-1 Adjustment processes for monthly and annual Tax reporting.
Collaborating with Tax and Accounting stakeholders to streamline fixed asset reporting processes for US and International entities.
Expanding all modules within SIG’s Financial Systems including the General Ledger, AP, Fixed Assets and Procurement internationally
Directly influencing plans related to future systemic upgrades/enhancements
What we're looking for
Bachelors degree in Business Administration (specialization in Accounting or Finance preferred), or a related technical discipline required
Minimum of 3 years of experience providing application implementation and support services to end users or working within or in support of finance &/or accounting domains & their associated systems required
Prior experience supporting accounting users or working within an accounting role a strong plus
Strong Project Management skills and proven history of great communications with stakeholders across various levels of the organization.
Strong SQL & T-SQL Skills
Experience with SSIS, DTS, Informatica, Scribe or other integration enabling tools a plus
Experience with BI Reporting Platforms (i.e. Qlikview) and/or Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services a plus

Job Title: Graduate: Analyst Local Account Management - Anticipated Hiring July/Aug
Job Description:
Overview and Summary


Urban Science is a business-solutions company focused on supporting the needs of the sales and marketing function of the automotive industry. We leverage a scientific methodology to help our client partners sell more vehicles, improve profitability and increase customer loyalty. And we do that by helping solve their toughest challenges including planning an optimal dealership network, improving individual dealer performance and efficiently converting sales leads into sales. In short, we guide business through science—and we’ve been doing this since 1977.

Entry level position supporting the delivery of client services. Under the guidance of Senior Consultant, an Analyst uses their analytical and technical skills (T-SQL, Excel, VB and a little knowledge or ability with Object Oriented languages once in a while) to execute high quality data-related projects and assignments in a timely manner.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
With manager guidance, plans, organizes, develops and delivers client-requested reports, deliverables and projects on time, adhering to client requested specifications.
Designs, creates and manages client databases, utilizing Urban Science proprietary software, ensuring accurate and high quality data.
Accurately performs application coding and testing functions associated with the development of custom client software.
Tracks, processes, analyzes and verifies data in order to improve accuracy and quality.
Use technical skills to accurately monitor, update and maintain Urban Science internal software systems.
Adheres to quality control standards for Urban Science and client organizations.
Coordinates with individuals or teams to complete analyses, tasks and projects on time and with high quality.
Effectively responds to client inquiries/requests in a timely manner to help improve client satisfaction.
Proactively communicates with management to provide updates and report issues in a timely manner.
Actively works with manager to understand and implement solutions to improve NPS (client satisfaction).
Actively supports and participates in required Urban Science training programs to achieve targeted development objectives.
Works with manager in completing own annual goal setting and performance review in a timely manner.
Works with manager to prioritize other duties as assigned.


Qualifications - Education and Experience


Must possess a combination of education and experience as follows:
University degree required; technical degrees are strongly preferred (i.e., engineering, applied math, statistics, applied science, information systems, operations research, etc.) from an accredited college or university, or equivalent foreign institution. Non-technical degrees will be considered if candidate possesses appropriate level of analytical and technical knowledge required for the role
Math & Statistics: Requires knowledge of basic descriptive statistics and ability to execute simple statistical analyses, create scatter plots, bar charts and histograms; requires ability to apply the right mathematical methods or formulas to solve a problem.
Analytical Thinking: Requires the ability to understand a situation by breaking it apart into smaller pieces, and/or tracing the implications of a situation in a step-by-step causal way
MS Office: Requires demonstrated knowledge of MS Excel for charting and graphing of data, writing formulas, utilizing functions, and filtering, sorting and formatting of data; intermediate knowledge of MS Word, PowerPoint, and Access is preferred
Database: Working knowledge of relational database concepts, which require gathering and manipulating data manually is preferred; knowledge and experience with SQL and VB is preferred. Light experience or knowledge with Object Oriented Programming desireable.
Excellent communications skills: Both verbal and written.
Teamwork & Cooperation: Ability to work effectively, efficiently and cooperatively in a team environment.
Excellent organization skills: Requires the ability to strive for optimal results by taking responsibility for timeliness, commitment to task and adherence to performance standards. Willingness and ability to engage with clients as needed.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Must be able to operate PC and other office equipment. Must be able to present to individuals and groups.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The job may require additional hours over the normal 40-hour workweek. The job requires little out of town travel.

This description is intended to describe the type and level of work being performed by a person assigned to this position. It is NOT an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities required by a person so classified.

Position Description: Financial Analyst
Contracting Resources Group, Inc. (CRG) is a Woman-Owned Small Business, specializing in several core markets within the Federal Government. Our professional services depth includes program and project management, strategic planning, communications, acquisition management, financial management, program evaluation, and IT solutions. CRG is a leading management consulting firm, in part because of our ability to attract the highest quality team members through our emphasis on culture, competitive compensation, and benefits packages. Since 2002, CRG has consistently received top performance ratings from customers and teaming partners and industry awards, including Inc. Magazine’s 5000 list of the Fastest Growing Companies in America, the Department of Labor HireVets Platinum Medallion award, and the Washington Business Journal and Baltimore Sun’s Best Places to Work awards.
Description: CRG is seeking a Financial Analyst to support our Federal Government client onsite. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of three (3) years of financial support experience, one (1) year of experience with US Navy programs and operations, and strong organizational, analytical, and communication skills.
Duties include:
Measure organizational performance and assess the effects of various programs and policies on the budget.
Examine budget estimates or proposals for completeness, accuracy, and conformance with established procedures, regulations, and organizational objectives.
May employ cost-benefit analysis to review financial requests, assess program tradeoffs, and explore alternative funding methods.
Examine past and current budgets and research economic and financial developments that affect the organization’s spending.
Assist in development of guidelines and policies governing the formulation and maintenance of budgets.
Provide functional and technical support for standard financial reports and respond to customer inquiries in a timely manner.
Develop and/or respond to ad-hoc queries related to financial data calls.
Coordinate with department and office personnel in gathering and review of supporting documents required for the management of funds.
Conduct follow up actions for funding documentation and ensure fund document packages are complete, organized, and stored appropriately.
May conduct training sessions for company or government agency personnel regarding new budget procedures.
Location: Port Hueneme, CA
Required Qualifications:
Minimum of three (3) years of experience in financial support role.
Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, or other related field.
Experience providing advice and technical assistance in the preparation of annual budgets.
At least one (1) year of experience in U.S. Navy programs or operations.
DoD Secret Clearance.
Expert in Microsoft Office programs (Proficient in MS Excel).
Familiarity with Defense and Navy financial systems (i.e. Defense Civilian Payroll System [DCPS], Navy Enterprise Resource Planning [N-ERP], Defense Travel System [DTS], etc.)
Very strong interpersonal, oral, and written communications skills.
Able to use independent initiative, good judgment, and decision-making skills when setting priorities.
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.

Company Description

At Biogen, our mission is clear: we are pioneers in neuroscience. Biogen discovers, develops, and delivers worldwide innovative therapies for people living with serious neurological and neurodegenerative diseases. One of the world’s first global biotechnology companies, Biogen was founded in 1978 and today has the leading portfolio of medicines to treat multiple sclerosis, has introduced the first and only approved treatment for spinal muscular atrophy, and is focused on advancing neuroscience research programs in Alzheimer’s disease and dementia, MS and neuroimmunology, movement disorders, neuromuscular disorders, acute neurology, neurocognitive disorders, pain, and ophthalmology. Biogen also manufactures and commercializes biosimilars of advanced biologics.

Global Business Services and Business Optimization

The Global Business Services (GBS) and Business Optimization team is a newly formed organization established to transform Biogen’s business processes to set a platform to scale global operations, fuel commercial growth and the innovation pipeline. Further, GBS will provide further value by developing and delivering a suite of business solutions and support services that are valued by internal customers. GBS will deliver services by leveraging a global delivery model, operational transparency and metrics, leveraging global best practices, and a service-oriented process improvement culture. All solutions will be supported by strong business cases and ultimately monitored for the effectiveness and efficiency against benchmarks and service level agreements.

The vision of GBS at Biogen is to be recognized as a world-class Global Business Services organization driven by the desire for excellence in its people, business solutions, execution and partnerships with internal customers.

The GBS Business Optimization team will champion building a continuous improvement culture that other parts of the organization will recognize and seek out for business support. We are developing a performance-based culture supported by tools, training, and well-defined accountability, where people can build their career or prepare for a role in the wider business or elsewhere within GBS. We seek individuals who can enhance our team with their knowledge, skills, innovation, collaboration and “can do” attitude.

Job Description

This individual will become a key member of IT Category Sourcing team, which is responsible for managing Biogen’s technology spend globally. In this role, the individual will:

· Generate, maintain, manage and report IT savings. This involves working with stakeholders, IT category managers, and Finance partners to baseline savings opportunities, calculate and document savings, and manage savings tracking and reporting for the IT category. The Category Analyst will also support savings forecasting for future periods.

· Manage the Request for Proposal (RFP) process. This involves using our e-sourcing platform, communicating with vendors and stakeholders, analyzing data in vendor responses, developing recommendations, and supporting the development of a negotiation strategy

· Analyze and cleanse category spend data to identify opportunities for potential savings. Be the resident expert on Biogen’s IT spend.

· Develop, maintain, manage and report on metrics that measure performance of IT Sourcing and Procurement, and support data collection and tracking.

· Develop and lead a market intelligence practice for IT Sourcing, which will involve identifying best practices and benchmark data, and managing these key resources.

· Participate in the development of and support the updating and maintenance of IT category sourcing plans, based on data collected, opportunities identified, roadmaps/budgets provided by IT, and other inputs.

· Participate in the development of workflows that define key IT Procurement process and ensure that these are input for performance metrics

· Identify continuous improvement opportunities. Standardize documents and processes.

· Support ad-hoc data and reporting requests from the IT function or from Procurement/GBS leadership.

The individual in this role will have the opportunity to flex and develop their data analytics skills, develop deep knowledge of the Sourcing process by working in partnership with IT Sourcing managers, and gain exposure to key IT initiatives in a leading biotech organization.

Performance Indicators:

• Value creation, including savings achieved and savings opportunity identification

• Category performance metrics (from category plan)

• Sourcing events planned vs executed

• Implemented Continuous Improvement (CI) and associated value

• Data quality and accuracy (spend data, savings data, etc.)

• Stakeholder satisfaction

Qualifications

• Strong research, analytical and problem-solving skills

• Demonstrated understanding of cost modelling and associated tools

• Ability to work effectively across functions

• Can organize and analyze large volumes of data to draw effective conclusions.

• Strong communication skills, with ability to present information in a clear and concise manner

• Past experience as an advanced user of enterprise software systems

• Knowledge of the Source-to-Pay process preferred.

Education:

• University degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience required; advanced/graduate degree preferred.

• 2-4 years’ experience

• Experience working in a Procurement or Sourcing function is a plus

• Experience working in or with an IT function is a plus

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Position Summary:

The Business Configuration Analyst will fulfill a role in the Business Services Configuration Center of Excellence for one of HealthEdge’s products, HealthRules Payor.

Candidates should have 1-5 years of experience working in the health plan industry in areas such as claims processing, benefits configuration, member enrollment, correspondence, medical management (UM, CM, DM), provider contracting and finance or be a recent graduate in a Health Information Management curriculum.

Under the guidance of an experienced business lead, activities will include delivering professional services as a configuration analyst in support of Payor products. This will include requirements gathering, definition, and configuration of the system and workflows for our customers as necessary. This hire will contribute to professional services projects through billable business configuration and will assist with quality assurance and testing, documentation of artifacts, and may occasionally assisting with training.

HealthEdge is an agile and innovative 21st century software company focused on providing next-generation, business-transforming technology products to the healthcare payor market. We enable our customers to radically innovate, drastically reduce costs, and efficiently address the business imperatives of the evolving healthcare economy.

HealthEdge is headquartered in Burlington, MA. This is primarily a virtual role which may require 25% travel to the client site.

Responsibilities:
Become a configuration subject matter expert and trusted client adviser for the HealthRules Payor product.
Work closely with stakeholders (i.e. business unit personnel, business experts, other staff, vendors, and contractors) to understand and document project business and system requirements and workflows.
Facilitate customer requests within their scope and act in a program quality role while monitoring the timely delivery based on customer objectives and departmental priorities.
May conduct interviews with stakeholders to elicit detailed functional and system requirements.
Work closely to support project members and various project teams.
Work directly with users and customers to identify needs and resolve software configuration problems.
Monitor and troubleshoot common daily tasks and events as well as changes.
Write internal knowledge base and customer service materials.
Reproduce, test, resolve and document software bugs, defects and problems.
Requirements:
Strong written and verbal communications skills.
Prior configuration experience strongly preferred.
Prior health plan industry experience (HMO, PPO, POS, MAPD, Medicare, Medicaid, Dental etc.)
Prior experience with health plan claims and benefits administration software.
Ability to manage multiple assignments with a high level of autonomy and independence.
Knowledge of Excel and Access.
Excellent organizational skills.
Ability to work well independently and be self-motivated.
Job Location: Virtual

Travel: 25% or less– primarily virtual

Billable requirements: 90% or greater

Bachelor Degree preferred or equivalent work experience.

Company Overview

Donegal Insurance Group is a regional property-casualty insurance company doing business in 26 states, headquartered in Marietta, PA, with 7 regional offices located in Athens, GA, Le Mars, IA, Grand Rapids, MI, Albuquerque, NM, Greenville, OH, Glen Allen, VA, and Sheboygan Falls, WI.

Donegal offers a broad range of personal and commercial insurance products sold exclusively through our network of independent agents. We are committed to the independent agency system and proud of the company's heritage, which spans over 130 years. Donegal's strong financial foundation and successful operating strategies have earned the company a rating of 'A' (Excellent) by the A.M. Best Company, the nation's leading insurance rating organization.

Job Summary

The Production Control Analyst will be responsible for the Mainframe environments (Test, Production, Development) to creating and maintain any Workload Automation along with providing Task and Workflow support for both Computer Operations and Mainframe Development teams related to Mainframe processing.

Create and maintain documentation for the running and support of tasks for the Computer Operations staff. Review and advise development staff for Mainframe batch processing such as JCL and Procs (cataloged mainframe procedures). Work with the Enterprise Automation team to create, manage, maintain, modify Workflows and Tasks that cross between Mainframe and Open systems. Will be the primary support team member for computer operators with questions or resolution of issues.

Responsibilities and Duties
Responsible for ensuring successful completion of the mainframe batch cycles. This will require engaging and integration with the mainframe development resources as needed.
Responsible for incident management as it relates to production cycle issues and exceptions. This will require communication to all impacted areas when significant production cycle events occur and marshaling appropriate technical resources towards resolution.
Identify system problems and make sure each potentially affected area is notified before the next cycle occurs.
Ensure that any special processes or changes to the production cycle are reviewed and that changes to the cycle are tested, test results presented and communicated to affected parties.
Maintain appropriate mainframe production system cycle documentation and back out and restore procedures. This would also include updating operational run book procedures as needed. Provide assistance and backup to the Production and Operations Manager as needed.
Ensure the job naming standards are being followed.
Lead problem management activates as it relates to production cycle issues and incidents. This will require tracking of issues and associated root cause analysis and remediation. These activities will require interaction with mainframe programming and other technical resources.
Identify and facilitate areas of continuous improvement associated with the production cycles.
Primary contact and support of mainframe schedule changes.
Participate in disaster recovery planning and understand the execution of DR cycles and tests.
Notify Production and Operations Manager in a timely fashion of system issues that need attention.
Qualifications and Skills
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
Five years of computer operations experience working in a medium to large scale Data Center and 3-5 years of Production Control Analyst experience.
For full-time, permanent positions, we also offer a comprehensive benefits package, including:
Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance
Company Paid Life Insurance
401k Plan
Paid Time Off
Sick Days
Paid Holidays
Incentive Plan
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Flexible Benefits Plan
Continuing Education Assistance

Job Description:

Culture & Values:

In everything we do, we deeply believe all people possess a fundamental right to receive financial enlightenment - straightforward and simple. Management deeply believes in the power of inspired and motivated people - and in their ability to accomplish great things, both individually and together.

General Summary:

Under general supervision but in compliance with Credit Union policy and procedure, compiles, prepares, analyzes and presents management information to various audiences. This may include coordination of the annual budget process, maintenance of the product cost and profitability process, assistance with liquidity management, asset/liability management support, and/or strategic planning support.

Major Duties and Responsibilities:
Provide robust modeling and reporting to facilitate executive level decisioning. Prepare monthly financial reports and ad hoc reports to assist with business decisions. Responsible for analyzing financial data and preparing financial related reports, utilizing the ProfitStar software system. Work closely with the accounting team to ensure accurate financial reporting. Complete the quarterly NCUA 5300 report.
Supports asset/liability management using, as a primary resource, asset/liability modeling software. Forecasts balances of both assets and liabilities on a 12 to 24 month time horizon. Applies thorough knowledge of USSFCU’s asset/liability management policies and procedures to model assumptions. Assists in the preparation of A/L reports for presentation and analysis at ALCO/MALCO meetings.
Works with the CFO to develop liquidity policy recommendations. Monitors USSFCU’s liquidity position daily and makes recommendations to the CFO to manage both short-term and long-term liquidity positions in conjunction with the strategic plan objectives.
Oversees the credit union’s profitability function. Maintains the profitability and branch accounting module, and provides information and analyzes results of product profitability analysis using the profitability modeling software. Prepares profitability reports for analysis and presentation to executive management and the board. Works closely with managers, supervisors, and staff to identify changes in the way activities flow through USSFCU and how those activities affect their costs. Identifies cost saving and revenue increasing opportunities for USSFCU, using familiarity with operations and procedures.
Assists with the annual budget process for USSFCU. Works with the CFO to provide analysis of budget variances as well as propose budget plan adjustments. Responsible for maintenance and updating of USSFCU’s forecasting software and general ledger systems to ensure accurate assumptions and historical information are available for use as an integral part of budget process.
Assists in the evaluation of investment options and strategies. Monitor the purchase, settlement, safekeeping and sale of investments. Prepare investment related reports for management, the Board and regulatory reporting. Interpret application to the credit union for all existing and new investment related regulatory and GAAP requirements and oversees implementation of those requirements accordingly.
Provides assistance to long-range planning efforts. As the strategic focus of the Credit Union changes and evolves, assists management in identifying how these changes will affect the financial results of the Credit Union. Incorporates new information into the financial forecast that makes up the planning period.
Monitors loan and deposit rates against the competitive landscape to ensure that products are priced adequately to meet strategic and ALM goals.
Methodically reviews accounts payable entries to ensure accuracy of reporting; reviews and analyzes expenses.
Assists with the annual year- end accounting audit process and various other audits and exams conducted throughout the year.
Collects information from various databases and distributes pertinent information to other departments and the Leadership Team
Complies with all applicable Rules, Regulations and Statutes of the NCUA and other appropriate governing bodies to include but not limited to: the Credit Union Bylaws, Credit Union Code of Conduct, Credit Union Employee Guidebook, Bank Secrecy/Anti-Money Laundering Act, Fair Housing Act, Fair Lending Act, and Fair Credit Reporting Act.
Ability to perform duties defined in the Credit Union Security Program.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Required Experience:

Education: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Economics, Business Administration, Finance, or related field required.

Experience: Two (2) year’s general work experience and five (5) years of experience in financial institution investment, asset/liability management or financial analysis required.

Skills: High degree of analytical skill, able to work autonomously, and comfortable with detail. Ability to identify correlation between various groups of financial data. Strong ability to gather, analyze and present financial, statistical and economic data in a clear and concise fashion. Proficiency with PC applications including Word, Excel and Powerpoint required. Experience working with forecasting and analytical software, including Visible Equity, Profitstar, Symitar and others strongly preferred. Requires a working knowledge in the areas of liquidity management, asset liability management, data analysis, and financial institution accounting practices and work flows.

Communication: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills required.

Time in Service: None Required.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Job Description


Summary

S+N is continuously evaluating the rapidly changing situation with COVID-19. We are working diligently to prepare for the future and to return to business as usual. With this in mind, this requisition was established for candidates to express interest in the above position, with a view to progress formally once we are in a position to do so.

Role Overview:

The Finance Business Partner - Operations will lead all financial management and strategic sourcing activities across the manufacturing operations for the Advance Wound Management (AWM) franchise and US Distribution businesses, provide business partner finance support to the AWM operations team and manage an Accounting Analyst supporting the business.

The position is responsible for ensuring effective processes and controls are in place to deliver the financial objectives of the business. Ensures accurate and timely preparation of group reporting and management KPI (budgeting, forecasting and actual results). As an active member of the Fort Worth site leadership team, the Finance Business Partner - Operations will help set the strategic direction of the facility through proper financial analysis and planning activities and provide business support to the management team to ensure that decision making is based on sound data. Act as liaison with corporate and group financial staff as well as internal and external auditors as required. Partners with Finance Operations and is responsible for the adherence of MAPS and SOX across the site as well as compliance with the Group Finance Manual and Policy.

Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain strong working relationships with AWB / US Distribution Operations and Global Financial teams.
Operations Finance lead for AWB Manufacturing in Curacao and BIFG / US Distribution activities
Lead the actual management reporting and planning financial processes for AWB Manufacturing, BIFG and SG&A
Prepare, monitor and review management reporting of financial performance within the required time schedule to help management deliver results in line with business plan
Support compliance with all aspects of Sarbanes Oxley for the unit in terms of design effectiveness, operation of controls and correction of deficiencies.
Work with the local management teams to proactively drive improved financial performance in line with plans.
Lead financial performance management for Capital Expenditure Requisitions (CERs)
Reporting and validation of AWB / US Distribution Operations initiatives.
Oversee the generation of financial statement analyses, capital equipment identification and inventory, material inventory and finished product inventory as well.
Comply with all requirements, duties and obligations under our Quality Management System. This includes the proper action program Management well as corrective and preventive strict adherence and compliance to all regulations, policies and quality procedures.
Comply with the implementation of standards and occupational health programs established by the company, through a compliance with those recommendations to perform the work safely and also advise the company on improvements to prevent incidents or illnesses that could actually damage the integrity of workers and / or the facilities and assets of the company.
Responsible for safeguarding all documents, confidential information, equipment, tools, raw materials, products or other assets directly related to their field of work, in order to avoid incidents that affect the productivity and distribution of our products that may cause economic impact for the company or a breach with our customers, suppliers, shareholders and / or other key audiences.
Location:

Fort Worth, TX

Education:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Accounting or Business Administration with a concentration in Finance

Licenses/ Certifications:

CPA preferred

Experience:
Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in financial and accounting in a manufacturing environments.
Competences:
Excellent problem solving and decision-making skills.
Advanced computer skills for both standard software packages and legacy systems.
Highly analytical.
Knowledge of both GAAP and Stat accounting standards.
SOX and IFRS knowledge.
Manufacturing, Supply Chain/Logistics and Cost Accounting knowledge.
Knowledge of Budgeting Practices.
Comfortable in interdisciplinary problem-solving groups.
Highly developed communication skills, able to communicate financial information to non-financial personnel.
Proven Team leadership and influencing skills
Demonstrable expertise in data-driven improvements.
Passionate about performance improvement with a driven style characterised by high energy and the ability to energise others with his/her enthusiasm
Comfortable with challenging others and being challenged and capable of establishing collaborative relationships in environments of conflict
Physical Demands: N/A

Travel Requirements:

Main Objective:

The Business Analyst position works directly with business departments within Arthrex to build and manage a pipeline of Information Technology projects and enhancements . A successful candidate must have experience defining and operating business processes in one of the following areas: Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Maintenance or Quality. The position liaises with the technical organization to determine the scope, timing and cost of specific projects. Note: This role will work directly within business partner departments to ensure systems meet the requirements for their ongoing business needs.

• Translate business goals and objectives into strategic business capabilities.

• Benchmark current and future processes against best industry practices.

• Develop a roadmap of projects and initiatives for enablement of new capabilities.

• Project Management small and large enhancements

• Engage in efforts to establish scope and business case for new programs and initiatives.

• Participates in the upstream of Demand IT Planning, Budgeting and Strategy sessions within business and Information Technology

• Ensures adoption of consistent processes, strategies and technology.

• Contribute to a design and delivery service in support to business priorities as defined by the business project portfolio and enterprise application landscape.

• Collaborate with internal and external technical resources performing analysis, design, configuration, development, testing, and deployment activities for applications.

• Follow the appropriate methodology for the identification and documentation of business requirements.

• Plan and manage user acceptance testing activities.

• Accountable for solutions supporting business departments.

• Provide the methodology, standards and tools for efficient and effective program management.

• Identify technical functionality that aligns with desired new business capabilities.

• Conduct research on emerging technologies in support of objectives and recommend technologies that will increase cost effectiveness, flexibility, and innovation.

• Identify opportunities to innovate and differentiate Arthrex from its competition.

• Up to 25% travel required

The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed in this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, and indeed additional responsibilities may be assigned, as required, by management.

Bachelor's degree required, preferably in Business, Computer Science or related field required. MBA preferred
Two years of experience within a business function (MFG, Supply Chain, or Quality) with business analysis or business process improvement activity required
Demonstrated history of success leading a business through a significant transformation initiative.
Deployment and optimization of the following system required (SAP – PM)
Involvement in the deployment or optimization of any of the following systems preferred (ME, MII, BI, PP/DS, PP, MM, QM)
Ability to work comfortably at all levels within the organization up to the senior management level.
Knowledge of Program Management Office functions and practices. PMP certification a plus.

Experience with S/4HANA deployment preferred.

Understanding of the major functions in a manufacturing organization.
Strong communication (written and oral) and presentation skills.

Open Position: Senior Business Analyst

Headquartered in Arlington, Virginia, Promontory Interfinancial Network – the nation’s largest deposit allocation service provider and the inventor of reciprocal deposits – provides dynamic, all-weather balance sheet and liquidity management solutions to help financial institutions grow franchise value. The company, chosen by thousands of banks since its founding nearly two decades ago, has assembled the largest bank network of its kind. Its solutions help institutions to acquire high-value, local relationships; purchase funding; and reduce collateralization costs.

At Promontory Interfinancial Network, we prosper by working hard in an open and creative environment. Our efforts to create and maintain a culture that values our people have led us to be designated among the top fintech companies to work for by American Banker. Promontory Network has also been recognized as one of the best places to work by the Washington Post’s Top Workplaces and the Washington Business Journal’s Best Places to Work. Our company is also recognized among Fortune’s lists of Best Workplaces—Small & Medium Businesses and Best Workplaces in Financial Services and Insurance.

What is the role?

You would be a key member of our IT development team, which is responsible for the definition and development of internal and external business applications. Your primary role will be to manage the analysis and oversee the facilitation required to develop new services and products, as well as meeting the diverse needs of a growing network of customers. You will also be responsible for the delivery and maintenance of these services and products, including post-production support and triage. Working with both the development and operations teams, you will help define the tools and strategies used by IT to foster a culture that embraces automation and DevOps processes. At Promontory Network, you can have a challenging, impactful career. You should possess the experience and qualifications to perform core responsibilities, such as:
Work with top talent in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment where automation and technical craftsmanship are a top priority.
Exhibit strong leadership abilities - inspire, motivate, and provide coaching as appropriate.
Triage and lead support for pre- and post-production release issues, which may include defect resolution, emergency enhancement requests, and data patching.
Write and review database patches, scripts, and queries to answer business inquiries, facilitate data-driven decisions, and resolve incidents.
Take responsibility for the overall application development lifecycle, including ensuring that project deliverables meet or exceed company policies, procedures, and standards.
Collaborate with Development Team managers to ensure high-quality software is designed, developed, and maintained in an efficient manner.
Partner with and support the Operations, Security, and Corporate IT teams to ensure that overall strategic goals are achieved and a highly collaborative culture of continuous improvement is constantly demonstrated.
Independently complete functional analysis for new features; document functional and system requirements; and produce supporting artifacts, including user stories and acceptance criteria, story maps, data flows, process flows, etc.
Usher feature development from inception to release. Continually engage in the development process. Be able to answer questions, provide detail, address changes to requirements, and facilitate dialog across teams when issues and challenges are encountered to ensure the end product is delivered as specified.
Be able to operate across multiple projects simultaneously and perform a variety of tasks from addressing production issues to designing new applications.
What qualifications are required?
Experience: Extensive experience with Agile methodologies, specifically Scrum. Ability to independently create user stories, manage a product backlog, and ensure that regular backlog grooming is effectively performed. Experience querying databases, using Excel for data analysis, and writing basic SQL scripts. Demonstrated leadership during production support, production releases, and/or user testing cycles.
Abilities: Exceptional written and oral skills sufficient to communicate effectively with nontechnical and technical business clients and team. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Outstanding customer and interpersonal skills. Proactive. Self-directed. Able to manage a cross-functional team of varied technical skill sets. Work independently or within a group of people as the situation requires.
Technical Skills: Strong skills with writing SQL queries required; experience with Oracle desired. Knowledge of Amazon Web Services and willingness to learn related technologies is helpful. Hands-on experience with MS Office, especially Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint. Five+ years of experience in computer programming or related technologies.
Education: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience, preferred expertise in Economics, Finance, and/or Computer Science.
How do I apply?

Don’t just settle for a job, explore our career opportunity.

APPLY

Who is Cenlar?

You are.

Employee-owners have made Cenlar one of the nation’s largest mortgage subservicers. We have achieved success by empowering people with company ownership, real programs that provide avenues for advancement, and a great atmosphere that makes everyone look forward to the workday. Get your share of our success by considering the opportunity to join our team as a Quality Assurance Analyst.

Perform ongoing, structured, and rigorous testing of key procedures and controls within all business units; working with the department manager, develop, draft and implement new testing scripts.
Work closely with managers in order to ensure department is adhering to all policies and procedures; work in conjunction with other departmental managers and operations supervisors.
Develop, maintain and ensure accuracy of default policies and procedures; work with department managers to ensure current processes are in place; maintain procedure manual (hard copy and on-line).
Perform ongoing monitoring of key indicators to detect and research unexplained variances which may be indicative of quality control issues.
Monitor outbound and inbound calls from relevant business units and departments.
Perform processes used for sample selection as well as effective root-cause analysis and follow-up on corrective actions.
Contribute to reporting to first-line-management and other interested parties.
Interpret regulatory requirements and investor guidelines to identify opportunities, and manage a tracking and reporting mechanism to periodically communicate results.
Follow Standard Operating Procedures on all federal and state laws, investor/guarantor requirements and business policies and procedures.
Support the department manager in maintaining a repository of business and process guidelines and fraud trends to be used as a reference tool.
Provide quality monitoring reports.
Develop best practices to resolve delinquencies and deficiencies and meet regulatory compliance.
Stay abreast of policy and regulatory changes to maintain subject matter expertise. Remain cognizant of relevant quality assurance policies and procedures.
Ensure departments are adhering to quality expectations with regard to task completion, and to procedures, etc. Review processes in various servicing departments for quality and compliance.
Work on performance plans for each department; participate in performance activities and staff training.
Other duties and projects as assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree preferred
2 - 3 years’ quality assurance/control, mortgage banking, auditing or other relevant experience
Knowledge of sound risk management practices for mortgage servicing functions and demonstrated understanding of risk management and internal control principles
Experience reviewing processes, data, phone calls or documents with a strong attention to detail
Experience interpreting rules and guidelines for appropriate decision-making
Ability to facilitate training materials
Excellent customer service skills
Excellent problem resolution and organizational skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, written and verbal

As a Financial Analyst at Echo Global Logistics, you will be required to perform standard monthly close processes in a timely fashion in order to meet internal and external deadlines. You will also be heavily involved in our quarterly reforecast and annual budget cycles, aligning business needs with short and long-term financial goals. You will be required to work with management and department heads across the enterprise to ensure engagement, accuracy and consistency in all aspects of financial reporting. Finally, you must be self-motivated. A proven ability to take partial direction and run with it or blaze your own trail that helps move the business forward is key. The environment is fast-paced and you will be privy to proprietary information, so a proven history of discretion is required as well. This role will report to the Manager of Financial Planning but will interact with all departments regularly, including the Executive team and Business Unit leaders.

Qualified candidates will possess the following characteristics and experience:
A strong interest in data analytics and technology such as Anaplan and Excel
Willingness to work collaboratively with other business analysts across Echo organization
1-4 years’ experience in a Finance capacity
Transportation/Supply Chain experience a plus
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Self-managed and motivated, able to work independently on most projects

Very organized and detail oriented
Ability to deal with confidential information and maintain privacy

Financial Crimes Business Analysis, Director

Job Summary:
As a part of Compliance Technology, the Director of Financial Crimes Business Analysis will build and lead a team of business analysts (BAs). The BA team will help Financial Crimes Office Americas (FCOA) design technology solutions to address risks and control deficiencies. The BAs will act as expert consultants and advise FCOA on the best ways to meet their needs, presenting various options. The BAs will then work with Compliance Technology developers to refine designs and create detailed business requirements. The ability to quickly grasp Compliance concerns and synthesize options is critical. The Director must work closely with geographically disbursed stakeholders across a variety of businesses and functions, including Home Office staff in Tokyo.

The Director will also serve as Chief of Staff for Compliance Technology and oversee planning and execution for all Compliance Technology projects. The Director must have strong track record of leading teams, and mentoring and developing direct staff. Polished oral and written communication skills and the ability to build relationships are essential. The Director must be experienced in presenting to executives and department heads, have a minimum of 10 years in-depth experience in banking and Compliance, and be a proficient risk manager. The Director should also be experienced in various Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies, including Waterfall and Agile, and have a solid understanding of technology and data.


Major Responsibilities:
Develop team members to be effective business analysts
Define team procedures and standards
Oversee reporting to senior management; including the Chief Information and Operations Officer (CIOO)
Oversee project planning and execution and escalate risks and concerns
Refine proposed solutions and estimate resource requirements in consultation with technology leads
Act as an expert resource to ensure that the project meets business objectives
Qualifications
10+ years experience implementing technology solutions at large banks or financial institutions
5+ years experience directing managing staff
In-depth knowledge of Compliance Risks and Risk Management, including AML, Sanctions, and Anti-Bribery and Corruption
Experience developing business requirements to solve complex problems in consultation with business partners
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Experience writing detailed business requirements and functional requirements
Experience presenting to executive level management and department heads
Experienced in SDLC methodologies including Waterfall and Agile
Knowledge of SQL and experience analyzing data
Bachelors degree preferred
CAMS certification preferred
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities duties and skills required of personnel so classified.

Acorio is looking for a Sr. ServiceNow Technical Consultant who is passionate about the platform, specifically within IT Asset Management. Why Acorio:
Acorio is a top cloud consultancy focused on the ServiceNow enterprise cloud platform. We deliver large-scale Enterprise Service Management transformation projects to the Fortune 1,000. We offer Big Five credibility with start -up agility, innovation and a relentless focus on customer excellence, and through direct customer feedback we are one of the highest rated companies in our industry. We're laser focused on keeping that leadership position as we grow, and this position will play an important role in continuing Acorio's success in exceptional customer delivery

Why we think this position is great:
As a Sr. ServiceNow Technical Consultant within Acorio you will have direct access to some of the most accomplished individuals within the Service Now eco-system. You will have the opportunity to work on a wide variety of implementations, integrations, and upgrades within some of the top Enterprise companies in the US.

Acorio is one of the fastest growing consultancies in the eco-system, and our commitment to learning and development give the Technical Consultant a unique opportunity to growth with individualized road-maps and training to help elevate you to the future you want.

A day in the life:
Participate in all technical aspects of delivering complex customer solutions on the ServiceNow platform.
Advise clients on best practice within the ServiceNow platform to create lasting value and enhanced experiences.
Collaborate effectively with virtual team members to achieve project goals and produce a variety of high-quality deliverables.
Contribute on multiple Agile engagements, utilizing the Acorio methodology and tools to enhance project efficiency.
Demonstrate flexibility by delivering on a variety of project roles; including documentation, testing, and training.
Innovate and identify solutions that can be reused on future engagements.
Proactively keep ServiceNow skills current and contribute to Acorio thought leadership.
What you bring:
3-5 years of experience implementing ServiceNow (SN) in a professional services organization.
A comprehensive understanding of both SN Hardware Asset Management (HAM) and SN Software Asset Management (SAM), including SN Certified Implementation Specialist - SAM, and Asset Model Management micro-certification.
Experience implementing SAM SaaS connections (Microsoft O365, Adobe Creative Cloud, Salesforce, etc.), as well as procurement module and contract lifecycle management (CLM) application integrations.
Experience with complex license metrics/reconciliations (IBM, Oracle, etc.), software spend detection, stockroom/inventory management, and contract management solutions a major plus.
Demonstrated experience in at least one other area of ServiceNow, such as ITSM, ITOM, or ITBM
Broad experience implementing the following Core Process Areas: Incident, Problem, Change, Service Catalog, Request, Knowledge, CMDB.
Experience in one or more of the following is a major plus: Integrations, SCCM, Orchestration, Discovery, or APM.
Experience working with Agile teams, methodologies, and tools in a virtual environment.
A passion for advising and guiding customers on how to get the most out of the product and for learning the latest product features.
A love of working in a fast-paced, collaborative, and entrepreneurial environment with smart and fun people.
Extra awesome:
Additional ServiceNow certifications, such as ServiceNow Certified Application Developer, ServiceNow Certified System Administrator, ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist.
Professional ITAM industry certifications from IAITAM, IBSMA, and/or ITAM Review.
Exposure to/general understanding of software licensing practices. Bonus points for specific expertise in one or more of the following vendors: Microsoft, Adobe, IBM, Oracle, VMWare, Citrix, SAP.

Job Description Summary

Under limited supervision, the Senior Business Systems Analyst is responsible for working with stakeholders to elicit, analyze, specify and validate business and solution requirements to meet business needs. Must be able to bring together a diverse stakeholder group, drive consensus and create a shared understanding between the customer community and the solution delivery team while maintaining alignment with Business and IT Strategies. Using knowledge of business goals, help translate strategies and initiatives into action plans with required deliverables Able to independently transition to unfamiliar business and systems domains. This job typically acts as a team lead for analysts on medium to large sized initiatives. Provides direction, coaching and mentoring to less experienced analysts

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
Identify, refine, and accurately articulate the business objectives and value proposition of assigned initiatives. Bring alternative perspectives and influence consensus among stakeholders.
Ensure the solution (people, process and technology) meets the program and/or project objectives and is aligned with business and IT strategic direction. Participate in the development of a compelling business case that measure and communicate proposed project benefits.
Collaborate with project leads to determine how requirements will be approached and managed for a particular project.
Work with project leads to develop requirements work plans, identify task dependencies, develop estimates and determine resource skill requirements; support risk management and change management activities.
Provide support and mentoring to other analysts and team members to facilitate a better understanding of requirements techniques, processes and deliverables required to support successful project delivery.
Responsible for the success of the Requirements Definition Process for assigned work with limited supervision;.
Elicit, analyze, specify and communicate business, system and implementation requirements.
Ensure the requirements are unambiguous and understandable by both business users and solution delivery teams.
Work with stakeholders to prioritize requirements effectively based on business value, risks and constraints.
Effectively identifies and manages requirements conflicts and issues to resolution.
Ensure that requirements are understood and approved by all stakeholders.
Manage requirement traceability and changes throughout the project lifecycle.
Measures and tracks quality of business analysis work.
Ensure the test strategy and test plans adequately cover the requirements. Assist in defect resolution.
Simultaneously support multiple initiatives as assigned.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Minimum Qualifications
Three years of experience in Business Systems or equivalent required
High school diploma or equivalent required.
Education, Work Experience, & Knowledge
5 years of experience in Business Systems or equivalent preferred.
Bachelors degree in Business, MIS or other related field preferred.
Job Specific Technical Skills & Competencies
Analytical Thinking (Advanced): Identifies current or future problems or opportunities, analyzes, synthesize and compares information to understand issues, identifies cause/effect relationships and explores alternative solutions to support sound decision making.
Facilitation (Advanced): Uses and adjusts style and technique to assist group process and understanding.
Communication (Advanced): Demonstrates effective verbal, written, and listening communication skills.
Teamwork (Advanced): Works together in situations when actions are interdependent and a team is mutually responsible to produce a result.
Relationship Management (Advanced): Seeks out, builds, fosters and maintains productive relationships, networks or alliances to meet goals and achieve results.
Business Perspective (Advanced): Uses knowledge of internal and external factors impacting the property casualty industry to make decisions.
Technology (Intermediate): Uses, leverages and maintains proficiency with corporate and job specific technology as it evolves (e.g., hardware, software, business unit applications and systems tools).
Conflict Management (Intermediate): Brings conflicts into the open and resolves them collaboratively.
Change Management / Resilience (Advanced): Remains energized and focused in the face of ambiguity, change or strenuous demands.
Risk Taking (Advanced): Identifies, assesses, manages and takes intelligent risks to attain objectives.

Zions Bancorporations Enterprise Technology and Operations (ETO) team is transforming what it means to work for a financial institution. Together we are building a culture that values diversity and creates a space of belonging for all our team members. We believe that investing in your success is an investment in our customers and our business. Our people are what sets us apart and make us great.

Configures system settings and options; plans and executes unit, integration and acceptance testing; and creates specifications for systems to meet business requirements. Designs details of automated systems. Provides consultation to users in the area of automated systems. Leads cross-functional linked teams to address business or systems issues.

Job Description:

Job Responsibilities:
Communicates and collaborates with external/internal customers and stakeholders to analyze information and business needs to deliver functional and technical requirements to applications development teams along with business solutions to the company
Provides consultation to users in the area of automated systems.
Leads cross-functional linked teams to address business or systems issues.
Identifies business process best practices and suggests process improvements
Responsible for conducting prototypes, developing functional specifications, data mapping, function mapping, setting of configuration tables and setting of transaction/ control tables
Leads evaluation and implementation of process improvements including needs analysis, scope definition and test plan development and execution
Elicits requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, data and workflow analysis

Puget Sound Energy is looking to grow our community with like-minded, top talented individuals like you! With our rapidly growing, award winning energy efficiency programs, our pathway to an exciting and innovative future is now.

PSE's IT Project Management Office team is looking for qualified candidates to fill an open Sr IT Business Analyst position!
Job Description
Works with project teams to identify, elicit, and document requirements, including stakeholder, solution, functional, technical, and transitional, in order to support IT projects.
Clarifies the business rationale of a solution concept, surfaces, potential impacts of the solution on stakeholders, clearly articulates the role of technology in terms easily understood by business constituencies.
Will facilitate process documentation and improvement with a cross IT or enterprise wide focus.
Will propose changes as appropriate to requirements methodology, system documentation and processes to better streamline IT project work.
Prioritizes problems to surface the most critical needs and competing business demands.
Understands technology standards and architecture guidelines and obtains key input from enterprise.
Incorporates usability and user interface techniques when designing systems.
Formulates and defines requirements and objects through research and fact-finding combined with an understanding of business and industry requirements.
Play a key role in aligning the needs of business with the capabilities delivered by IT. Analyze and synthesis information provided by a large number of people that interact with the business and IT.
Is responsible for understanding business requirements, coordinating and delivering IT Services for the requirements, resolving challenges and priorities, and reporting status to support the delivery of IT Services to the Project Manager and the team.
Manages and cultivates the relationships with internal customers and project teams.
Upholds the safety compliance standards inherent in PSE’s operating and/or field procedures related to work responsibilities. Promotes and supports a culture of total safety.
Job Responsibilities
Assumes full accountability for developing requirements for project tasks.
Works closely with project teams and internal customers and IT teams to ensure accurate translation of business/application specifications into workable requirements and has primary responsibility for documenting all requirements including stakeholder, solution, functional, non-functional and transitional.
Identifies stakeholder, solution, functional, technical, and transitional requirements and process updates required to support large and complex IT projects, and understands how these translate into customer needs and benefits and resource requirements.
Uses analytical tools and methods to analyze and streamline complex IT processes.
Provides requirements and process consultation to business area management and staff for all aspects of IT services.
Coordinates implementation of the system hardware and software when needed to support project deliverables. Works with the Project Manager or Manager.
Works with the QA team to write scripts and develop test plan when needed.
Can identify and document emerging business requirements. Can intelligently question business partners to identify unique value drivers.
Properly prioritizes business and enterprise demands and accurately translates business requirements and functionality.
Accurately measures the contribution of IT projects to business value.
Can manage ambiguity and create accurate estimates related to BA deliverables.
Can identify commonalities and suggest a consistent approach across projects in the absence of standards.
Can engage with the business in their normal day to day environment and can effectively convey their needs to IT teams in order to deliver value and benefit.
Responds to unfamiliar, undefined, unexpected, or unstable situations with the professionally prescribed standard response. Uses standard analytical tools and rules to determine root cause and resolve the broad range of common system or process problems. Updates or creates documentation based on work performed.
May assist with writing user documentation and user training materials, and assume responsibility for completing project communication tasks related to OCM.
Provides services support and procedure guidelines to client and systems areas through documentation.
Proposes changes to system documentation and processes to better streamline work. Assumes responsibility for developing new or updating existing processes and workflows in support of project requirements and services.
Proficiently applies IT methods, professional knowledge and PSE standards and practices to complex tasks and situations.
Effective in building and sustaining relationships with business partners, professional peers, and other IT team members.
Has deep knowledge of IT services and understands how team must work together to deliver services internal customers and project teams require.
May function as Project Coordinator/Project Manager on small to mid-sized infrastructure projects.
Estimates services required for large projects involving multiple departments, platforms, technologies, executive sponsors, or particularly high risk business problems.
Works with project manager to develop realistic work estimates, financial budgets and project schedules. Reviews project deliverables for accuracy and provide assistance and mentoring to others.
Coaches less experienced IT professionals.
Operates under general direction.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of experience in related field, or combination of specialized training or experience and five years of directly relevant experience.
Expertise in process design, reengineering, and requirements management and documentation methodologies.
Experience in requirements management, diagramming, use case development (UML).
Solid understanding of IT services and delivery processes.
Demonstrated team leadership and facilitation techniques.
Some experience in business case development.
Has a strong understanding of information systems, business processes, the key drivers and measures of success for the relevant business.
Must be a self-starter.
Demonstrated creative thinking and analytical skills.
Strong attention to detail.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Project, Excel, Outlook and Visio.
Desired Qualifications
IT Project or proven related experience.
BA Certification such as IIBA, CBAP.
Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) Certification.
Previous experience managing small to mid-sized projects.
Familiarity with project life cycles.
Proficiency with Microsoft Project and Visio.

This job is an individual contributor primarily responsible for completing and reviewing various unique appraisals in the agricultural lending area as well as determining and securing appropriate collateral for lending needs. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, reviewing and analyzing technical and legal documentation, using judgement to identify appropriate comparables, determining appropriate entries into appraisal software, entering into contracts with external appraisers and communicating throughout the appraisal process with both internal staff and customers.

In this job, you will:
Perform internal appraisals of agricultural properties, research and analyze subject property data and market data to provide current collateral valuations.
Engage appraisers from approved list of appraisers, manage bidding process, award process, and report delivery process.
Respond to inquiries from appraisers regarding property data and appraisal assignment conditions.
Review and analyze appraisals performed by external appraisers in compliance with appropriate compliance and/or regulatory rules and confirm appraisal valuation is accurate/acceptable and collateral is acceptable as related to the scope of the assignment to meet investor requirements (includes analyzing market analysis and approaches utilized to value property to provide estimated value).
Prevent delays by providing notification and appropriate coaching for requested revisions.
Drive panel performance by developing and managing high-trust vendor relationships.
Communicate with loan officers regarding appraisal assignment requirements, conditions and status.
Respond to inquiries from credit analysts, loan officers, and members of senior management in order to resolve appraisal disputes and concerns.
Serve as a peer and subject matter expert for QC escalations from our appraiser panel.
Build and maintain professional relationships with internal staff, customers, and vendors.
Complete all required qualifying and continuing appraisal education to receive &/or stay current with appraisal license.
Other duties as assigned.
Here’s what you’ll need to be considered:

Education

Required – Bachelor’s degree in Agriculture, Finance, Business, or related field.

Experience

Required – None.

Preferred – Experience in agriculture.

License/Certification

Required – Valid driver’s license and satisfactory driving record.

Required – State Certified General Appraisal License or ability to pursue and obtain license and continued education.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Working knowledge/Ability to quickly learn various aspects of appraising agricultural collateral.
Advanced mathematical skills (calculate figures and amounts, such as discounts, interest and percentages).
Proficient computer skills, including working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (including Excel, Word, Outlook, Adobe and use of internet search functions).
Effective interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with the ability to interact with all levels of people within and outside the organization (including ability to effectively speak before groups of customers and others).
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret various resources, such as instructions, third party data, various legal documents, general business periodicals and governmental regulations.
Ability to interpret data and incorporate into valuation review.
Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of situations where only limited standards exist.
Ability to utilize analytical thinking; find facts and solve problems.
Ability to work both in an office setting and outdoors in a farm environment.
Ability to perform independent research and analysis.
Works effectively under pressure and able to work within tight deadlines.
Ability to plat and read legal descriptions and draw maps/aerial photographs.
Here’s additional information you need to know:
This is a full-time position working out of our Louisville, KY office location.
Travel, up to 10-20% travel required; most travel is within two hours driving distance of the assigned office. Some out of town travel may be required for trainings/meetings.
