Job Description:
Company Description

Dailymotion is the leading video discovery destination & technology that learns about your tastes over time; constantly surfacing the best, most relevant content on the web.
Our mission is to provide the best video user experience for consumers on the market, connecting publishers and advertisers to engaged viewers who turn to Dailymotion for their daily fix of compelling music, entertainment, news and sports content around.

Through partnerships with the world's leading publishers and content creators which include: CBS, CNN, Fox Sports, GQ, Mashable, Universal Music Group, VICE and more, Dailymotion commands 4 billion monthly pageviews across its mobile app, desktop and connected TV experiences. Dailymotion is owned by Vivendi, one of the largest mass-media corporations in the world.

Job Description

Within the Dailymotion’s AdTech department, we are looking for someone to join the Business Operations & Analytics team in our NYC office. The team’s mission statement is to drive growth, deliver insights & scale efficiency for the AdTech, Sales & Content tribes.

As Sr. Business Operations Analyst – Programmatic, you will act as a true internal consultant to support our Programmatic Business and actively contribute to the success of the Programmatic Partnerships team driving revenue growth as your #1 priority.

You will have to wear 2 hats to be successful at this job:

· Business Analyst: provide relevant and actionable insights, drive better business understanding and help the team make data-driven decisions

· Project Manager: identify pain points, implement your recommendations concretely and drive efficiency, by providing both strategic thinking and structured project management capabilities

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

· Partner closely with the Programmatic Partnerships team to develop and execute their roadmap and business plan

· Monitor frequently our multiple buyers spend and improve reactivity of the team to fix issues

· Perform regular analysis of our Programmatic Business and provide recommendations on how to unlock more revenue

· Develop our Business insight via better Reporting & Dashboarding using both our internal and external data

· Drive large cross-functional projects, partnering with multiple stakeholders to implement your business recommendations

· Help our Operations team develop our Programmatic Marketplace and facilitate the go-to-market of new offers to our different demand sources

· Scale tools and processes to improve the DSPs/SSPs relationship cycle (automation, CRM, regular business reviews…)

· Provide high quality consulting and analytics support across a variety of strategic team initiatives

Qualifications

WHAT THE IDEAL CANDIDATE LOOKS LIKE..

· Master’s degree from a Top Business or Engineering University

· At least 4 years of experience in a strategy consulting firm, investment bank, or renowned tech company at a strategy, operations or analytics position

· Prior experience in the AdTech / Programmatic industry isrequired

· Strong SQL skills and knowledge of data visualization tools (Tableau is a plus)

· Great rigor, structured approach to problem-solving and very strong attention to detail

· Amazing ability to synthesize complex subjects into a couple of key comprehensive message

· Excellent communication skills and great ability to cooperate efficiently with people from different backgrounds (tech, operations, sales, finance, legal…) and seniorities (from juniors to C-level

· Creative and entrepreneurial mindset, highly autonomous and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously

· Fluency in English (written and oral)

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU

· Join Dailymotion during a key period of growth and development with multiple key projects being launched from the ground-up to achieve very ambitious goals over the next few years.

· Join a growing team with many processes to improve and projects to implement, with the opportunity to play a key role and bring new ideas to the table!

Additional Information

Location: New York
Type of contract: Full-time
Start Date: ASAP
Flexible time off; vacation, holidays, sick-leave, etc..
Fitness club membership
100% healthcare coverage starting day 1
Commuter benefits
401k Contribution
Paid parental leave
FULLY stocked kitchens with free snacks and drinks!
Feel free to explore Dailymotion culture a little further, please check out:
/ Our BuiltIn page: https://www.builtinnyc.com/company/dailymotion
/ Our Recent Global Hackathon in November 2018: https://www.dailymotion.com/video/x70val9
/ Welcome to the Jungle page: https://www.welcometothejungle.co/companies/dailymotion/team
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Alternate Locations: Fort Wayne, IN (Indiana)

Relocation assistance is not available for this opportunity.

Level: P3

About the Company

Lincoln Financial Group, a Fortune 250 company with over 10,000 employees, provides advice and solutions that help empower Americans to take charge of their financial lives with confidence. Our core business areas — Life Insurance, Annuities, Retirement Plan Services and Group Protection — focus on supporting, preserving and enhancing over 17 million customer’s lifestyles and retirement outcomes.

Headquartered in Radnor, Pennsylvania, Lincoln Financial Group is the marketing name for Lincoln National Corporation (NYSE: LNC) and its affiliates. The company had $238 billion in assets under management as of December 31, 2018.

Ranked one of the Best Large Employers in America by Forbes magazine, Lincoln Financial Group makes a serious investment in our employees’ futures through a broad range of wealth accumulation and protection plans, health and wellness programs, and career development resources designed to help each individual reach their personal and professional goals.
The Role
As the Business Analyst in Retirement Plan Services, Life & Annuity Operations Project Management Organization, you will provide subject matter expertise and direction on complex Business Analysis projects/initiatives for the Annuities Operations. You will also advise and collaborates with business stakeholders to define and validate complex business solutions that meet the needs, goals and objectives for assigned area(s).
Duties and Responsibilities
Champions and enhances organizational initiatives by positively influencing and supporting change management and/or departmental/enterprise initiatives within assigned area(s) of responsibility.
Collaborates effectively with appropriate internal and/or external stakeholders on more complex issues and conflicts that impact time, cost, scope, quality and risk of assigned projects.
Collaborates with internal and/or external stakeholders to assess, select and recommend more complex solutions and/or alternative approaches that will achieve business goals.
Consults and acts as a resource to appropriate internal and/or external stakeholders to ensure solutions meet business needs
Consults and collaborates with key internal and/or external stakeholders to elicit more complex business issues, determine root cause(s), and capture business needs.
Consults/Analyze on more complex assignments and/or projects for his/her assigned area(s) of responsibility.
Determines and recommends the most appropriate response to identified more complex problems, issues and/or defects by assessing impact and prioritization.
Determines more complex best practices and suggests how to improve current practices.
Develops more complex business requirements for assigned area(s) of responsibility.
Facilitates change to the organization through the more complex analysis, design and implementation of business processes that achieve business objectives.
Identifies and recommends process improvements that significantly reduce workloads or improve quality for his/her assigned area(s) of responsibility.
Maintains knowledge on current and emerging developments/trends for assigned area(s) of responsibility, assesses the impact, and collaborates with management to incorporate new trends and developments in current and future solutions.
May provide more complex testing support as needed.
May serves as a mentor and share knowledge with junior and/or peer team members.
Provides more complex research and analysis to support business operations and presents findings to management or project leader.
Serves as a resource to team members and applicable internal/external stakeholders on more complex assignments/projects for his/her assigned area(s) of responsibility.
Using structured requirements process, clearly articulates, documents and validates more complex business requirements.
Validates that the solution meets the business need by developing more complex acceptance criteria and plan to evaluate

Additional Position Responsibilities
Carries out duties in compliance with all state and federal regulations and guidelines. Complies with all company and site policies and procedures.
Makes a positive contribution as demonstrated by: - Making suggestions for improvement - Learning new skills, procedures and processes
Performs other duties as required.
Remains current in profession and industry trends.

Education
4 Year/Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience (4 years of experience in lieu of Bachelors)_Minimum Required in Computer Science, Information Systems or Information Technology

Experience
3 - 5+ Years experience in business analysis that directly aligns with the specific responsibilities for this position

Ability to work with others in a team environment.
Demonstrated strong relationship management skills with internal clients (e.g. management, peers and colleagues); proven ability to develop collaborative approaches.
Demonstrates ability to identify and recommend processes improvements.
Demonstrates excellent organizational skills with the ability to prioritize workload and multi-task while maintaining strict attention to detail.

Job Summary

This position will provide experienced leader with excellent communications and coordination skills to support program management for the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA).

Years of Relevant Experience

The position requires 5+ equivalent years of experience in a people leadership, marketing, planning, and coordinating position in project management, business, communications, or marketing. The candidate must possess the following critical skill set to meet the requirements of the job function:
Excellent communication skills
Coordination (ability to coordinate with teams and between teams)
Sense of judgment (self-awareness, common sense)
Industriousness (diligence, persistence, and completion of job at-hand)
Completion (work with team to define and achieve job completion)
Organization (ability to organize tasks, plan effectively, and stay focused)
Teamwork (ability to work effectively in teams)
Specific experience with the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) is not required but is a plus. A Bachelor’s degree is required. A Master’s degree or Ph.D. may count for additional years of experience.

Essential Job Functions

The following duties are normal for this position. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from this position if the work is similar, related, and/or a logical assignment for this position. Other duties may be required and assigned.

Individuals will assist in the efficient and effective operation of the program office, providing on-site program execution, coordination, communication between teams and organizations, and data collection to assist in the migration of data from current FAA systems to new database systems to be retained by an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) tool at the FAA. The data migration analyst will support coordination of data exchange between parties, communication of completeness and meeting intended requirements, persistence in gathering information from defined parties, coordinating with the larger program office team where challenges or roadblocks appear, and other data migration support activities. For data migration, the individual’s activities include but are not limited to:
Collect data from engineering teams in pre-determined templates, checking for completion, and noting where gaps exist
Delivering populated templates to engineering and implementation teams, gathering and documenting feedback, and reporting on status of efforts to the program manager
Support coordination of data exchange between parties, communication of completeness and if data population is meeting intended requirements
Will demonstrate persistence in gathering information from defined parties and will coordinate with the larger program office team identifying and resolving challenges or roadblocks as they appear
Work in a team environment with system, data, and engineering SMEs to collect templates, adjust data requests, and keep the data migration effort on track
Assist in other communication, status briefings, and updates in support of data migration activities.
Individuals will be required to contribute effectively to working groups through oral and written communication and cooperative working relationships. Detail oriented, self-driven individuals sought.

Education Requirements

Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in Communications or Business Management. Graduate and Post Graduate degrees are a plus and may count as additional years of experience.

Skills Requirements

Ability to coordinate and communicate in a fast-paced team environment. Minimum proficiency with MS Excel and other MS Office Products. Strong organizational, communication, coordination, and interpersonal skills.

Security Requirements

Must be a US citizen or a legal resident for three of the past five years. Must meet eligibility requirements for a US Public Trust security clearance.

Travel

Occasional travel required as needed by client/s and/or company

Through its administration of the $10 billion Universal Service Fund (USF) programs on behalf of the FCC, USAC works to promote the availability of quality services at just, reasonable and affordable rates and to increase access to advanced telecommunications services throughout the nation. Specifically, the USF programs provide funding for the expansion of telecommunications and broadband access to rural communities and health care facilities, schools and libraries across the country, and low income households. Through program administration, auditing, and outreach, USAC works with contributors, service providers, and program beneficiaries to achieve the program goals articulated by the FCC for each of these programs.
The FCC has reformed the USF to support further investment in and access to evolving broadband infrastructure, making the programs a primary vehicle to support this critical national priority. USAC, as the administrator of the USF, plays a critical role in supporting the ambitious vision to ensure that all citizens in the United States have access to high-speed broadband. The organization has approximately 500 employees with an operating budget of more than $200 million. USAC works in close partnership with the FCC and other federal and state partners to support the achievement of the USF program goals.
USAC administers the USF programs—High Cost, Lifeline, Rural Health Care, and Schools and Libraries. USAC strives to provide efficient, responsible stewardship of the programs, a key national asset in making important telecommunications and Internet services available to consumers, health care providers, schools, and libraries throughout the United States. The program divisions are supported by additional USAC personnel in Finance, General Counsel, Information Systems, Internal Audit, the Enterprise Program Management Office and Human Resources. Consistent with FCC rules, USAC does not make policy for or interpret unclear provisions of statutes or the FCC’s rules.
Universal service is paid for by contributions from telecommunications carriers, including wireline and wireless companies, and interconnected Voice over Internet Protocol providers, including cable companies that provide voice service, based on an assessment of their interstate and international end- user revenues. These contributions are most typically passed through to consumers through a universal service fee line item on their telephone bills.
Additional information on USF programs can be found at: http://www.usac.org/about/about/who-we- are/default.aspx
USAC offers a comprehensive benefits package, ongoing professional development opportunities, including vacation and sick leave.
USAC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Only principals will be accepted. No agencies please.
To apply, please submit a cover letter and resume, click the “Apply For This Job Online” button.
USAC employees are passionate about our mission. Our work contributes to the success of all Americans. We’ve worked together to build a culture that is collaborative, ambitious, outcome-oriented, and feedback-focused.

Job Description:

SUMMARY: The Business Continuity Senior Analyst will be responsible for assisting the Business Continuity Manager with the day-to-day aspects of the Bank's Business Continuity Management (BCM) Program. This role requires involvement with Business Continuity, Disaster Recovery and Crisis Management planning for all of the Bank's business operations, locations, and IT. The Senior Analyst will lead and manage key projects within the BCM Program and will serve as the primary owner/SME for the tools used to deliver on resilience and preparedness objectives in support of the Bank's brand and reputation. Backup for Business Continuity Manager.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provides support of the development, communication, maintenance, exercising, and activation of Business Continuity, Disaster Recovery and Crisis Management Plans.
Provide ownership accountability and SME guidance for all Business Continuity planning and Notification tools within the BCM Program
Provide lead in maturing current planning and testing processes, integration with Crisis Management, and outbound communications and notifications.
Ensures all business continuity plans are coordinated with requirements and capabilities of our Disaster Recovery program
Analyze impact on, and risk to, essential business functions or information systems to identify acceptable recovery time objectives and resource requirements.
Write reports to summarize testing activities, including descriptions of goals, planning, scheduling, execution, results, analysis, conclusions, and recommendations
Identify opportunities for strategic improvement or mitigation of business interruption and other risks caused by business, regulatory, or industry-specific change initiatives.
Recommend or implement methods to enable effective life safety planning, implementation and testing
Performs due diligence of third party assessments for external resiliency plans, exercises, and approval of contractual obligations
The position may entail any, or all, of the following responsibilities:

Development -- Directing or assisting in the development of Business Continuity/Disaster Recovery Plans and Procedures, and providing regular status updates to the Business Continuity Manager.
Change Management -- Together with the Business Continuity Manager review the implications of proposed technological or organizational changes, and assist in the coordination of any revisions to existing Business Continuity Plans and Procedures necessitated by such changes.

Administration -- Manage key program documentation and reporting, inclusive of presentations, enterprise communications, lessons learned and other such documents.

Training and Awareness -- Assist the Business Continuity department reach the goal of ensuring all personnel with specific Business Continuity responsibilities are adequately trained to fulfill their assigned responsibilities. Ensuring all employees are familiar with the relevant provisions of the Business Continuity Plans.

Testing and Exercising -- Coordinate annual Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery testing on an annual basis validating IT systems, applications data and infrastructure required to meet the business requirements in support of the bank's critical processes. Maintain updated Test plans and exercise documentation. Assist in the coordination of at least one simulation exercise a year, involving all critical business units. Documenting the results of all tests and exercises, and identifying any recommended enhancements to the Business Continuity Plans and Procedures.

Execution -- Providing 7x24 on-call support for any emergency which may require activation of all or part of the BCM program. In the event that activation is required, serving as support to Business Continuity Manager and when manager is unavailable is to perform as their backup. Liaison between the Crisis Management Team (i.e., senior management) and the Incident Response Team (cross functional representatives from across the organization that would support the preparation, management, and recovery efforts for an incident/event.

Primary Backup to Business Continuity Manager. Fills in during absence of BCM.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: Assists with the supervision of employees during activation of the Command Center or during an emergency situation.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:
A BA or BS degree required
CBCP certification strongly preferred
Minimum of 5-7 years of SME level experience in Business Continuity, Disaster Recovery and Crisis Management
Strong interpersonal, facilitation, and communication (both verbal and written) skills; (Soft Skills)
Incident Notification System and Business Continuity tool administration support experience required
Strong analytical, organizational, and decision-making skills.
Technical Acumen with IT/Disaster Recovery planning and testing experience
Ability to work and collaborate with team members, stakeholders, and partners across all levels of the organization
Independent self-starter with the ability to participate in multiple complex projects simultaneously
Ability to coordinate response, recovery and lessons learned activities with remediation strategy during and after a crisis event
Analytical, critical thinking, and consulting services skills with the ability to efficiently support multiple projects simultaneously to a successful completion

Join a fast growing company that is transforming its industry! Financial Recovery Technologies has become a trusted partner to hedge funds, mutual funds, custodians, sovereign wealth funds, and other institutional investment firms, and our best-in-class people and technology have made FRT a market leader. We are seeking a motivated financial analyst to join our growing team. This role will collaborate with departments across the business to perform analyses, build financial planning tools, develop metrics and dashboards, and assist with creating and presenting outputs used to support management and the executive team in making timely and informed decisions related to our strategic objectives.

The role: As a Financial Analyst at FRT, you will:
Own financial planning and budgeting across the business
Develop department-level and company-level financial planning analytics, including budget/forecast, variance and sensitivity analyses, and identification of KPIs and other key metrics
Own variance analysis, forecasting/reforecasting, and financial performance reporting and communications to functional leaders, the executive team, and the FRT Board
Develop models to be utilized for the annual budget/forecast as well as potential strategic initiatives
Identify issues, opportunities, and trends and prepare analyses to guide strategic business decisions
Review and analyze internal financial data to identify issues, opportunities and trends to provide the executive team and others with financial analysis input that will drive decision making including project profitability, productivity analysis, and return on investment
Prepare analyses incorporating external benchmarks, market and competitor data, and potential M&A or new business development opportunities to guide business decisions
Review corporate development opportunities, including M&A
Analyze potential deals as they arise to determine proper valuation or other deal terms
Perform ad hoc tasks as assigned by the Controller and CFO
Our ideal candidate has:
A Bachelor’s Degree in finance, accounting, economics or another analytical discipline; MBA or CFA preferred
A minimum of four year of progressive finance experience; experience in financial services and/or fintech highly desirable
Experience in building and managing finance processes, including forecasting, budgeting, and capital planning
Strong MS Office skills; specifically advanced Excel skills with the ability to create financial models and analytics out of disparate and raw data sets and effectively present findings in an efficient and effective manner to members of management
Advanced analytical and project management skills
Excellent written and verbal communications
Passion and an ability to work in an entrepreneurial and fast-paced environment
Drive – you are self-motivated, hard-working, and able to work independently
A collaborative style, prioritizing collaboration over credit, with an interest in building strong relationships with peers at all levels across corporate functions;
Intellectual curiosity, with a demonstrated commitment to continuous growth; and
Of course, a desire to join a growing company with a vibrant, entrepreneurial culture, dedicated to being the top provider in the class action recovery space.
WHAT FRT OFFERS:
Competitive salary and bonus
Health, dental, vision
401k (with company match)
Income protection plans (life, accidental death and dismemberment, short- and long-term disability) and access to a suite of voluntary benefits
Close to public transit (walking distance to Wellington T on Orange Line)
Free drinks and snacks
Free parking onsite
Free access to onsite gym
Fun, smart, diverse colleagues

The Application Analyst II - Human Resources provides support for assigned Human Resource systems with an advanced understanding of Infor and its related third party business applications which include functionality, system design, technical architecture, testing, workflow, modification, routine and non-routine processing, and business system structure. The Application Analyst II is responsible for advancing the functionality and operational efficiency of the use of Infor CloudSuite. This entails advising and assisting customers in the operation and administration of their system; collaborating with internal customers to enhance their work methodologies and tools; and maintaining a customer-centric technical knowledge and focus when contributing to the analysis, design, development, testing, documentation and implementation activities including recurring Customer Updates of the Infor CloudSuite software.

The Application Analyst II must possess sufficient detailed expertise to support multiple applications, preferably with functional expertise in payroll, timekeeping, or other HRIS systems.Primary areas of focus will be payroll, timekeeping, talent acquisition, and human resources modules. The Application Analyst II provides response and resolution to application problems and requests for change to Infor. This position works in a collaborative team setting, creating and sharing information and assisting team members while providing quality support with a focus on customer service and timeliness. The Application Analyst II must possess detailed human resources knowledge and systems expertise to implement medium to high complexity assignments with minimal guidance.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop and document product definitions, stakeholder needs, product features, and corresponding functional specifications.
Solid understanding of Human Resource management functions
Collaborate and build proactive, positive relations with peers, managers, and cross-functional teams to ensure that consistency within defined processes is maintained; help determine best practices; and work efficiently.
Assist in installation, configuration, administration, and maintenance of the ERP.
Ability to work with aggressive timelines in a team environment with a desire to learn and grow.
Proactively review, test, and communicate significant system updates ensuring system integrity is maintained.
Document issues and resolutions for future reference; help create and maintain FAQ.
Focus on providing a friendly, courteous, and polite customer service experience at all times. Contact vendors regarding service issues to receive support information or assistance as required. Assist users with optimizing the use of assigned applications Set priorities, plans and manages a diverse set of tasks.
Follow the outlined Service Management Processes during outage events.
Participate in after-hours support by rotating call schedule on a regular basis.
May be required to travel to perform some job functions.
Perform other duties and as requested.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree or 6 or more years of related experience in application analysis, or Human Resources
Possess an understanding of and/or experience in the following: payroll, timekeeping, talent acquisition, or human resources management
Relevant Bachelor degree may substitute for relevant years of experience.

Job Summary:

The Business System Analyst will review, analyze and evaluate business systems and user needs. Communicates and collaborates with external/internal customers and stakeholders to analyze information and business needs to deliver functional and technical requirements to applications development teams along with business solutions to the company
Identifies business process best practices and suggests process improvements
Responsible for conducting prototypes, developing functional specifications, data mapping, function mapping, setting of configuration tables and setting of transaction/ control tables
Leads evaluation and implementation of process improvements including needs analysis, scope definition and test plan development and execution
Elicits requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, data and workflow analysis
Assists in security/ authorization set-up, user documentation, data interface design, data migration and reconciliation

Acts as the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams

Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or another related field

Excellent oral and written communication skills with organization and time management skills
Ability to learn, demonstrate and apply knowledge of the business over to solutions and processes

Act as a SME on behalf of the Customer to IT.

Competent with Microsoft Project, Visio, and Office software;

Organizational and analytical skills;

Ability to clearly communicate ideas and solutions;

WillowTree is an award-winning digital product agency driven by innovation and grounded in strategy and user-centered design. We create long-term partnerships with the world's leading brands to design and build digital flagship products crucial to their core business. We are one of the largest independent digital firms in the US. Our clients include HBO, National Geographic, Nestle, PepsiCo, and many more.

The Opportunity


As a Senior Digital Analyst, you'll help our clients track and measure user behavior and engagement within their flagship digital products. You'll use tools such as Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Amplitude, and Mixpanel. You'll create comprehensive analytics strategies and uncover product insights to help us build and optimize the best digital products possible for our clients and their customers.

*This is a full-time opportunity on-site at our headquarters in Charlottesville, VA.

Responsibilities
You'll lead workshops with clients to understand their business and user goals and translate them into trackable outcomes within their digital products
You'll audit our clients' existing analytics strategies. You'll recommend the best analytics tools (e.g. Adobe Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude, Google Analytics) to suit their unique needs
While you won't be writing code, you'll collaborate closely with engineers to dive into technical documentation and provide guidance on how to integrate analytics into the codebase
You'll find meaningful and actionable insights from the data, and create user-friendly dashboards to illustrate your findings
You'll effectively present recommendations and tell the story behind the data to our clients and teams
Qualifications
You have 3+ years of experience leading the digital analytics strategy for clients and/or digital products
You've developed strategies to capture user behavior and engagement on digital platforms such as web or mobile
You've partnered with stakeholders from business, marketing, and/or engineering teams to guide product decisions and roadmaps
You can effectively translate business objectives into trackable metrics
You're a strong communicator and presenter who can tell the story behind data so that it's meaningful and actionable
You've familiar with a breadth of digital analytics tools specifically for measuring user data on digital platforms e.g.Amplitude, Mixpanel, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc and can guide clients in selecting the ideal tool for their needs
You're a data advocate and can both articulate and demonstrate the value of data to clients and project teams
Bonus Points
You've worked with marketing teams to implement growth marketing specific tools or platforms like Segment, Braze, or Branch
You have in-depth experience capturing and measuring user behavior on native mobile
You've helped a client migrate from one analytics tool to another
You've worked on eCommerce digital products
P.S. In an ideal world, you have all the bullet points we listed, but hey we know that's a lot of bullets. If you feel confident about a good amount of them, we can ramp you up on the rest.

Cherokee Town & Country ClubinAtlanta, GAis looking to hire afull-time Financial Analystto engage directly with department leaders across the entire organization in support of our efforts to ensure financial stability and member satisfaction. Are you an energetic self-starter? Do you want to be part of an ambitious and close-knit team? If so, keep reading!

This position comes with a competitive salary of$50,000/yearand a typicalMonday-Fridayschedule. We also offerfree meals while on duty, free parking, a work uniform, employee golf available on most Mondays, employee recognition opportunities, employee appreciation events, and a MARTA discount. If this sounds like the right opportunity to advance your career in finance, apply today!

ABOUT CHEROKEE TOWN & COUNTRY CLUB

Chartered in 1956, Cherokee Town and Country Club is recognized as one of America's premier private clubs. Our Town Club occupies the famed Grant Estate on West Paces Ferry Road in Buckhead and our Country Club is located near the Chattahoochee River in Sandy Springs. The excellence of our facilities, combined with our commitment to the highest standards in dining and member services, has brought the club an extraordinary number of honors and awards throughout the years.

We are in the "happiness business" and believe in a positive "What can I do? How can I help?" attitude. We refer to our high expectations for our staff as the "Cherokee Standard". Wevalue our employeesfor their hard work and dedication. Here at Cherokee Town & Country Club, we are proud of ourtop-notch working environmentsupported by a high-quality team management approach that includescompetitive wagesandawesome perks.

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A FINANCIAL ANALYST

As a Financial Analyst, you use accounting, finance, and business knowledge along with your good judgment to drive our financial success. It's a good thing that you have an analytical mind because you spend much of your time interpreting information. Utilizing Excel, you create complex models and capture key business drivers, forecast and monitor the capital and operational budgets, and calculate KPS's to measure performance and identify opportunities for growth. Occasionally, you support the accounting team with transaction processing to ensure timely and accurate financial results.

While you do spend a lot of time analyzing information, sharing and explaining your findings to our CFO, COO, and department leaders is an equally important part of your job. The information you provide allows us to make strategic decisions. When it comes to key stakeholders, you ensure ongoing communication and dialogue. You strive to improve the data gathering, visualization, and presentation processes, automating whenever possible. You drive improvements in reporting accuracy, timeliness, and insightfulness. You get a great deal of satisfaction out of ensuring that our country club has the revenue necessary to continue serving our members at the highest level!

QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in finance
At least 1 year of FP&A / financial modeling experience
Advanced Excel skills
Recent graduates with applicable internship experience and course work will also be considered. Experience with Microsoft B, Python, R, and/or Tableau is a plus! Do you have a broad understanding of finance and accounting principles? Do you have an inquisitive and analytical mind? Do you have experience with advanced analytics and data visualization tools? Do you have strong interpersonal and communication skills? Are you organized and able to follow up? Are you a creative and resourceful problem solver? If so, you may be perfect for this accounting position!

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be the right Financial Analyst for the job, fill out our initial3-minute, mobile-friendly applicationtoday!

Position Summary

The Senior Systems Analyst plans, conducts, and directs the analysis of business problems with moderate to high complexity to be solved with the development of automated analytical systems leveraging integrated healthcare data systems. The Senior Systems Analyst leads efforts in gathering and documenting business requirements (technical and non-technical) and functional designs and creates technical requirements that will be used by the development team. This includes compiling user requirements to convey to development teams throughout the software lifecycle.

The Senior Systems Analyst will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to fully support the development process, and ensure that project deliverables are met according to specifications and within project timelines. In addition to eliciting and documenting technical requirements, the Systems Analyst is also responsible for assisting with programming, data modeling, and QA testing activities, as well as documenting complex use case scenarios, creating test data and partnering with the QA teams in test execution.

Job Responsibilities
Asist with design, development, analyzing, and modifying existing and new products and modules
Review new functionality to be implemented in modules and applications
Gather business requirements to facilitate the definition and documentation of business processes to meet business needs
Liaison between business and/or product development teams to understand business requirements and convert them to technical requirements for development team
Create technical specifications for system development and testing
Create and evaluate test cases to verify user stories / use cases meet required specifications
Proactively identify and facilitate problem solving including identification of the source of the problem, accurate recommendation of appropriate solutions, and communication of alternative arrangements, if appropriate. Provide escalation to management in a timely manner when appropriate
Provide business knowledge and technical support for requirement development
Work closely with developers and requesters identifying data and functional requirements in the design of new/enhanced systems
Develop and participate in the review of business and functional requirements and determine primary functions that the project is to provide
Participate in end-to-end solutions (Requirement gathering, planning, solutioning, development execution and documentation) for products
Work with customers to understand business challenges/ requirements for expected solutions
Translate high-level business requirements into actionable and achievable products
Clearly document requirements (business and technical)
Participate in solution development process to ensure solution addresses all business requirements
Provide guidance on data conversion/mapping decisions and responsible for data integrity
Understand and document the underlying data elements, constraints, flows and sources supporting the products
Develop the process and supporting artifacts to organize information management into Source to Target Mapping documents, data dictionary, data lineage, and other supporting documents
Ability to operate as a project coordinator and manage end to end project timeline by tracking activities across cross functional teams
Present status, milestones and issues to management and to other stakeholders related to assigned projects
Document and communicate business process design and documentation as needed for new projects and enhancement to existing projects
Familiarity with fundamental financial, performance, and quality measures used in health care payer industry
Assimilate quickly and lead functional aspects of a project to successful delivery and customer acceptance
Ability to project manage small projects
Actively resolve day-to-day functional needs of the business unit with a focus on the analysis of processes – dissecting problems and suggesting solutions, including complex systems process analysis
Ability to prioritize among multiple tasks and self-manage
Is familiar with SOC 2 compliance and its impact on company policies and processes
Understands importance of adhering to SOC 2 requirements, and maintains an effort to do so
Job Requirements
6+ years systems analyst experience
4+ years’ experience with large health care informatics
4+ years in the healthcare analytics industry
Experience analyzing medical and pharmacy claims data and membership data




Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in business, analytic, or computer science-related field
Demonstrated ability to create and oversee business and technical requirement documents and work as liaison between business and technical teams
Demonstrated knowledge SQL programming with medical claims data
Demonstrated ability to integrate and deliver informatics and business intelligence projects
Demonstrated ability to develop test plans and complete acceptance testing processes
Understanding issues related to data analysis in healthcare payer industry
Strong coordination, analytical and communication skills
Ability to derive insight and infer business implications from data
Ability to provide guidance to stakeholders in understanding business value of the initiative
Ability to interface with customers and other stakeholders with minimal supervision
Ability to complete project, with demonstrated commitment to meeting deliverables
Strong understanding of healthcare analytics and ability to identify interdependencies and suggest plans to integrate new and existing processes
Understanding of industry, best practices and standards
Experience with internal / external testing tools
Broad understanding of the organization’s business systems and processes, as well as industry-wide requirements
Understanding of current products and ability to identify interdependencies and suggest plans to integrate new and existing processes

Job Description:
Why work for Brilliant Corners?

Organization Overview

Founded in 2004, Brilliant Corners provides innovative housing and housing-related services to those transitioning from or at risk of homelessness or institutionalization. We develop, own, and manage multi-family supportive housing and licensed residential care homes. Additionally, we implement a broad array of scattered-site, one-on-one supportive housing, and clinical case management programs through partnerships with developmental services, homeless services, veteran services, and health care sectors.

In short, we do good work.

We have offices statewide with a staff of passionate people. While we are growing rapidly, we are also selective: Were seeking inspired, talented people who want to be effecting profound change and who have fun doing it.

Position Summary
The Budget Analyst's primary objective is to develop key program budgets, to provide analysis on business trends, and to monitor the program budget/expenses on a monthly basis. The Budget Analyst will report directly to the Controller and will work closely with a team of accountants and program managers.

Responsibilities
Analyze monthly departmental financial reports, investigate actual to budget variances, and communicate with managers/directors in order to maintain expenditure controls and forecast financial trends.
Assist in the development of the annual budgets and manage program-based, multi-year forecasts for expenditures and revenues.
Monitor and update program budgets within the agencys accounting software and funders online budget portal.
Provide support to the Director, Associate Director, Controller and/or Chief Financial Officer to assist with special studies that require data compilation; analyze and interpret information in oral and written presentations.
Utilize and ensure compliance with cost allocations across various funding streams in accordance with the OMB Uniform Guidance Regulations.
Be aware of and adhere to multiple contract budgets with their own specified individual requirements and parameters. Maintain confidentiality of information as appropriate.
Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities. Read applicable contract agreements to ensure all revenues and billable expenditures are maximized.
Contribute to departmental and organizational goals and mission by completing related tasks as needed.
Other tasks as assigned.
Requirements
Bachelors Degree in Accounting or related field required
3+ years accounting management and financial analysis experience
Familiarity with Intacct; and other accounting software packages
High level of proficiency with Excel.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The employee is occasionally required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually low to moderate.

Citadel is a full-service financial institution with products ranging from insurance and investments to money market and checking accounts. Our mission is to identify and meet our customers' needs through a full range of financial and insurance services, while maintaining financial safety and soundness. Our passion goes beyond merely meeting their banking needs. With every interaction we want to exceed their expectations, creating highly satisfied customers. At the heart of this is Citadel Class Service™, our pledge to keep the customer’s needs at the forefront each and every day.

Primary responsibility of the Service Desk Analyst is to provide first level telephone support and problem resolution for all Citadel Credit Union users of computer applications, hardware, peripherals and networks. This position ensures that all system processing related to the daily operations of the Credit Union’s products, services, infrastructure and critical applications are completed in an accurate, efficient, controlled and timely manner to insure 24x7 access to service delivery channels and information.

Essential Duties& Responsibilities:

~ Service Desk Support:
Answer incoming technical support phone calls; manage service desk ticket queue.
Provide technical assistance / support for desktops, laptops, servers, network connectivity, business applications and voice-over-IP telephone systems.
Apply problem-solving skills to resolve phone, email and“walk-in” Service Desk cases; analyze and troubleshoot problems and applies understanding of software and hardware products and services to resolve reported issues.
Determine severity, impact, and nature of reported issues.
Perform analytical analysis to troubleshoot reported issues.
Log all calls and activities accurately into the Service Desk application, including updates and status changes; abide by Incident Management outlined framework.
Follow up with internal and external resources in order to resolve open cases.
Document steps taken for troubleshooting and problem resolution to assist others with understanding what steps have already been taken.
Create documentation for future reference as it relates to resolving the call at point of contact.
Deliver high levels of customer service. Ensure Service Level Agreements are being met
Stay current on all new product releases so that client questions can be addressed appropriately.
Identify trends and communicate them to management so that the core problems can be resolved quickly.
Escalate issue to the next level when appropriate.
Comply with Information Systems Security Policy.
~ Support the daily operations of Citadel Federal Credit Union;
Work unsupervised to monitor and complete all batch processing, transaction processing and file; transfer activities as outlined on the procedural checklists.
Complete scheduled shift activities accurately and within times prescribed.
Work on call weekends and holidays to insure system accessibility.
Maintain processing checklists.
~ LAN/WAN Administration:
Complete daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly administrative checklists.
Maintain current and updated processing procedures schedules.
Install, configure and maintain software utilized on the network.
Install, configure and maintain desktop devices on the network.
Support desktop devices and servers attached to the wide area network.
Support the software systems utilized by Citadel Federal Credit Union.
~ Support and maintain Episys system software and hardware:
Have a thorough knowledge of job scheduling applications.
Have a thorough working knowledge of the Symitar Episys software.
Have a thorough understanding of Synergy cold storage and Synapsys CRM applications
Assist with system testing to support monthly and annual processes and system updates.
Perform periodic System Re orgs to optimize the overall efficiency of the system.
Test and deploy new workstations and printer devices utilized by the transactional systems.
Expectations:

~ Must be willing to be on call after hours.

Requirements
Working knowledge of SMA Operation Control (OpCon) job scheduling application preferred.
Working knowledge of Windows based network architectures and protocols.
MCSA Certification preferred
MCP/MTA Certification
Preferred - Previous Symitar Episys experience desired.\nMinimum two years experience in the Credit Union industry preferred.
Minimum one year experience in data processing environment.
1-3 years of previous experience with personal computers, information systems or related computer business experience required.
Competitors: TruMark Financial, North Island Credit Union, CommunityAmerica Credit Union

Are you looking for a challenging role as a Sr. Business Intelligence Developer? InterVision Systems is a strategic service provider committed to unlocking value by delivering innovative technology through a consultative approach. We believe we will transform businesses through the evolutionary power of technology. Our people are the best in their field!

If you are looking for a career changing opportunity, we want to meet you!

The Sr. BI Developer is responsible for analyzing data and reporting on trends and activities for various departments within the organization. This includes collecting, tracking, analyzing and disseminating information that provides support to a variety of stakeholders i.e. Finance, Sales, Operations, HR, Architecture, Engineering, PMO, Marketing, etc.

The Sr. BI Developer must be able to think critically to deliver existing performance analysis on trends and will make recommendations. They must be able to acquire data from multiple sources including Microsoft SQL and Postgres databases. They must be able to understand the data gathered from ERP, CRM, HR and other applications to create insightful reports, presented in a variety of formats for both internal and external customers. To be effective in this role, the candidate needs to be attentive to detail in a dynamic work environment, balancing multiple projects and work activities.

The role will assist in full life cycle analysis to include requirements, design and activities related to implementation of databases, data collection systems, reporting and presentation systems. You must be comfortable working with a variety of teams and be able to communicate succinctly with technical and non-technical departments. Strong communication, organization, documentation, and analytical skills are required to fulfill the duties expected of this position.

Do you have the Right Skills and Experience for our Team?
Bachelors or Associates Degree or equivalent experience.
At least five (5) years related experience and background in a data intelligence position in a multitasking environment, preferably within a technology or services environment
General knowledge of data assets, data requirements, and data reporting
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (PowerBI and Sql Server Reporting Services (SSRS), databases (Microsoft SQL (MSSQL), Postgres), SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) and similar applications
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience with ServiceNow, Salesforce, or Great Plains, a plus
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft office products required with advanced skills in Excel
Previous experience and understanding of technical service tickets preferred
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Organize and think through desired end to end outcome before starting a task
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and the ability to communicate with a range of customers
Ability to work in a high-pressure environment on non-repetitive tasks
Dependability excellent attendance record, follows instructions, responds to management direction and solicits feedback to improve performance
Must be extremely detailed oriented with exceptional focus on accuracy and quality output. Produces work that is accurate and thorough and monitors own work to ensure quality
Excellent organizational skills - ability to anticipate and prioritize daily workflow to effectively meet deadlines
Ability to tolerate peak workloads, multiple assignments and projects from multiple leaders, and produce results with accuracy and reliability. Ability to demonstrate a calm demeanor and retain composure in dynamic work environment
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced team environment with minimal supervision
Professional presence and demeanor; strong commitment to provide exceptional customer service
What GREAT things will you be doing?
Collaborate with managers to define reporting requirements
Design and develop core organization reports, working to improve the quality of information provided to both internal and external customers
Identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and clean data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to locate and correct issues and providing quality insurance of data
Create and Analyze reports and performance data to provide assessments of trends, and to identify and explain variances from goals and prior periods, and to identify indicators of possible performance issues or changes in future business activities from multiple sources
Collaborate, coordinate, and communicate across departments regarding data availability and the delivery of management reports
Increase effectiveness, accuracy, and speed of all reporting/analytics requirements by automating reporting requirements
Work closely with other teams in a team-oriented environment, but also able to function independently
Take ownership of projects and prioritize assignments
Train end users on new reports and dashboards
Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines
Performs other duties as assigned and required. Duties and responsibilities may change from time to time without notice and include, but are not limited to, the duties described above.
How Do We Back Our Strong Reputation?

GREAT PLACE TO WORK: If you thrive in an environment of growth and individual impact, InterVision is the place for you!

CUSTOMER SUCCESS: InterVision has worked with more than 5,000 clients across industry sectors to solve their biggest business challenges. Job Title: Quality Data Analyst - Clinical Effectiveness (Sepsis) - Full Time
Job Description:
El Camino Health is committed to hiring, retaining and growing the best and brightest professionals who will carry our mission and vision forward. We are proud of our reputation in the community: One built on compassion, innovation, collaboration and delivering high-quality care. Come join the team that makes this happen.

FTE

1

Scheduled Bi-Weekly Hours

80

Work Shift

Day: 8 hours

Job Description

The Quality Data Analyst supports clinical business decisions and operational processes through interaction with executive management and other key management staff. In partnership with leadership and physician key stakeholders, the Quality Data Analyst identifies and supports areas of analytical focus for the organization's quality of service, care delivery performance and evaluation of potential areas of opportunity and risk. Incorporating clinical best practices and interpreted data, the analyst produces both long-term and short-term activities and deliverables and defines innovative solutions that drive measurable benefits to the organization. The Quality Data Analyst creates analytical tools using an in depth understanding of healthcare data (e.g. patient, claims, financial, clinical and provider data) and operations coupled with the knowledge of large data set development and quantitative data analysis methodology.

Responsibilities

The Analyst leads special projects, lending data expertise and actionable insight

Develops exception reporting and conduct drill down analysis to proactively identify specific variances in practice patterns

Generates customized work products, presentable for content and audience Maintains strong attention to details and prioritizes workload while meeting deliverables and expectations

Works autonomously and collaboratively with report requestors, providing guidance to define report requirements and validate results

Works collaboratively across departments to understand and meet the organization's clinical quality analytic needs

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in a healthcare-related field, science/social sciences, mathematics/statistics, information technology, or public/business administration

Five (5)years' experience in a managed care, hospital, provider practice or similar setting

Five (5) years' experience in data systems

Proficiency with SQL, Access, Excel, reporting software, Business Objects, Epic Clarity, Epic Reporting Workbench, PowerPoint and healthcare transactional systems

Experience building partnerships and fostering trust with cross functional team members

Experience working with databases, large data sets, multiple data sources and interpreting complex data to create meaningful information

Experience managing projects, tasks, deadlines and discerning priorities while working within budget constraints

Exhibits critical thinking and problem solving skills
Required/preferred EPIC certification(s) are: Cogito - Fundamentals, Caboodle Data Model/Fundamentals, Clarity Data Model/Fundamentals, Clinical Data Model, SQL I, SQL II

The Physical Requirements and Working Conditions of this job are available. El Camino Health will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with a disability if that will allow them to perform the essential functions of a job unless doing so creates an undue hardship for the hospital, or causes a direct threat to these individuals or others in the workplace which cannot be eliminated by reasonable accommodation.

Sedentary Work - Duties performed mostly while sitting; walking and standing at times. Occasionally lift or carry up to 10 lbs. Uses hands and fingers. - (Physical Requirements-United States of America)

An Equal Opportunity Employer:
El Camino Health seeks and values a diverse workforce. The organization is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of qualifications and competencies. El Camino Health prohibits discrimination in employment based on race, ancestry, national origin, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, marital status, age, medical condition or any other status protected by law. In addition to state and federal law, El Camino Health also follows all applicable fair and equitable employment policies from the County of Santa Clara.

Overview


Aerojet Rocketdyne (AR) is seeking a Business Relationship Manager (BRM) to join our office in Sacramento, California.

In this individual contributor role, you will be part of the Shared Services Indirect Procurement (SSIP) organization and will be responsible for supporting other BRM’s in their day-to-day category management responsibilities. There are four primary categories: CapEx & Construction, Facilities & Site Services, Corporate & Professional Services and Information Technology Services. Support will vary depending upon project volume and workload within any one or more of the aforementioned categories. I

n this role you will serve primarily as the AR BRM to various AR stakeholders and secondarily as the liaison manager to third-party outsource providers during the delivery of SSIP services. Help drive teams to execute on contract terms and conditions and work with third-party category/delivery managers to ensure on-time delivery of projects and sourcing events.

This position may be filled at this level or one level higher.

Essential Job Functions (Including % of Time for Each)
Serves as the AR stakeholder liaison for Shared Services Indirect Procurement activities across CapEx & Construction, Facilities & Site Services, Corporate and Professional Services and Information Technology Services categories. (20%)
Performance Management: Works heavily with AR’s 3rd party outsource provider for all Shared Services Indirect Procurement activities, including Category Management, Sourcing and contract execution as well as other 3rd party outsource providers. Uses Service Level or Key Performance methodologies to track and analyze vendor performance, generate reports as required, provide operational oversight, assess and execute penalties or incentives per contract terms. Identify issues and opportunities and provide recommendations for performance improvement and when necessary implement action plans accordingly. (25%)
Contract Administration: Be the subject matter expert on contracts pertaining to outsourced 3rd party arrangement, including terms and conditions, financial provisions, roles and responsibilities and all supporting documents. Team lead in contract formulation, negotiations, and post-award change control. Using data driven analytics, evaluate and monitor contracts to ensure vendors comply with all contractual terms and conditions. Act as the liaison between AR Legal and vendors. Serve as an informal SME and on-the-job training resource for vendor delivery managers and/or AR stakeholder groups. (25%)
Relationship Management: Be a key participant in various category projects, provide status on supplier performance, and facilitate problem resolution activities. Establish strong partnerships with AR stakeholders to ensure effective planning and collaboration on appropriate vendor/contractual related matters. Effectively manage relationship with vendor account/delivery managers to ensure consistent service delivery and customer satisfaction. Facilitate communication and coordination of activities between AR stakeholders and vendor delivery managers and project teams. Coordinate vendor activities as they relate to customer initiatives, program enhancements and new implementations. Lead or be a key participant in problem resolution activities, utilizing a governance model as depicted in the contract(s). (25%)
Project Management: Be a key participant in Corporate and Professional Services category planning, provide status on supplier performance, and facilitate problem resolution activities. Lead or support cross-functional project teams to develop efficient processes aligned with long-term corporate goals. Adapt or create new and effective processes as necessary. Manage broad functional projects and/or participate as a contract SME on larger project or initiatives. (5%)
Requirements


Requires a Bachelor's degree in an appropriate discipline and three (3) years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

US Citizenship Only Required. Dual Citizenship does not meet job qualifications. Must be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. Security Clearance at the appropriate level.

Desired candidate should be proficient in Creating Purchase Requisitions and Material Receipts in Maestro (Oracle) system, P-Card administration, as well as have the ability to assist Buyers and Planners in completing Material transactions within Oracle.

Other Desired Qualifications:
Category Management experience in one or more of the following categories: CapEx & Construction, Facilities & Site Services, Corporate and Professional Services or Information Technology Services is preferred.
Experience in a in a 3rd party outsourcing function that included accountability for complex tasks and/or projects required for successful execution is preferred.
Demonstrated skills in contract formulation.
Prior experience in negotiating and analyzing contracts along with knowledge of vendor performance metrics preferred.
Ability to influence others and be a key contributor or leader on all category specific project teams.
Contract negotiation and excellent written/verbal communication skills.
Strong presentation, organizational, interpersonal communication, and analytical skills required.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Word, PowerPoint and Excel; knowledge of other Microsoft Office products.
Work Environment/Physical Requirements:

Employees in these positions must possess mobility to work in a standard office setting and to use standard office equipment, including a computer; stamina to sit and to maintain attention to detail despite interruptions; may occasionally lift/carry/push/pull up to 15 pounds; may require minimal walking, climbing, stooping, crouching, and/or bending; and vision to read printed materials and a computer screen, and hearing and speech to communicate in person and over the telephone. May require the ability to travel by air or auto. May require the use of personal protective equipment such as safety glasses, safety shoes, and shop coat. These positions may be expected to work varying shifts and hours to ensure successful operation of activities in the organization.

Market monitoring is responsible for protecting both consumers and market participants by identifying and reporting market design issues, market manipulation, and evaluating market performance. In fulfilling this role, we rely on a multidisciplinary team with expertise in economics, financial analysis, engineering, data science and law.


How You Will Make an Impact

Routine monitoring of market outcomes and participant behavior, and performing in-depth empirical analysis of market performance and efficiency. Apply economic principles to practical and challenging electricity market issues. Work with large and complex data, and develop a detailed understanding of wholesale electricity market mechanics and the interactions between markets.

• Market Surveillance

• Continuously track market outcomes, identify and explain trends and outliers

• Design, develop and run screening tools to identify market performance issues, non-compliance with market rules and uncompetitive behavior

• Identify and source relevant data through research and proactive engagement with colleagues

• Build data queries and analysis in a programming language

• Economic Analysis

• Scope and perform empirical analysis of market performance, market efficiency and behavior

• Evaluate current and new market rules changes and recommend enhancements

• Reporting

• Present complex and technical content to a diverse audience through written reports and presentations

• Write clear and insightful content, collaborate with colleagues to make connections between report sections

• Investigations

• Identify market outcomes and market participant behavior that warrants further investigation and analysis

• Conduct investigations and make referrals to the federal energy regulator


What We Are Looking For

• Master’s Degree in Economics or Finance.

• Strong quantitative skills with emphasis on analysis using SAS or similar programming language.

• Experience working with very large and complex data sets desirable.

• Ability to conduct forensic-like investigations of market outcomes and participant behavior.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to communicate complex findings and ideas, in plain language, at an executive, board member or regulator level.

• Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment.

• Ability to change direction quickly in response to changing information, priorities, policies, rules or the results of an analysis.

• Proactively seek clarification of requirements and direction; take responsibility when needed.

The position is open to qualified candidates at various levels, ranging from Associate to Senior Analyst. The level depends on a number of considerations, including, but not limited to:
• experience in a similar role

• technical proficiency

• academic background

• ability to manage and lead projects

• ability to mentor analysts, and

• level of communication and interpersonal skills.

ISO New England oversees the 24/7 operation of the power grid that covers the six-states of New England and administers the region’s $10+ billion “stock exchange” for the buying and selling of wholesale electricity. The power system is constantly evolving as new technologies emerge and energy policies evolve. There is a lot going on at our organization behind the scenes to make sure the grid continuously yields reliable electricity at competitive prices while addressing the unique challenges that come along with our industry.

What We Offer: ISO New England is located in Holyoke, MA. The company provides a base salary plus bonus, competitive Medical and Dental plan, paid vacation, 401k with company match, retirement plan and more. All benefits start on your first day.

Director of Business Intelligence

TwinStar Credit Union is seeking a Director of Business Intelligence to join our team! The Director of Business Intelligence is responsible for the vision, leadership and strategic direction of credit union's business intelligence systems and tools for structuring, organizing, storing, retrieving, analyzing and reporting data. This position is responsible for managing and overseeing the day-to-day operations and employees in the Business Intelligence Department.

You must have a minimum of 5 years of relevant professional experience with 3+ years of data analytics, data science, or business intelligence experience. Tableau experience is highly preferred.

Essential Functions and Tasks
Bring people together; partner with business leaders, managers, and analysts in order to coordinate business processes, analyze efforts, and develop methods for capturing and maintaining shared business data and analytics work products to promote reuse by multiple stakeholders.
Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, Finance, Operations, Branching, and Member Experience teams to develop and maintain an enterprise-wide information model that contains current and future data requirements for internal and external customers.
Research industry trends, business practices, data sources and develop recommendations to meet future business needs. Envision future uses of data and work with impacted departments regarding what enterprise-wide information should be captured, where it is maintained and who should have access.
Develop and maintain an in-depth knowledge of corporate strategies, business operations, information requirements, and priorities. Provide consultative advice to the business on tools, best practice and vendor activities in the Analytics arena.
Implement Business Intelligence governance for the organization, and establish data communities and drive consensus around metric standardization at TwinStar.
Establish long-term and short-term priorities for enterprise-wide analytics and business intelligence deployment.
Drive integration platform, data warehouse, and reporting tools standards and drive standards around data management, data quality, and stewardship.
Identify new sources of data and transform it into actionable information that brings value to the credit union. Improve the quality of reporting by creating easy to follow weekly or monthly dashboards that key stakeholders will utilize to make informed business decisions.
Sets daily example and drives a team environment in the utilization of our core values. Empowers members of the BI team to grow their skillset and to advance their career goals.
Assist team members in building datasets and visualizations to help advance team goals forward.
Demonstrates highest levels of customer service, confidentiality and discretion when dealing with the internal and external members.
Actively participates in individual and team development programs and or conferences.
Develops, plans and schedules for the efficient use of materials, resources and employees resulting in outstanding service-delivery.
Manages and supervises assigned employees according to established credit union procedures and applicable State and Federal laws.
Resolves employee problems and performance issues. Provides support and suggestions in regards to operational issues for employee development or performance improvement. Prepares disciplinary write-ups with approval from Human Resources. Prepares employee performance (90 day and annual) appraisals. Makes recommendations for termination to Human Resources and their manager, director of chief.
Conducts employment interviews and makes hiring decisions or recommendations as authorized by their manager.
Communicates creation of/or updated changes to the credit unions processes, policies/procedures and/or other pertinent information; either immediately or through scheduled staff meetings.
Assists direct reports with complex transactions and escalated member service issues. Resolves or makes decisions related to the service and operational functions of the department as authorized by their manager and credit union procedures.
Ensures department operations are in compliance with all security, audit, regulatory compliance, information security, customer privacy, and Bank Secrecy Act/Customer Identification Program policies and procedures.
Works with their manager in developing short and long-term goals and plans for the branch/department.
Works with their manager to prepare budget forecasts and/or requests.
Education Requirements and Preferences:

Required:
Bachelors Degree in computer science, data science, data analytics, or related field
OR 8+ years of demonstrated professional experience with data analytics
Preferred:
Masters degree in CS or MBA preferred
Data Analytics or Business Intelligence Certifications
Job Experience Requirements and Preferences:

Required:
5-8 + years of relevant professional experience
3+ years of data analytics, data science, or business intelligence experience
Experience with analytical platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, etc.
Preferred:
10 + years of relevant professional experience
5+ years of data analytics experience
3+ years supervisory or managerial experience
Tableau experience a plus

You've probably heard that credit unions are different than banks, but what is it exactly? The big difference is you!
